text:
I went here on a whim last night for a date and couldn't have been more pleasantly surprised! From the minute we walked in, it felt as though we had been transported to some beautiful California coastal spot. 
The food was amazing and the service was awesome! We got to meet one of the managers named Doug and he was such a blast to talk to! 

Pros: 

- the ambiance was incredible, felt like you were in a coastal home enjoying a home cooked meal.

- the food was delicious. I come from a family that cooks Mexican food almost every meal and it was fresh, tasty, and beautifully plated.

- the servers were quick on refills of drinks, chips, and salsas. Super friendly and accommodating. 

- Doug was so friendly and really made us feel at home. We are coming back specifically because of him!

- the live music was just loud enough to hear, but never overwhelming. 

- all in all, such a great experience. I can't say enough about how much I enjoyed this place! I have already recommended it to everyone I work with. 

Cons: 

- my only con is that they close pretty early. I felt guilty still eating almost half an hour after they closed.

I hope nothing but the best for this place, and I will be back again VERY soon!!

Came in for dinner with my family on a Wednesday evening. The food was delicious and very generous quantities. And our server Miguel was one of the best servers I've ever had. So polite and attentive without being a hoverer. Will definitely come back

We had Sunday Brunch at Pancho's.  The hostess offered both the dinner menu and the brunch menu.  We decided to have brunch.  The brunch is supposed to come with fresh fruit and champagne, neither was offered to us by the waiter.  I had to ask about the fruit and it was brought out towards the end of the meal rather than a starter.  Never offered champagne.  Then I asked about the bunuelos  which are also included with brunch.  Waiter came back with flan because they did not have any more bunuelos.  When the check came, my order was charged $3.00 more than the price on the menu!!!  Very disappointed Pancho's.

Sadly the only thing I enjoyed was the ambiance and the chips and salsa. Lack of service since I waited almost 10 min for my meal while my boyfriend already had his. And mine was just soup. The waiter came to ask how everything was and didn't notice I was missing my food until we mentioned it . The food didn't really have much flavor and i guess I just expected more from my experience as this place was over priced to begin with.  Sad to be disappointed the look of this place really intrigued me.
The carne assada was tender and moist.  The food is typically ok, not wild about it but an overall good experience.

I went there for lunch on a Tuesday and it wasn't crowded as it was taco Tuesday. Surprised! We had a coupon and glad I did. The combination plates are large in portions  but the food was tasteless. The chips were the best part. My chicken tamale was dry and tasteless and the rice wasn't good. Will not go back. Pretty restaurant- 5 stars for atmosphere.

Great food! First time I was here the waiter was informative about their social nights. The following experience was not so great. The waitress dropped the ice cold water on me, apologized but left and didn't come back. Had to wait until I got another waitress attention in order to get help. Smh...

The ambiance of this place was great! (The only great thing about this place.)The service was terrible (we waited 15 minutes before our server even took our drink order)! The food was average at the very best and extremely overpriced. Small family of 4 with two kids meals and a taco salad and burrito was $80! No alcohol no appetizers. Not worth it. Likely won't be back.

I had a enchilada del sol. But this one was filled with crab meat instead of shrimp. My first bite was unbelievable. The sauce was unbelievable. One thing I would suggest. Do not have it with the sour cream on it. It takes away from the sauce. I also had the tortilla soup. This was all so tasty.

Service was great.  We got to the restaurant and it was half empty. Told it was a 1 hour wait.  We we to the bar and was given a table in 15 minutes.  The guacamole was $ 17.00.   Queso Fundio was  $18.00. Way over priced 
The drinks in the restaurant were more expensive than in the bar.  Food was ok not great and very overpriced. This restaurant was so expensive to build and their overhead is so high they gouge the customer.  There is better in town for less money.

Went on Monday for lunch, wasn't impressed with the food itself especially for its cost. I was expecting a phenomenal dish but was left disappointed due to its lack of flavor and texture. The only reason I give this place four stars is because of the service, my server David was awesome, he followed up with me and I could really see he cared about my experience. Although the service was great, I may not come back until I hear they have an improved menu or are under management that cares about the food they are trying to sell.

Extremely slow service - very pricey- food was tasty. Will not return unless prices become more in line with surrounding Mexican restaurants. Try Frank & Finas or Flaming Fajitas. More reasonable comparable food.
Food and atmosphere is excellent more than enough to eat just a little pricey a little pricey but well worth it servers and waiter do a great job they know their product

Stopped in for lunch have been waiting to try it out. its right down the street from my work and from my house. it needs a lot of improvement with service but the food was really good a little bit pricey.  But they need to work on their bar area only high to bars.  Doc has restricted me from using my right foot so can't stretch it to sit at the bar tops in the bar the hostesses wooden honor the prices for happy hour for a bar only and weren't really accommodating finally the manager came over and said that he was aware of our situations and still honor the price. 

So management=great 
hostess = horrible service 
server he apologize they're still new but we got our water after our meals and we had to ask for chips and salsa and someone had mentioned that you get fruit but we never got.

Willing to try again in 6 months if they last.
Atmosphere is great, but food is most definitely overpriced! Even the appetizer pricing was ridiculous. Would be happy to spend $$$$ if the food was actually worth it.

I REALLY wanted to like Pancho's. We have always had a great experience at the Manhattan Beach location and loved going there. It has been several years since we have been back but at this location prices seemed a bit high even given the location. 

The first negative sign was when we nearly finished our chips and salsa before our order was even taken. The second negative was when I ordered the chicken tortilla soup and never received it. After our main entrees arrived I mentioned this to our server and he apologized and later gave an additional discount which was very nice. The last negative was food quality. Let's be honest, most Mexican sit downs seem to taste the same unless they have a signature stand out dish/item, or the style of cooking/preparation is different. Pancho's was no different. There was nothing about their food that justified the price point. 

Unfortunately,  we didn't even stay to use  the Yelp fried ice cream offer. We paid and left. However, I had the last laugh and ordered a second helping of the free chips and salsa...

Very disappointed-service was slow.  It took a long time for our guacamole which was unfortunately inedible because somebody dumped so much salt in it. The chips were not crisp but still managed to be greasy and slightly bitter. We ordered a vegetarian tostada not noticing that the dish had no beans included in it. So the dish only had rice and greasy veggies spiced in an unappetizing way.  The waiter told us that the rice is cooked in chicken broth which is a no-no for true vegetarians. We went away hungry after paying quite a bit.  We will not be back.

This place has such potential but is sadly disappointing. The restaurant is visually appealing and was beautifully decorated for Christmas. Our server was just friendly enough but was not overly attentive given that we were one of the few tables in the whole restaurant. We felt that the food should have been more than mediocre for the price. Kids plates are $10 and adult plate average around $20. My husband and I ordered signature dishes since they all had enticing descriptions on the menu. The food was beautifully presented and the serving size was more than adequate but the taste failed to live up to expectations. This is not a place I would recommend due to the high price for lackluster food.

Pancho's is a beautiful place, and the service wasn't bad, however, the food was just OK, but pricey, so probably wouldn't go back anytime soon.  Waitress did say that some bigwigs from CA were there working on the menu, and some positive changes should be made in the next few months.  I'll watch Yelp to determine when and if I'll be back.

Food was excellent and service was better. My wife, 2 kids and myself were all impressed with her service. Lovely ambiance of authentic Mexico. Martha definitely made our night with her great attitude.
Loved the food, yet pricey for Mexican food in Las Vegas.  Also, they need to make the soda drinks much larger.  We will be back.  We had no alcohol and are lunch bill was $49 before a tip.
Service was beyond bad.no water refills. .app..took over 35 min. for queso fundido..food over priced...and food was mediocre at best. .sorry won't be back...
Yeah entrees might be $5 too high but the food was very good and the manager was extremely nice. He stop by again afterwards to make sure everything was fine.

I just don't see how this place is going to last.  The prices are just too high for the quality of food provided. The only reason I went was because of the happy hour half off appetizers and discounted drinks.   

The chips were cold and seemed like the type of cheap chips you'd get at a grocery store.   And the salsa was completely uninspiring -- typical boring, tasteless, spiceless garden salsa that could've easily come from a grocery store bottle.  I asked if they had a hotter, habanero type salsa -- and was provided with habanero Tabasco sauce (I like Tabasco sauce, but not exactly what I was looking for)

Tried the naughty maggie Margarita.   Found it to be no more interesting than a standard Margarita. 

My main dish was the queso fundido appetizer (it was just me, so the large appetizer was a full meal).  Well, it looked nothing like what I'm used to seeing with queso fundido at other Mexican restaurants.... looked more like a plate of sour cream. Flavor was okay but not something I would order again. .. and had I paid the usual full $16 price for this appetizer, I would've been very disappointed...instead of just moderately disappointed.  

When the check arrived,  the happy hour discount amount for what I ordered was incorrect so that had to be fixed.  But it actually couldn't be fixed and instead I had to be given an additional dollar off (so double check the pricing for those going for the happy hours deals).  And I was charged the full price on the Margarita because apparently that was not part of the happy hour special discounted drinks (something that was not clearly explained by my waitress when I ordered.... even though I had expressly asked her about the drink specials just before I ordered it -- so she clearly knew where my head was at and allowed me to order the non-discounted drink instead ..... a little bit deceptive if you ask me).  

I'm sorry to say but there is just nothing good to report about this place. I hope the restaurant that takes over this place after they inevitably close does a complete overhaul.   I had high hopes for this place,  but having gotten a small bad taste, there is simply no reason for me to ever come back and try anything else.

If Yelp allowed for zero stars, that would've been my rating.

Would someone please message me and tell me where I can get some decent very spicy, but smooth salsa in this city!!  Is that too much to ask for?

Really good  mexican  restaurant.  Mexican restaurants  aren't  really the most fresh as far as I've  experienced  them.  This one is pretty  good. 

Definitely  not cheap. A little  over priced  actually  but its probably  the best mexican restaurant  in town. 

Great costumer  service.  The best actually.  Just a little too expensive.
This beautiful place should offer better quality food if they want to survive in Las Vegas! Servings are skimpy and overpriced.

We went to the Sunday brunch using a coupon we got in our snail mail. Everything was very good. The atmosphere was festive and our server, Cesar, rates as one top servers we've had.  We  had the tacos al pastor plate and the artichoke/avocado enchiladas - both were delicious. Check the prices before you go to see if you think they're  too high. With the coupon, we were fine with the bill.
I felt the food was fair, in taste and in quality.., but they were EXTREMELY over priced, two people, two drinks, two dinners......eighty bucks, geez Louise, it's beans and rice, not prime rib!
This is my new favorite Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas. Chicken Enchiladas Suiza were excellent. Been here twice in a week!!

Just leaving Pancho's for my best friends birthday and from the moment we entered until the time we left our experience was amazing. The customer service is empecable the great food matches the service. Our server Miguel is great he gave us wonderful service I'd most definitely be coming back. The ambiance of the restaurant is exactly what it should be amazing and litteraly every employee here made sure we were ok. Try the Burrito Del Mar. Like Miguel said it is "The bomb". Keep up the great work Mi hermanos over at Pancho's.
did not have a good experience there. no team work had to get find someone to give me my check so i could leave

Second time we've been here in the last month! The food is delicious (highly recommend the Salmon,  it's perfectly cooked with great seasoning), the staff is patient and attentive as well as quick. Food came out quickly as well. Our server was Jose (both  times!) and he's great at what he does. Would consistently check on us for drink refills and to see if we liked our meals. Management  also checked in on us several times throughout our meal. Young man assisting our waiter also checked on us several times and asked if we needed take out containers before we even had to request them. Overall, outstanding food, service, and experience!!!


Highly recommend this place! Fun environment for kids as well.

So this is going to be a weird review.. the first time I went to this place was this past Memorial Day and it was delicious! the red salsa with the chips was fresh and spicy, I ordered the taquitos dorados and it was the best taquitos I have ever had, the meat was perfectly seasoned, the taquitos were nicely filled and the green salsa was to diiiiieeee for. The ambiance was fun and the service was great.  I couldn't wait to take my husband there especially since he tasted my leftovers and LOVED it so we went the next day... yes, the very next day. Which where this rating comes in... the food tasted NOTHING like the day before.. the salsa was watery and weak. The taquitos were bland and the green salsa was... flavorless. The service was still great but the food was such a disappointment. Upside is that they are true to their word, they make everything fresh. Downside, their chefs are very inconsistent so much so that I will never eat at Pancho's again. Why? because you should never have to pay that much money for disappointing food.

I had the mole verde which was suppose to be the chef's specialty, but it was disappointing because they didn't cook the chicken with the mole.  

The prices were a little high for things like tacos ($20+) for 2.  

Pros were the fajitas and guacamole were great.

Checked out Pancho's in DTS for the first time. Sat in the bar to watch the game and have a few appetizers. Decor and atmosphere are very nice.  Service was okay. Drinks were good. Food was average. Prices are ridiculously high for what you get. Well over $40 for two drinks and one average chicken quesadilla!  Could have gone to Mercadito in Red Rock for the same money and had a much better culinary experience.  Sorry Pancho, but I was hoping for better.

So today I experienced Pancho's for the first time. I walked in with our party and was treated to live guitar music from the bar area stage. Nice way to set the mood. Short wait then our party of 16 was seated. Chips were average, while warm, still tasted commercial grade not fresh. Salsa was meh, no heat at all. Once again, commercial grade. But the wait staff did replenish them in a timely fashion. I ordered a Blue Ribbon Margarita. It came out in a basic margarita glass you find in any Mexican restaurant, salt on the rim etc, plenty of ice. Took a sip and it was room temp.. If a margarita is on the rocks, shouldn't it be shaken? I decided to let it chill, so it could chill. The margarita was like the glass, basic. As I looked at the menu the Enchiladas de Langosta (Lobster) stuck out to me. Seemed like a winner so I ordered it. Salad came first with the Pancho's vinaigrette, nothing special, red and green leaf lettuce, tomatoes, and chickpeas (I believe). Nothing spectacular, middle of the road as far as salads go. We didn't have to wait terribly long for our food to come out even at peak time (6 p.m.). My entree came out a fish shaped plate... different but I guess it distinguishes seafood entrees. Took a bite of the "special" green rice first, undercooked and bland. Then took a bite of my enchilada, tasted ok as did the black beans. Took another bite with the sour cream, and guac. Took a third bite with the sour cream and guac where I could really distinguish the lobster. After this bite I took a long pause, I could feel a slight wave of nausea wash over me. I was puzzled as to why this was happening. I sat for a second to see if the feeling would pass, it didn't. I asked a waiter for the restroom and proceeded there. Handicap stall, in use, regular stall FILTHY, and added to my nausea. Waited a few min for the feeling to pass, went back to my table. I sat back down after a few minutes and engaged in casual conversation. I decided to try my meal again. This time I scraped off the sour cream and guac and dug through the enchilada to just get a piece of lobster by itself. 1-2 minutes after I ingested it, I got felt that familiar uneasiness from my stomach. Im convinced the lobster or the sour cream was the culprit. I gave up on my meal and ordered a Sprite. The Sprite helped somewhat but I still felt uneasy and ventured again to the restroom. Light was off when I entered, regular stall, still FILTHY. The handicap stall was still locked and I then realized that it was not in use the first time, but locked from the inside. I assume this was for a reason and cringed at the potential horrors it could have contained. I sweated it out for a few minutes at the sink, and was able to keep my composure. At this point I gave up on Pancho's, and decided for my gastro intestinal well being to cut my losses. I texted a coworker to let my boss know I was leaving as I wasn't feeling well. I drove home swiftly, immediately grabbed a ginger ale to settle my stomach and aid me in completing this review while the memory was still fresh, which is more than I can say for my meal. Pancho's.. First time, last time, no time. There are better options out there.

Overpriced for the food. It was decent. The decor was fine. Service was good. However, not mind blown on the food considering the prices. And the one disappointment for the night....no horchata at this Mexican Restaurant. Say what?!?!?! Bummer.
Yummy yummy margarita. Little pricy but got a free fried ice cream with checkin. Had the enchilada trio. Well worth it.

Beautifully designed restaurant inside and out. The Margaritas are the best! They are very tasty and strong! I had the Naughty Maggy (Cadillac Margarita) and a Mango on the rocks, both so good. To eat, I had the Anna's Pollo. It is a chicken dish, I wish I would of taken pictures but it was too good. Overall experience was great. Good food, good drinks, amazing ambiance!!

This restaurant is not worth your time.  The service was horrible.  The waiter never came back to see if everything was or ok.  Never refilled a soda? chips? salsa? asked if you needed anything?  The manager  dropped by the table wrote of the cost of the sodas we ordered Big deal!.  The manager said he would write off on one entre instead just wrote off the sodas.Don't waste your time!!

Haven't found a good Authentic Mexican restaurant until we tried Pancho's. The surroundings felt welcoming and homey. The staff were very friendly and service we good.   
Prices were moderate to high, but it pays off with the large servings and tasty food. 
I've tried other restaurants, but this place has to be by far the most authentic. Rice and beans define the authenticity of this restaurant. Simple and full of flavor.  Not to much going on.. but its a must order.

Went here with my family last weekend. We were told the wait was about 45 minutes but we were seated within 20. The atmosphere was great! The decor made you feel like you were eating in an outdoor garden even though you were inside.  I love that they give you a bowl of fruit to start out with.  Our server was very helpful and they were very quick. The appetizer sampler was great as well as the nachos. Can't wait to go again.
Don't order the "queso fundido"! it's straight up cream cheese and if your lucky a crumb of artichoke. Atmosphere is cool, live music was worth the bill.

Really enjoy the atmosphere of this restaurant!  It's beautiful and very lively!  The meals I've had here were excellent and reasonably priced.  This Mexican restaurant is high on my list of favorites!
Great service in the bar and amazing food. Our server Jason was the best. Went out of his way to make sure everything was perfect even though he was extremely busy.  Definitely coming back.

We went for Sunday Brunch, and we really enjoyed the lovely ambiance, great service, & food & drinks... The bar was crowded watching football & a lively upbeat vibe... As the designated driver I did not have any margaritas but everyone else did & enjoyed quite a variety... Excellent service...

Quite possibly the worst 'Mexican' food I have ever had.  I have traveled all over Mexico - even lived in Oaxaca for the better part of a year - and I have never seen anything like this there!  I think it's an attempt at 'Tex-Mex,' that horrible sauce laden aberration that comes from the land of George W. Bush.  I had a chili-relleno and a cheese enchilada.  Of course, both were drowning in the same horrible red sauce (thank you, Texas) but the cheese was strictly American and the Chili was barely cooked.  It was so crunchy, it bordered on raw.  What once may have existed as an eggy batter was musched up with that gross sauce, I mean:  just disgusting!  Anyone claiming that this is 'Authentic' should be flogged.  The only Latino faces in the place belonged to the servers who, I am sure, were secretly apologizing every time they lay down a plate.  The price is as bad as the food - at least 30% more than it should be if not 50%.  $7.50 for a glass of Dos XX in the middle of Sunday afternoon?  Puleeeeeze!!!  Adios, muchachos, dios te bendiga and all that.  Avoid this one like Montezuma's Revenge!

Cute atmosphere and people watching overlooking the bar but the prices were ridiculously high - $14.95 for guacamole? $18.95 for an enchilada/taco combination plate. And the food was average - nowhere near justifying the high prices. Service was very friendly and the vibe is fun but we won't be back.

Went on a busy Friday night and service was excellent.  The staff was very attentive.  Prices are really high. $15 guacamole that was lacking flavor and $14 chicken and bean burrito with no sides.  Burrito had great flavor but something really upset my stomach.  A friend also went on a different night and 2 people from her dinner party got sick.

Save time and your money and don't eat here. As many other reviews state, the atmosphere and decor is very good. They definitely hit the mark there but that is where it ends.

We came on a Sunday around 1:00. They had a brunch menu in addition to a dinner menu. Huge selection of entrees on the dinner menu, all ranging from 17.95 and up. The four adults in our party all agreed that there wasn't anything special about the food. I had a chimichunga and the chicken was super dry and the shell was over fried. Rice, no Bueno. The menu also stars at the bottom 10.95 minimum per person. Seriously!  Not sure if they would have enforced it. 

They brought some of our drinks in plastic cups. For $18/person you ought to be able to put the drink in a glass. 

Kids meals were $10 each as well. Fine if you don't want to cater to kids but seriously. My son had a pizza and before you say it... yes, don't order pizza at a Mexican restaurant.

It's all about the taste and quality of the food. I will pay $30 for a $30 steak. I will pay more if I am in a casino or high tourist area. I expect quality if I am going to pay this much and this place failed miserably.

We have always loved Panchos.  The food and service is always 5 star. I never leave reviews though. This time the service was so exceptional I can not help by leave a review. Alfredo was our waiter and he was absolutely incredible. The best service we have had in Las Vegas and we have lived here for 9 years. We will come back to Panchos and we will be asking for Alfredo! Thank you ALFREDO!! Your the best!

First time customer. My date and I only went to the bar for Happy Hour and found out it was Taco Tuesday , they were only $2.50 each which were very good. We each had a house Margarita and they was also very good. The other items on the menu looked to be a bit expensive, but didn't try any so I could not comment about them. The chips and salsa were excellent and the service was great. Our bar tender was Kelly and she was a lot of fun to chat with. I will go back again and try an entr√©e.

1st off I would like to say just like many people the venue is beautiful! Very authentic Real plants! Beautiful colors in the restrooms! The wood work omg. It reminds me so much of home! Just gorgeous you guys really did a great job. 

If yelp had another category on venue you  would score a 5++++ 

The food on the other side was a disappointment, really once I walkin I fell in love with the ambiance. During our meal I was still wanted to find reasons to go back! 

Sadly we won't. 
 *The chips and salsa were good portions the salsa, taste and looks like the the Tostitos salsa from Costco and the chips are not consistent half of them stale half of them good.
* Order a appetizer fried taquitos flavorful but odd to serve with Verde tomatillo sauce. Weird it wasn't spicy I guess it was for dipping didn't think it needed. Chichen was moist beef was ok.
*They don't offer agua Fresca's only soda product not house made lemonade.
*The abondigas soup broth was too thick the meatball itself was very flavorful and traditional but the broth and vegetables lacked seasoning.
* ordered Lobster enchiladas they came with black beans green rice the green rice was blend no salt not sure if it was supposed to be cilantro rice enchiladas were okay black beans  good.
* Then ordered chicken green mole was horrible so much cumin and bland. Accompanied with red rice and pinto beans the rice and beans were the best part of the whole meal.
This is not an authentic Mexican style restaurant it caters more to the American palette, the has no indication of what real Mexican food should taste like.

In summerlin people act like they have money. The prices didn't bother me as much as the food is not worth the price. If the food was outstanding I wouldn't mind paying for great food and the amazing atmosphere the venue has. 

The service staff on the other hand was very polite very cordial very helpful. Service staff was great so they get a a 5-star! :)

My husband and I went in Sunday at 3 for a late lunch. We're always excited about a new Mexican restaurant and we love downtown Summerlin. The party in front of us left after speaking to the hostess, we were then told the wait was at least 1 1/2 hours. I could understand this with a newly opened restaurant but there were many open tables in the dining area and only 1 small party waiting in lobby area. If they are short staffing so soon after opening shame on them. Two other  parties left after being told the same thing. Not a good first impression, we will not waste our time again!

Came in to try this amazing looking Mexican restaurant . Walked in and was seated immediately. After we sat down , we all looked at each other in total shock . The prices here are way ! Over the top ! 19.99 for 2 tacos and rice and beans ? I looked over at the table next to us and asked them how they liked the food . They responded " Food was ok , small portions and they didn't realize how expensive the meals cost and said they will only come back for special occasions . So after the 4 of us looked at the menu .. We all decided to leave and go to macayos . The total bill at macayos was 65 bucks including 4 beers . We figured at "Panchos" the same meal would have been over 125 with out the tip . I really want to like "Panchos" but I can't see my self paying 19.99 for rice and beans and 2 tacos . Hopefully they will realize that there prices are not for the local budget and they are as much as the Las Vegas strip . This is only my opinion and I do hope to return some day . I give it 5 stars for the decor 
And the atmosphere . I'm pretty sure it cost a pretty penny to build this place . But that's not a reason to charge so much for Mexican food .
Food was pretty bland. Service was very nice though and the atmosphere is good too. Don't know if I would return for anything specific, but this place is close to my house so that's convenient.

I typically am not the one to leave reviews but after reading some of these 1 star comments, I feel inclined to share my opinions.

My experience at Pancho's was spectacular! It was just what I was looking for to start my weekend after a very long Friday at work. When I walked in, I felt as if I was transported to the middle of a Mexican jungle, instantly all my work stress was left at the door. The lush greenery, authentic aztec/mayan relics, stained glass windows, and beautiful water fountain created a very calming and soothing ambiance, in what was still a very busy restaurant. The wait time was brief. When I got my table, I ended up getting seated upstair. This was great because I received a wonderful view of the entire restaurant. Sitting upstair you could really get an expansive view of all the detail that went into designing this restaurant.

As soon as I sat down, I was greeted with warm chips and delicious salsa. The waiter was extremely professional and instantly introduced himself. He asked if we had been here before and then began to give us the story of Pancho's. Very interesting story, I had no idea the history and tradition of this place that dates all the way back to 1945 in Southern California. 

The menu at Pancho's is extensive. They serve classic items like a combination plate but I suggest exploring one of the many authentic dishes they have to offer. In particular their seafood section! I ended up going with Enchiladas de Langosta however the Shrimp Diabla Puffy Tacos did catch my eye. While I waited for my dinner, I ordered a Naughty Maggie Margarita (A MUST ORDER AFTER A LONG WEEK OF WORK)! This was one of the best margaritas I have had in Nevada, 3 or 4 of these and you are in for quite the night. As I finished off my chips and salsa I was quickly replenished with more before I could even ask, love this type of service! Especially when the chips and salsa are this tasty. When I received my meal, it was fresh out of the oven, the cheese was still bubbling and I was warned of the hot plate. These enchiladas were excellent, the lobster was cooked and seasoned nicely and the chipotle cream sauce stole the show. It was accompanied with delicious rice and beans. Very large portions, I was extremely full and I highly recommend this dish. 

After enjoying my dinner, I got up and headed downstairs to the bar. When I walked into the bar, I was excited to see the ample amounts of space and TVs. I sat at the bar and ordered another Naughty Maggie Margarita which was of course accompanied with some more chips and salsa! I thought I was full but ended up finding some extra room for them...I guess they were that good! The bar was perfect, comfy seating, great margs, beautiful women, and lots of sports.

As the games were ending, I noticed that a band was setting up. At this point, I was ready to leave but wanted to know what was going on. The manager, Abbott (very nice guy), informed me that there is live entertainment 7 days a week. He told me, the entertainment consist of comedy, karaoke, and live music depending on the night. I was thrilled as I knew this would be my next date spot, I mean who does not like live entertainment and strong drinks! I ended up staying to hear a few songs from the band. Classic rock cover songs, yes please!!!! 

I highly recommend Pancho's for any occasion and definitely suggest checking it out for yourself. The atmosphere alone is worth the trip!
Great Mexican Food!! Huge menu, friendly staff, great server Cynthia, the manager went up to every table to check on them. Great margaritas as well. We'll definitely be back.

Can't say enough, it's our "go to" place for THE best nachos around. Service is great, people are so friendly AND always inquiring about our satisfaction, and where do they get those fries? A must have!

Was there for a quick lunch Saturday after noon, the place was packed since the had just open a few days prior.
Sat at the bar and ordered a steak burrito that looked more like a quesadilla (flat) due to the lack of meat in it.
As I was eating my rice I saw what appeared to be a piece of chicken, bone included in my rice!!
How do you not see a whole piece of chicken going in the rice??
The GM came and had s full operations discussion with the owner sitting next to me 
Right over my shoulder, literally inches from ear.
Long story short the good was bad and expensive 
One burrito and one Arnold Palmer $25.00
Not dinner, lunch

Bad service. We asked repeatedly to turn down the music, even to the manager. They did for around two minutes, and turned it up again. Does the manager not have control of his staff? When our food came, half was either cold or messed up. The food is expensive for what you get.

This place is so nicely decorated. If you're going for old Mexican style decor and not for taste in food you're in the right place. 
Chips and salsa were okay. Not the greatest! And so goes for the rest of their food. I found it to be bland and the only other taste was overly salty meat. 
It's a shame, cute atmosphere terribly expensive food! 
They need to hire people that can cook. Hopefully they will get it together. 
Won't be returning for now until I hear more reviews on food improvement. 
Sorry Panchos, you gave us nothing but a punch in the stomach.

Very nice ambiance.  Love sitting in the courtyard area and listening to the fountain. The food was good and very generous portions.  Our server, Claudia, was amazing.  Very helpful, attentive and friendly.  I would definitely recommend this restaurant.

Convenient Downtown Summerlin location, stunning decor, extensive and interesting menu, perfect service from Augustin, more than generous portions, and very good value.  Definitely recommend the artichoke and mushroom quesadillas and the chili relleno (oh yeah, and the margaritas, too)

This place knows how to do authentic Mexican food and margaritas! The enchiladas, beans, and rice were all amazing. Service was on point- our food and drinks were served promptly. We didn't have to wait at all to be seated. The atmosphere is beautifully decorated and everything seemed very clean. Our waitress was friendly. The cost of the food seems slightly high but not a deal breaker by any means since the portions are generous. We will be back again!
The food here was amazing!!! We had ceviche and quesadilla with beef!! My only complaint was the music was a bit loud. Definitely try to sit up stairs it's more intimate.

Lets start out by saying the decor is very pleasing (except in the bar), really nice. From there it just falls off the cliff. This was our second visit.  As we sat in the bar (mid-day) we noticed only 2 others in the bar, that's it. We did notice 3 servers chatting away at the other end. The bartender was well, not interested in the customers. Very little "chat-up". If you are slow, customers pay tips. The staff on the other hand was chatting up a storm, enjoying themselves.....but please don't bother us we're busy......with each other. WE BECAME BORED. One and done. Chips and salsa were served, didn't like them.
Bottom line if you want me to come back, give me a reason....With staff that understands the customer is what pays there salary and tips are the gravy.... and friendly goes a long way. Decor isn't enough. If you are tending bar, talk to your customers, make them feel welcome and WANT to come back.

Way over-priced.  Took the fam there...I didn't know the hi$tory of this place so I was surprised by the prices.  As soon as I saw the menu, I felt guilty for wearing shorts and not a suit, but the staff were nice to us anyway.  It's beautiful inside; the decor is great, but I agree w/ another review that it seemed a bit cluttered w/ tables which took away from the aesthetics a bit.  The food was good.  Better than your typical Mexican restaurant, but still not worth the price they charge.  I'll be surprised if they make it w/out lowering prices, who knows though, maybe there's a niche of rich people who like overpaying for ok food and passing up better restaurants in the area.  Supply and demand I guess, so I'm probably wrong.  BTW while we were there, 2 different families came in, sat down looked at the menu (prices), and got up an left.

Well just tried this place because of location.  Took the wife and kids.  Service was horrible.  So slow for a Tuesday night..Food is over priced and lacking flavor and any heat.  Which you'd expect for a Mexican restaurant. $10 kids meal for a crappy cheese quesadilla.. yeah no thanks.  Even the kids can make better ones at home. Plenty of other places that are happy to get my money.  $141 for 2 adults and 4 kids...will never be back!!!!

We were excited to try a new place close to home as Summerlin is in desperate need of a good Mexican restaurant but we left feeling underwhelmed. The wait for a table on a Saturday evening was about an hour so we decided to eat in the bar area. Well, we were informed you can only be served drinks and appetizers in the bar. Really? Big mistake, Pancho's! I know of no other restaurant with such a ridiculous policy. The margaritas were okay and we liked the chips and salsa. Bar waitress was fabulous and fun. I did notice that the Tiffany style chandeliers (I don't know how these fit the Mexican theme) over the bar were an afterthought as they were run on exposed electrical conduit which perplexed me as the building was just constructed.
 
We were called to the dining area after approximately 45 minutes but of the 5-6 hostesses ready to seat us, not one had a clue of what to do and we waited more than 5 minutes at the hostess stand while they figured it out.  Upon entering the dining room, I literally felt as if I had walked into a jungle. The place is filled with an extreme, almost obnoxious,  amount of artificial plants and trees. Clearly the concept of "less is more" was lost on the designers. The lighting is very bright (might want to heavily consider dimming in the evenings) and there was no background music playing so we weren't impressive with the atmosphere. Our waiter was very good and attentive which made for a pleasant dining experience. I had the lobster enchiladas (really delicious!) and my husband had chicken chimichanga (he liked it but it didn't knock his socks off). We didn't stick around to have another drink or desert because the atmosphere was not inviting. My husband commented on the walk to the car that he probably wouldn't go back and unfortunately, I'd have to agree with him.

This place is by far my most favorite Mexican restaurant.  Everything from the chips and salsa to the enchiladas to the tacos tastes delicious and authentic!!!!  I used to go to Lindo because Ricardo's is gone and Macayos is too far from my house but I was thrilled to find this place!!!  Yes the prices are slightly higher than a Macayos or Ricardo's, but it's in Downtown Summerlin.  The real estate there has a significant premium attached to it.  They do have an excellent happy hour if you're on a budget!

Since when is it appropriate for wait staff to be taking shots on the job?  Two very large shots within 20 minutes. By the time we left she was very obviously feeling tipsy.  I see a drunk waitress as Huge liability, but maybe that's just me.  All this while myself and others around me sat neglected with empty beverage glasses?  Food was ok but not worth the price my any means.   The service was ridiculous.

We tried out Pancho's because we received a BOGO coupon. Overall the food was good but we were disappointed that they did not serve beans with the chips and salsa, no soup with the entrees and no horchata or any of the traditional Mexican drinks (they had margaritas and beer). It came short compared to our long time favorite Mexican restaurant but I would eat here again if the BOGO coupons keep coming, plus the free dessert for checking in thru Yelp :)

This is my favorite Mexican restaurant in town. My top had always been Lindo Michocan... But I came here and it surpassed my expectations. I have yet to be disappointed in anything I've tried here. The food is awesome and the service is fantastic. The price may seem steep - but they're large portions imo. I will come back many times again.
Wow. Just wow. Tinga Poblano is on the must have list!  The manager was great - thanks for the bean dip!  Will definitely be back. I'm sure there's a Naughty Maggie with my name on it. Maybe 2
Had lunch here. I really liked it. I had a cheese enchilada and a chili relleno. It was so yummy! Service was good too! I will be returning!

I tried Pancho's yesterday and it was not great. Like all the other reviews below, the space is beautiful but the food was too pricey for what it was. We were offered guacamole as we sat down and it came out to $15 for cold, stored guacamole. I know it's generally an extra cost, but I'd appreciate it if I was told that before I even had a chance to look at the menu. Besides that, the service was good and the manager even came to check in.

Decor is beautiful, but it definitely does not justify the insanely overpriced food. $18 for an enchilada plate that is not worthy of the price tag. $10 for chicken strips & fries on the kids menu. Chips & salsa were tasty, but not enough for me to come running back. I'm disappointed as I was hoping to find our new favorite restaurant being that we live less than 5 minutes away. I guess I will keep looking!  We will likely not be back for these ridiculous prices.

Went to Pancho's on Saturday December 12th for the first time and sat in the bar area with my five girlfriends to celebrate a birthday. The first thing you should know is there is nothing on the menu that is less than $20.00 except for the taco salad that was $16.99 and a few appetizers that were $18.99. Now, I am not cheap and I don't mind paying for a good meal so I was expecting with these prices to have great food and great service to celebrate my friend's birthday. We were sadly disappointed. 

The taco salad was pretty much just lettuce and sour cream with a few beans (not exaggerating - maybe 7 beans throughout) and a very small amount of ground beef at the bottom with a couple chips (again not exaggerating - probably 2 chips total). The Queso Fundido was tasteless. Oh and I could smell the Ceviche my friend ordered from 5 feet away- I was convinced she was going to get food poisoning from rotten fish. As it stands, I cannot guarantee she didn't - food poisoning and too much alcohol cause similar symptoms... 

The food was not even the worst of it though...the service was horrible!  Our waitress Adriana/Ariana was terrible! She was so slow. Took 20 minutes just to get our first drinks and another 20 minutes to get some chips. Then the worst part of the entire night - THE BILL...(cue the horror music). The bill took 2 hours (again not exaggerating - we finished eating at 9pm and we were there until 11pm figuring out the damn bill). Why? Because Adriana/Ariana had apparently never rung up a bill in her life. From the 5 of us, she split the bill for 3 on one and 2 on another. I was on the bill with the 3. One of my friends on that bill payed in cash and the other two of us said to split the rest of the check. I'm sure you could see how this could go wrong - She could only charge one of us...she could not split it evenly...she could charge us for the completely separate bill for the other two girls at our table..wait! Yes! You read that right...she charged us EACH for the other bill at the table. So round and round we go for 2 damn hours. In the end,  I still show a pending charge on my bank account for $53.00 for my taco salad and a coke...when it should have been $26.00. 

I know what you're thinking, you would have asked to speak with a manager and cleared the whole thing up - no need for this drama mama's review. But you would be wrong because I asked to see the manager TWICE and no manager ever came. In fact, no other waiter PRETENDING to be the manager even came (yes, I used to work in food service and this happened all the time). After two hours, I couldn't wait anymore and I wasn't going to make a scene and embarrass my girlfriend on her birthday so I left...

Please don't waste your money here, folks. It's too bad because the band was actually pretty good and the place is really beautiful (decor and such). Worst dining experience ever.

I would give a 3-1/2 stars for food and price but because of the decor I gave 4 stars. Had the tacos de pescados. The mahi mahi was grilled well, not rubbery but just a tad dry. Tried the fish by itself and it was good but once you add the sides, lemon, and sauce then the taco was really good! The rice was decent and the beans were ok. They melted the cheese on the beans I believe with a torch, like you would with the sugar on creme br√ªl√©e. The chips were of medium thickness, not greasy, and the salsa was pretty good. One of the waiters offered us a free refill on chips and salsa which was a plus. I've read comments where a bowl of fruit is also complimentary but we didn't get any. Might have been a special or grand opening thing. Lastly, they added a nice little touch to the tacos. They pinned the tacos closed with a strip of bamboo (I believe) shaped into a sword (tied a knot at one end) and used radishes as stoppers. Check out the pic!

As for the decor, gorgeous! Just look at the pictures other people have uploaded. There is a nice little outdoor waiting area that is very charming. Slightly hidden and intimate. I looked at the colorful patterned tiles that were everywhere and from I can tell they are all hand painted or else stamped but none were completely identical. We were a table away from the fountain and didn't smell "mold" like what one person said in review. We walked by it and I took a whiff and didn't smell a thing. We did however get one of the two tables that is right next to the kitchen entrance. It was busy and kind of distracting but luckily no accidents this evening. The "uniforms" of the hostess' were a nice touch, subtle Mexican styled dresses. 

I would definitely come back but not as often due to the prices. This would be a great place to take friends and family for dinner due to the "WOW" factor of the decor. By far the coolest looking Mexican cuisine restaurants I've been to. Looking forward to trying the flan next time, it looks similar to how my mom makes them.

I gave one star because the bus boy was very nice and attentive and the restaurant decor was adorable.  However everything else was horrid!  Let's start with the unfriendly and borderline snarky hostess.  I didn't get her name, but she had dark brown hair.  The restaurant is lit so darkly at the tables that you can barely see your food.  Which is probably what they intended so you can't see the horrible presentation of the plates.  I ordered the 2 cheese enchilada combo.  The enchiladas had so much cheese on top of them that that's all I could taste.  The rice was hard and not at all like any Mexican or Spanish rice that I've ever had.  How can you possibly serve awful Mexican rice at a Mexican restaurant?  My meal was under $20, which is completely overpriced!  My friend wasn't that hungry so she ordered a side of beans and rice.  The serving she got was baby sized and was $6.  My daughter ordered from the kid's meal a cheese quesadilla.  The kid's meal was $10 for a tiny quesadilla and hard rice.  Let me say that she's had better at Taco Bell.  The tortillas were hard as rocks on her quesadilla.  The flan I ordered for dessert was ok, but was drenched in cinnamon.  I've had Mexican food in many places, even in Mexico.  I've been to taquerias that were amazing and sad to say that I'd rather go to Taco Bell than ever return to this place.  The price point at this place does not match the quality of the food or the service.  The waiter was barely present until I asked our bus person if he could bring my dessert.  We were done with our plates a while, and our server never came back to ask if we were ready for dessert or how our meal was.  He did however bring us the check, and after picking it a back up he opened it right in front of me to see how much tip he received.  How completely rude and unprofessional!  He was a jerk period.  I don't mind paying this price for good food and good service, but this restaurant has neither of those things.  I will NEVER return to this overpriced restaurant with rude service and disgusting food.
We walked in and saw a stage, and you know me - I know that screen and the set up when some karaoke is about to happen. Well, what to you know - There's karaoke every Tuesday night. I love Pancho 's

Making reservations with Open Table was a snap. We got seated as soon as we arrived, early evening on a Saturday (6pm). The decor ambiance is very pleasant. We sat upstairs with a nice view of the hacienda style layout. The sound level upstairs was moderate, and we could easily have a conversation.The wait staff was attentive and courteous. Salsa and chips were very good. The meals arrived at a good pace, were well prepared and quite tasty. I had the enchilada Ramon and my wife had quesadillas. Granted the prices are on the higher end but not unexpected for the Downtown Summerlin location. If you want cheap Mexican food on the go, you can always dine at Rubios! Note that the now defunct Agave restaurant which was a short distance away in the Canyon Pointe Center had similar pricing, but Pancho's food and ambiance is better. The restaurant manager made a point to visit our table and everyone else  near us to check in on the food and service. We plan on visiting again, and if there is consistency in the experience and different entrees, I could see bumping the rating up to 5 stars.

Met a friend for their Sunday Brunch.  1st time for us and we both agreed, the restaurant is very beautifully decorated.  We sat near the water fountain which created a relaxing and inviting atmosphere.  Our server Miguel was awesome, attentive and fun.  We were brought a complimentary glass of champagne and a small bowl of fruit while waiting for our food which by the way, was delivered quickly and perfectly hot (hate cold eggs!).  Neither of us ate the fruit, not sweet, out of season, appeared a bit old --  they should forego it altogether.   Overall a great experience, just a little surprised when we received the bill -- tax and our 20% tip (would have liked to have given more to Miguel to be honest) came to $90.00 total.  We each had one margarita,  one brunch item and we split a brownie dessert.  Seemed a bit overpriced to us but I would definitely go back, the food was delicious, excellent service and atmosphere but would definitely forego the $11.75 margarita and stick with the champagne.

Sub par at best. Chips salsa. Jarred salsa is better. Couldn't keep a drink. Fajitas fair. Leticia's off farm is way better for Mexican food. The tortilla soup wasn't horrible but not worth coming back. I got combo plate with beef taco which was worn down the whole shell so couldn't eat as a taco. And a chicken tamale. This was pure awful. Bland no taste. I'm telling ya , hit Leticia's !!!!
OVERPRICED! Don't get me wrong I have no problem paying for good food, this was bland food and jar salsa You are definitely paying for the decor...had better Mexican food at a chain El Torito...

Food was ok. Nothing extraordinary. I'm a vegetarian so I enjoyed some of the different options they had. Honestly, the biggest deterrent is the prices. Nothing we had justified the entree prices of $20.

We were told there was a 30 minute wait. 45 minutes later, our pager buzzed and when we turned it in, the hostess returned it. She said our table was not quite ready. So we proceeded to wait another 10 minutes. When we were led to our seats, our party walked past numerous empty tables to the back room, which was completely empty except for a party of 2. Service from there on was sloooooow. Our food arrived and it was mediocre at best. I love Mexican food....but the only thing I can say I enjoyed was the salsa and the bite of kids quesadilla I had of my daughters plate. It took so long most of our party had to leave with the kids before the check made its way to us. Who knows, grandma and grandpa may still be there attempting to pay.

I've been doing customer service in restaurants since I was 16 and I've given my share of outstanding customer service! An employee named Martha gave me and my friends outstanding customer service. Very cute very nice and very sincere about making sure everything at our table and our meal was perfect. She gave us ideas, told us what things were and how big and small they were and she even put out for in the to go container for us neatly!! :) She also had several other tables and was killing it! Very good employee! The place here is very clean and very beautiful! Thankyou for everything! We will be back very soon!
Great atmosphere in the bar,  but I am not going to pay $15 for guacamole or a couple tacos.   Too many good Mexican restaurants in town to pay that much,  especially if you have kids.   El Paso!

We visited Pancho's for the first time today.  I really liked it.  I LOVED the d√©cor, it's really cute inside, with an indoor patio feeling with lighted trees and colorful tiles and a fountain.  I bet it's pretty at night - will have to go back and check.  The staff were all very nice, from the host staff, to our server & busser.  I ordered Enchiladas Suizas, and they were very good.  My brother had a Quesadilla with Chorizo & Eggs, and he said that was also very good.  As some others have said, it was a little pricey, but that is not a particular concern of mine.  It is also a little noisy, but not too bad.  I recommend it to anyone who doesn't mind the high prices.
Love the food, love the service, and if you have Jason you'll have amazing service from start to finish

I will never return to this restaurant ever again. 2nd try and it was awful.

The food is just boring. The decor is the only thing this place has going for them.

The 'street tacos' had zero flavor. The shrimp puffy tacos were absolutely disgusting. The 'puffy taco' was cardboard. I'm convinced they put cardboard under a heat lamp then put it on my plate. This is just sad and I really wanted to give this place the benefit of the doubt.

Other than Happy hour, I would go elsewhere.  The food is quite expensive for what you get.  The bar area is very brightly lit and the ambiance is not very good.  The redeeming thing is their Happy Hour and well made Margaritas.  They also have live music which is quite nice.

First time here...enjoyed the atmosohere..great service.  Food was a little pricey however the taste and presentation was wonderful and I didn't mind paying the price.  Keep an eye out in the local ads for buy one get one to try it your first time.  The kids enjoyed the fountain and also commented the food was good.

The prices here are comical. The waitress literally began her introduction by telling us that the food is too expensive, however she assured us that it was worth it, which it was not. The guacamole alone here is $14.95. Insane! The salsa was not good either, it was too spicy (and I love heat!) and bland. That being said, my friend ordered a kiwi margarita (which is mysteriously priced at a reasonable $10.95) and it was one of the best I have ever tasted. There was also live music in the bar area and the band playing was fantastic. There were fliers up saying that have comedy and karaoke as well. All in all I say come for the drinks and entertainment but skip the food.

Very nice atmosphere and cozy. The waiter was attentive and kept our ice tea filled. The chip basket was kept full but when the food came I was expecting better taste. I had heard so much about this place with the wishing pond and picture area all was good but the food needs some work. I had the rolled tacos with sour cream (taquitios) and the meat was mixed with onion and meat sauce. I would have liked it simple no added sauce to the meat. It was nice to try something different but won't go back.
This is the closest to real mexican food I've find in Las Vegas. I am mexican and I can vouch for it. Please disregard other comments, please don't make it more tex-mex. Thank you!

Do not ever go to this Shi*hole the managers are so fin rude Mallory and MIke to be exact they should be fired not even capable of being managers we ordered seafood that smelled old when we got it and let them know and also called later to inform them we felt ill they said oops oh well sorry not sorry basically NEVER EVER will I come back here
Food awesome, great service ,food came SOOOO quick thought it would take longer place was very busy, but it came out was hot and freash
Love this place and their margaritas! This is my new taco Tuesday spot for sure. :)

So we had our first, and last experience at Pancho's today. Decor gets 5 stars but the food is not good, bland on top of bland with an extra side of bland. Nothing we ate was good, service was nothing special, and the food is EXPENSIVE for what you get. I guess they figure they can price gouge you because its in downtown Summerlin.

The carnitas were tough, flavorless, and did not appear to be fresh. The carnitas burrito is $17.95, came topped with cold Chile queso sauce (bland) and not a side of rice and beans in sight. For 18 dollars.... Really? The side of guacamole was 8.95. For a modest scoop of once again, flavorless guacamole. I mean, there isn't an authentic thing about this place, the plates are garnished with parsley for goodness sakes. Where's the cilantro? The limes? The flavor?!?!?!

We paid our $71 tab (no alcohol) (for two people and a toddler) and walked out quietly. The first thing we said to each other when we got to the car was, "never again." Fool me once, shame on you, fool me twice, nope you won't fool me twice.

If you are looking for decent Mexican in the area try viva mercados on sahara and ft. Apache, or even better, casa don Juan on buffalo and lake Mead, or Frank and finas cocina on flamingo and grand canyon..

Delicious!! Been living in the southeast where they don't do green chili. Was VERY glad to see our new home state had green chili and Pancho's was a great welcome back to the good stuff! And omg the ambience here? Stunning!

The first time I ate at Pancho's here, I wasn't impressed or ready to come back anytime soon.  Whatever Mole Enchiladas the waiter said I'd like was not even close to what I described.  He did however bring out another sauce to try for next time I order it, which was awesome.

I love the location, ambience & sports memorabilia, especially the winners circle pix for racehorses!  Instead of giving them a bad rating for the first time, I decided to try them again.  Not only cause they were new at the time, but cause my friend has eaten here about ten times w/ no complaints!  He highly recommends them & knows Mexican food.  I've also been to the one in Manhattan beach which was great.  Older & more authentic feel, but always fantastic.

Helen in the bar area on Monday Night Football w/ happy hour & specials was FANTASTIC!  She not only brought me the mole sauces to taste so that I got the correct dish this time, but she was on top of everything!  The hot sauce, sour cream, oven baked or regular been burrito, etc.  Wow!  

Dad ordered the Oven Baked Bean Burrito, I got the Mole Helen recommended & we tore it up lol!  It was so absolutely fantastic!  Mom's fish tacos weren't so good.  Instead of a chuck of Mahi Mahi she got tiny cubes.  Almost mushy & overwhelmed by the pico de gallo & cabbage.  Mom said she loved the chips & dip & service, but will never get the fish tacos.  I took a bite for this review & absolutely agreed.  However, we WILL be back.  5 stars for two of three dishes & exceptional service Helen.  We may only sit wherever she is lol.  

Overall, I recommend the brown mole Enchiladas, oven baked bean burritos & fajitas.  Salude!

This place decor is awesome, those staircase are everything , service was really good Claudia was very helpful on suggestions  for us decide what to get, food was average Mexican gringo food! One thing I notice is on the menus they said the have Wahoos fish tacos! I wonder what Wahoos think of that.
Chile relleno was undercooked and chicken tortilla soup tasted like it has unseasoned boiled chicken in it. Not great.

I love eating at ponchos. I've eaten here so many times, really a lot. It's by far my favorite Mexican restaurant in las vegas. I grew up in summerlin and it's my favorite go to Mexican food craving  place. It's very pretty inside, also very clean and I've never had bad service there. I usually get the combination plate 2 beef tacos, it's very good. I get chips with the bean dip, it's very good. And I usually get the tres leche dessert, soo good. The wait staff is always very nice, I think overal they forgot my drink order one time.  And my food always comes out hot. It isn't priced cheap but in comparison it's not far off from the other Mexican restaurants in summerlin, and I don't mind paying a little more for the pretty ambiance, good food, and friendly wait staff. Also location is great in downtown summerlin, convienent, lots to do.

Great service and atmosphere.  Food eh.  Unfortunately, a little bland and way overpriced.  Margaritas were good.  Had burrito ranchero, chile rellano made with pablano  and chimichanga.   Probably not returning.

The service is kind and the atmosphere is welcoming. Now on to the best most satisfying, sit down Mexican food I have had... maybe ever. My someone and I split the burrito vegan style with the veggie mix option. Also grabbed on a side of salsa and chips on top of already eating the complementary chips and salsa... and two cups of the vegan fideo soup. All were super tasty and authentic. The price is on point for this sit down eatery. And you will feel like you're getting your moneys worth as well. Vegans won't suffer here. The menu is full of options... and I saw breakfast options also that I will be in to try. There is actually two menus you are handed when you sit down, one for vegans and one for others. Seriously would be a great place for tacos and beers as they have a nice selection. This place would be perfect for lunch or dinner solo or with family and friends. Tomorrow is taco Tuesday and I may have to swing by for lunch!

Definitely the place to go if you are not that hungry and just want a beer and some appetizers. 
Their chips and salsa are really good and the place is beautiful. 

Their entrees are not good at all and they are very high priced. 
My husband ordered a burrito and it was mush. A mushy $20 burrito. 
I ordered the street tacos and had to send them back
Then, I ordered the shrimp tacos. The tortilla was falling apart and they were just filled with lettuce. When I finally bit a shrimp, there was almost no seasoning so all I could taste was lettuce. 
I ended up paying for a meal and not eating it. :(
This place is too expensive. California prices and in a Las Vegas strip mall.  I like my burritos for under $15. Service is not great either.  I would recommend going up the street to matadors.

Beautiful and welcoming atmosphere as soon as you walk in. 
GREAT customer service and wait staff. 
Have lived in Vegas 3 years and have not found - until today - a place that could make a chili verde that I actually loved. Today I found that place and its Panchos. 
Anyone complaining of price have obviously never been to a high quality Mexican restaurant as Panchos. 
They're prices are consistent with other restaurants and yet Panchos food is better. 
I highly recommend and will be bring my husband here for date night!!

Service was great, had appetizers at the bar. Chips and salsa good, margaritas were great. They had an awesome band playing until midnight on Sat. Good place to just hang out listen to music have a drink. The band that played last night played alternative rock, was told they will be back on Thursday can't wait to see them again.

Loved the look and feel of this New Mexican Restaurant in Downtown Summerlin!   Prices were, what I thought, ridiculously high but the fried ice cream made up for it for sure!  It was amazing!   Give it a try!

The ambiance of this place is lively. I love the garden style decoration. It really feels like you're inside the house patio. The energy is uplifting. The only downside is the price. It's quite pricey but the taste is excellent. Everything is delicious. I'm rating it 4 star just because of the price but other than that, food is delicious and service is quite alright.

Just had a delicious lunch at Pancho's! I've been wanting to check this place out - especially after hearing great things about the chips and salsa, which were perfect. I then had the artichoke avocado enchiladas - and my only complaint is the size. I could have easily shared them. I enjoyed the lighter ingredients in enchiladas, as it is rare to come away from a big plate of Mexican Food  without feeling like I overdid it!

I visited this restaurant for the first time with a friend. Nice atmosphere and service was decent. However we were very disappointed with the food. I ordered chicken quesadilla for $16.95 and the chicken was shredded and tasted horrible. I have never seen shredded chicken quesadillas in somewhat of an upscale Mexican restaurant especially for the price that we got charged.  The shredded chicken is a low quality form of chicken that is very cost affective for restaurants . Most if not all Mexican restaurants, I've visited use grilled chicken breast instead. 

I returned the dish and decided to ordered the Tacos Al Carbon which suppose to have Carne Asada for almost $20.00. Guess what? The red meat used was not Carne Asada, it was low grade red meat with a dreadful rubbery after taste.  
We honestly did not mind the price and the atmosphere, but the quality of the food especially the meat products does not justify such high price on the menu. 
I do not recommend this restaurant to anyone who is looking for authentic and high quality Mexican food. We will definitely not visit this restaurant again.

Restaurant open till 930 tonight bar is separate with live music scene and karaoke some nights. Service is great from bartenders Ariana is awesome cocktail server! I had the fajitas they were awesome with a great portion size

This  place use to be good the first couple times. My husband and I went last night tortilla chips were bland but at least they were warm, when we received the Entree's mind was warm but not hot I had my burrito De Mar sent back but when it came back out it was fishy and drowned with too much sauce my husband said he should've sent his back his plate was on a fajita skillet and his plate wasn't sizzling or hot either . His steak was over done
Nope we weren't happy at all and we won't be back !!!
All good
Memories of this place are
Now bad memories

I was very excited to try this restaurant as there aren't any good Mexican restaurants in the Summerlin area... 

We started with chips and salsa and queso. The chips were decent and salsa was good but nothing particularly delicious. 
The queso had mixed reviews at our table some members of our party loved it. Other hated it. If you are a fan of artichoke cream cheese dip you might be interested in this.

The steak salads were decent. Meat seemed overly salted but overall not bad. 
The chicken tacos were the flop of the evening. Extremely greasy and tasteless. 
The beans and rice were fair. 

The carnitas enchiladas were the favorite at the table. I recommend those out of all the dishes we tried. 

The fried ice cream was so - so. The only downfall was it was greasy... 

Mediocre food but the real kicker was the price of the food! $20 for two tacos with a small side of beans and rice is outrageous. 
That's the reason for the two stars. Average to below average Mexican cuisine at sky high prices. 

I won't be returning.
Generous portions, great margs, speedy service and a fun atmosphere! Prices were a little high for the type of food but seemed normal for this area in general.
Pancho's had delicious food and excellent service.  The manager, Doug, is great with kids and checked in often to be sure our experience was a great one.  I would definitely recommend Pancho's

Went there last night. My girlfriend was on a knee scooter with a cast on her foot.  We also had an elderly couple with us. The hostess takes us upstairs to our table. They aren't very observant. Maybe she should have asked if everyone in the party can get up the stairs...it would be a novel idea to offer the elevator. Waitresses and hostesses are plenty nice. 

Manager came by and asked how the queso fundido was. We said it could use a little more spice. Then suggested maybe a spicy one and a not spicy one for the menu.
Manager cracked a stupid sarcastic joke that maybe the restaurant could be half Chinese and half Mexican. He acted and looked like a clown. He was a jerk off.

I ordered the Carne Asada, the GF ordered the seafood chimichanga. The old folks ordered a combo dinner and a beef chimichanga. The Carne Asada they serve is a hunk of sirloin. It is tough and chewy. Authentic Carne Asada dishes are usually made with skirt steak. 

Girlfriend loved her seafood chimi. Heard no complaints from the olds regarding their food.

Bartender in the Bar was pleasant and helpful while we waited and the three waitresses were fun to talk to.

We ordered no alcohol with our dinner and the bill was well over $100.00

 The girlfriend said she prefers Robertos Taco Shop for tastiness of food and price. I agree with her.

Funny thing is that I have been to Panchos on Rosecrans 100s of times for over 30 years. I remember the food being better and the price not as expensive there.

I was disappointed over all.

We had great service (thanks Fernando) and great food, in a nice environment. 
No complaints at all with our experience. We will definitely be frequent customers.

Very middle of the road OKAY. I've always passed by this place on my way to Trader's Joe and my friend said it was good so I decided to try it out. We had the queso fundido, tortilla soup, and chicken fajitas. 

The queso fundido was just meh - the queso fundido is wayyyyyy better at Viva Mercado. The tortilla soup was warm and good, but I probably wouldn't get it again. And the chicken fajita (always the safest bet whenever you try a new restaurant) was good, not great - I mean it's grilled chicken and veggies...I hope you don't mess that up. 

Anyhow, would I give it another shot? Maybe. My friend had the taquitos and those looked good.
Was ok. Sub par mediocre food, nothing to go crazy over. We tried it and we won't be back. Better Mexican restaurants to go to in Las Vegas
Beautiful atmosphere, attentive customer service, delicious fried ice cream, just slightly over priced for the quality of food. May only be back for the fried ice cream and a cocktail.
Amazing Mexican restaurant, the best I've been to in 8 years. Will return. Cesar is the best, had the smile the whole time while serving is. Love this place.

Food is really good. Strawberry margarita with strawberry pur√©e is good. Salsa is good. Price is a few dollars more than Lindo Michoacan. 4 stars because they don't have homemade tortillas. :( it's a must.

Excellent food. The service is fantastic. Greeted by every person we came in contact with. Brian was our server and was Brian and he was very attentive.  Our meal arrived within 15 minutes.
If you are in the area definitely give them a try. You won't be disappointed.

Our first visit was 9 months ago. While satisfied with the food, the service really wasn't all that great. We returned tonight and the food was great and so was the service! Definitely a bit overpriced, but overall a nice improvement from our last visit.

Pretty solid Mexican food restaurant. "A-OK" is the description Yelp gives for 3 stars. I think that's exactly right. This place is exactly what I expect from a good Mexican restaurant in a strip mall.

For starters we had the guacamole. This was pretty good, and they were able to give it to me without cilantro! That's a big bonus for me, because I'm one of those people for whom cilantro tastes *terrible*. This also means they are more likely to have made it fresh, which I like.

My wife and I had entr√©es that were also good. The menu is so big that now, a few days later, I can't remember what I had. 

I think that is a good example for this restaurant and why it gets 3 stars instead of 4. I remember that it was good. I remember that I enjoyed it and that I would eat here again if I were in the area. I don't remember anything really stand-out or special about it enough to really remember what I ate. It's just good Mexican food.
Great naughty margaritas and their mole is crazy good. Love this place and our favorite bartender is Jason!

Service was good and food was decent. It's high priced for Mexican food though- nothing I would return to spend money on when there are other options in town that are more reasonably priced for the same if not better food.

Not a great meal.   The star is literally for the company and the nice looking building.  

I was yet again disappointed in another execution of so called Mexican food and why they think it's acceptable to charge so outrageously for. It's not like you get gold plated beans served here. In my opinion you can't even call it Mexican just because you stuff a tortilla with rice and beans. Maybe we are actually helping to pay for the building, d√©cor and uniforms.  I actually was whishing I was at Caf√© Rio since at least their rice is eatable instead of hard grains that can do some real tooth damage.

 The seafood burrito I ordered tasted like the seafood was one minute away from going bad.  It was just not okay by any stretch.  And it wasn't just my dish.  I think only 2 out of the 6 of us enjoyed their meal. The average isn't good. 

The server was okay in the begining and just got mediocre towards the middle and unhelpful at the end. They seem to put more emphasis in replenishing the chips than anything else, but too bad I didn't come here for the chips.

I can't even take a risk coming back to try something else.  Also if paying $$ for Mexican food makes you think it is high end or of better quality maybe you need to try a $ Mexican food place and compare... just for kicks. Que mala comida sirven aqui. No costea, que lastima por querer aparentar tan prestigioso lugar.
Meh - it was just ok but I guess for folks who don't know better it will be fine. I ordered the chicken enchilada suiza- dry. Their specialty margarita was good.
The service was prompt and fast and amazing and the food was absolutely delicious the Ambiance was extraordinary really cool place and if you go on Yelp you get a free fried ice cream
Really great atmosphere and location. Service was fun and attentive. The chips are salsa are  but the actual was just ok and overpriced.

Terrible service, over priced, terrible food. Beans are out of a can. We live 1 mile a way in Summerlin and will not be back. We were really hoping it would be great So Cal Mexican Food but not so. Very noisey, tables cramped together. We kept bumping into the people next to us and they were bumping into us while eating. Robert'o for a fraction of the price is 100% better. However we enjoy sitting down and having a drink so Viva Mercado it is on Sahara and Fort Apache. 5 star service 5 star food 3 star pricing. Been there at least 50 times and every time it is consistent and amazing. We have all worked in restaurants putting ourselves through college and know the business well. It is not rocket science to make great food, served with a smile and priced correctly. This place is insulting to our intelligence. 
Never Again

I usually don't come to high end Mexican restaurants because they are highly overrated. I ordered a burrito and it was absolutely bland, it did NOT taste authentic. This is why I stick to hole in the wall Mexican restaurants.. and the price was insane for the quality of their food.

AS many of the previous reviewers have stated and by now it is obvious to both the owners and the customers, the restaurant is beauftiful and every detail is fantastic, the food however is very average with outrageous pricing for a Las Vegas location.   I truly think the owners have forgotten that this restaurant isn't in Manhattan Beach, or Newport or wherever the other one is.  IF you are interested in paying California prices for average Mexican food, then by all means visit this establishment.  If you know the difference, do like the rest of us and go elsewhere.

The chicken tortilla soup was so delicious. I got the lobster enchiladas they were excellent but I cannot stop thinking about those margaritas i had the naughty Maggie and the pomegranate freaking awesome coming back next week with my girls from work. Oh and the service was more than I could have wished for

First visit here. Great atmosphere. Pretty busy but we were seated way before the estimated time the host gave us. 
The food was delicious. I had the Panchos Chimichanga Especial. The portions were above standard. 
Service was very good. We used the Yelp Check in offer. 
Overall, this place is a keeper...and I believe I hear a live band in the background.
