Horrible, horrible... horrible!! Over priced and not good. I ordered the tortilla soup that is $8 assuming is was more that just a cup of soup. And I got the smallest cup of soup. 

They only have 2 types of margaritas and we all ordered different flavors and they all tasted the exact same. Nothing about them was "peach" or "banana" flavored and they are $12 each. I would just order a classic margarita if you go. I know you can get a better margarita at Applebee's for half the price too.

Beautiful place but horrible drinks, food and service. You pay for what you see not for what you eat. Is like TacoBell but upgrated. Very expensive and not welcoming at all. How did they survive for 40 years with this type of food and service. Our America has lost the good taste for food and they settle for looks. I rather it frozen Mexican burritos and save my money.
Love! The classic margarita is the best.  Food is authentic and delicious.  One of my favorite restaurants.

This was a tough one to review.  

I'd give five stars for the live music...which is why we actually go to Ponchos.  STEF N ROCK  are amazing and are there three nights a week. We make a point of being there  on Saturday nights...just to see them. They are worth paying the high price on the drinks...just to enjoy the performance.  Best live music on the West side of Vegas.  Go...you'll be impressed by the warmth of their voices.  Truly amazing. 

I do love the decor of the restaurant...it's has so much character.  

The food however lacks flavor.  How can Mexican food lack flavor!!?? Plus it's overpriced.  Big disappointment.  

We do continue to patronize the cantina to enjoy the performances. The drinks are pricy but good.  

So three stars seems fair.

Not sure why all the bad reviews... Service was perfect, atmosphere was relaxing and the food was amazing. I wasn't sure if it would be worth the price but you can really taste the quality and freshness of the ingredients. Well worth it in my opinion!
Too expensive! It's Mexican food! For gosh sakes  rice beans flour tortillas atmosphere is good in the bar live music too but way over priced.

Can I give less than 1 star? This place is the WORST $25 for a disgusting burrito. Then I receive my margarita..... It was pure water. This place lacks everything! Taste, authenticity, everything!!! Please don't waste your time. Oh and venue sucks too!

Great Mexican food, good service and very nice workers. Prices are a little high but they have so many coupons and specials it's worth it!  The music in the bar was a nice surprise and we have been back to listen to more!

The ambiance of this place was so great! We had the chicken nacho and they were delicious!! We also ordered a chimichanga, chicken taco salad and a kids quesadilla! All were huge and tasty! Loaded with meat and they did not hold back on portions. One of the best Mexican places we've eaten at!! It is slightly pricy but the server and staff were amazingly attentive.
Very nice atmosphere, service was good. Price is a bit high, as it is located in the Summerlin area. Food is below average, compared to other places with same food category. The stake was tasteless.

To start off, this place is gorgeous very nice seating area and the fountain was a nice touch.
As  for the services, the server didnt know much about some of the entrees and also couldnt say what the names were. The food was alright. I ordered the carne asada burrito but was told they dont have that... odd right? Anyways they have a philly burrito (Which is the equivalent to a carne asada burrito but they failed to mention that)
Presentation of the dish was nice but quality of the food lacked, the meat wasnt seasoned per "carne asada" just tasted like peppered steak. 
Drink selection was pretty basic, didnt have any common "mexican" drinks 
Prices???? Extremely expensive for what you are getting. In my honest opinion it is a bad replica of Lindo Micohacon. 
Wont be returning.
Came here for happy hour, sat at the bar they had live music. Everything was great food and drinks were on point as well as customer service. The place was very clean as it should be.

New place! New vibes! Familiar tastes...

I've been watching this building come together for months so I was super excited to finally walk through the beautiful doors. 

When it comes to first impressions, it was love at first sight. A major wow factor! Whoever designed this place deserves 5 stars. They brought the beauty of Mexico to us in Vegas! It reminded me of the movie ~ Original Sin with Angelina Jolie. 

I do have one note about the design and that's the little room behind the beautiful staircase. I highly suggest that room is used for private parties & events only because customers don't get the true experience sitting there. We were guided over to it and I said no way, then we were sat in the lovely courtyard & I couldn't get enough of that space! Art, central fountain & greenery surrounded us and I loved it all. 

The service was fantastic & I'm even going to give a shoutout to Jason who took great care of us and was also very sweet & funny. 

The food was good, not amazing. I've definitely had better but everything also tasted better sitting in this space. We also only tried one thing but that's how it goes sometimes. We ordered the enchiladas de Langosta which were filled with lots of luscious lobster. Prices are high here but they definitely didn't gip us on the seafood. I also need to add that the portions are HUGE. We shared and couldn't even finish everything. 

The black beans lacked in flavor & were a tad undercooked. The green rice was perfect and the creamy chipotle sauce was super rich, a tad too rich for me. Overall it was good but not amazing. I needed bolder flavors but I'm still interested in going back & trying something else. The menu itself offered a lot of classics & a few unique dishes so it'll have something for everyone.
2 stars for our server and the decor. Seriously this is far from authentic or traditional. The name of the dishes are as authentic as this place can get. Way over priced for Taco Bell quality food.

First time here and I received excellent service! I was greeted with a warm smile by your hostess Leslie and was seated immediately. Our server Carlos and Luis  was very attentive I would definitely be coming back for the great service and the amazing food!

What can I say about Pancho's? It's a beautiful restaurant which 100% takes me back to Mexico. 
Food wise the chicken chimichanga was absolutely delicious. It was enormous so I couldn't eat it all. However it made a great leftover meal the next day. 
Definitely give this place a chance and I'll be updating my review after I stop in for drinks soon.

What a beautiful restaurant that must have cost millions to build . 
We were looking forward to a upscale Mexican restaurant to compete with Javier's at Aria. 
What we got was no better than an average at best Mexican restaurant .
Food quality was fair , drinks were fine but expensive and finally desert was poor .
I expect this restaurant to last as long as the investor figures out that money needs to go into the kitchen and not just the entertainment . 
Hope it improves and they figure it out .

Best Mexican in Vegas. I asked to go there for my birthday Twice in the same week. I had seven people mad at me because it was 30 minutes away. But when we got there and saw the food they all told me it was a good choice. I loved the one in Manhattan Beach Ca. and they didn't disappoint and even had some of the same employees from Ca.. I see people complain about the price but the portions are really BIG. You can easily split a burrito and it would be plenty for 2 people. They also have a huge bar.

First off, if you are looking for the same michoacan garbage that is all over this city don't bother. This is Cali Mex, through and through. Fresh ingredients, clean flavors. Also, it's not cheap so if you're offended by a $19 plate of solid mexican food, go elsewhere. For some reason people will pay that for just about any other type of food here without thinking about it but when it comes to mexican food, they think it should be cheaper. I completely disagree but if that's your take, go hit Roberto's & eat half warm food out of a Styrofoam carton.

Salsa here is slightly chunky with great fresh flavor. You are not going to find runny "hot sauce" here. We both ordered the combination plates and there was not a single item that we didn't absolutely love. I especially enjoyed the cheese enchilada which almost had a creamy cheesy consistency & husband especially liked the beef tacos with shredded beef which were encased in a perfectly cooked corn shell, not too hard & not too soft. We also had a half-order of the guacamole which again was incredibly fresh tasting & didn't included a bunch of shredded lettuce at the bottom that many restaurants use as filler. 

The service was incredible (shout out to Jason & his manager) and the interior was beautiful with lots of plant life. It gave the impression you were sitting in one of San Diego's great mexican restaurants.

It's completely refreshing to have an alternative to most of the other nuevo mex & michoacan you'll find in this city. We'll definitely be back!!!

Very good !! We've been in NV for 11 years and could not find a Mexican restaurant  in the valley that compared to California  style food and we finally found this place ....loved it!!! The atmosphere  is super nice too!!!

The was a disappointment. The interiors are fabulous and the margaritas where good but unfortunately 3 out of 4 of us were not happy wth our meals at all. It's over priced too. The server was nice but it took her nearly an hour to take our order. I hope they figure it out because it's a great location and as mentioned they've put a lot into the interiors.

Beautifully designed building with nice decor inside. The service and food were good but the prices were way to high!!! 

$13 for a margarita $18 for enchiladas!! 

Was looking forward to this place being a regular for Mexican food but not at these prices. Disappointing

My family and I went here after a long day of shopping. The service was good, and chips and salsa were fresh. The food was very good, but on the pricey side. The kids menu alone was $10.00 ( this is the reason for 4 stars). We would definitely go back as we have been unable to find a quality Mexican restaurant in Vegas.

I have been there twice, once just last week and it will be my last.    The food is very average and very expensive.  The looks of the building are nice.  The salsa is great.  The chips mediocre.  The service in the bar area last week was very slow even though it was not busy.  The server  did not seem to care much.  The bar stools at the high top tables are very uncomfortable.   You are paying for the building and the location not the food.   The food does not justify the cost.

I really wanted to like this place. We had not heard great things just by word of mouth but my mom had a coupon so we tried it out. We normally eat at frijoles or frank and Fina's for Mexican. I had the wahoo fish tacos and the fish was dry and not flavorful.  There was a sauce to put on it but it had a skin on top of it because it had been sitting so long and the beans were almost cold. The best thing we ate everyone agreed was the fries with the chicken strips my daughter got. The chicken pipian received a frown from my husband the shrimp tacos were again just OK. The cheese appetizer had cream cheese in it? The taquitos were OK. The service was good it was loud and my husband says the beer was good. I could imagine going to try happy hour maybe that would be a better experience but with the coupon the bill was 130 before tip. I don't mind paying but not when I leave hungry because the food was almost inedible.
Yummy!!! Love this place! I'm a huge Mexican food lover and this ticks all the boxes! Yum yum yum!

First time here... Food was fantastic!!!! Very cool decor inside, tables are spread apart so there is a sense of privacy! 
Lunch crowd wasn't too bad although I felt like the food could have been served faster.  Service was great and everyone was so friendly and on top of it.
Highly recommend "Birria Chef Ramon".... Delish

Went here with my aunt. It's one of her favorite places. 

The decor/atmosphere was really nice. The service was good. The food looked and smelled amazing...but was really just ok tasting. 

I'm kind of a Mexican food snob as it's my all time favorite food on the planet and eat it several times a week, both at home and at various restaurants.

Since it was my aunt's favorite new place since it opened I had really high hopes. So I was a little disappointed that it was only ok tasting.

It was VERY expensive too! Lunch for 2 with a margarita each was around $60 with tip! Come on! That's way too much for two people for mexican food.

The decor is nice and our server was attentive. I had a margarita and it was not good for $9.75 I'd expect better. The food was not very good. It lacked seasoning and was luke warm.  It seems like they try to cover up bland food with sauces and or salsa. For the flavor and portion size this place is over priced. We came here because I wanted to try it for my birthday. My husband low key told them it was and they did nothing. Too bad! Nice place but not worth the money.

Awesome service, great food and ambience. Their taquitos and chicken tacos were amazing and so were the rice & beans. They have a bar making all drinks so they're all top notch quality which was awesome, I hate watered down Coke. The staff was very accommodating when I asked to move due to being sat next to two screaming babies in a small room. The price was reasonable for the area, around $20 a person.
Decent food- but waaaaaaaay too expensive for Mexican food. Ridiculous. Juan's Flaming Fajitas is much better food. We won't be back.
Alfredo was the best waiter! Great margaritas Cadillac w/chili rim , try the beef  Colorado was awesome  must ask for bean dip on the house ! Best Mexican in Vegas !

Grossly overpriced, very small portions, and sub-standard ingredients.  I ordered a shrimp and crab chimichanga, which cost $21.95.  For that price, I expected large shrimp and chunks of crab meat, and a reasonably substantial menu item.  Instead, I was served the smallest chimichanga I've seen in any Mexican restaurant, filled with tiny bay shrimp and a miniscule portion of finely shredded crab meat.  My wife ordered nachos with no meat, at a cost of $15.95.  They were half the size of those served at Nacho Daddy for the same price.  My wife and I visit Mexican restaurants for dinner at least twice a month, and have patronized most of the Mexican restaurants in town.  If this wasn't the worst Mexican food experience we've encountered, it certainly comes close.  We will never again be a patron of Pancho's, and would not recommend that restaurant to anyone craving a good dining experience.  It's ashame that the proprietors didn't put as much thought into the food quality and menu pricing as they did regarding the facility's d√©cor

We had a coupon for a buy one meal get one free so decided to try it. Sitting in the atrium area is nice, but if you sit anywhere else it's very plain. Food prices were double compared to other restaurants in town (Ricardo's, Jalisco's etc.) Was surprised and disappointed they didn't serve Horchata. Their normal salsa was heavy on the garlic. Service and food were just ok, nothing spectacular. I've had better Mexican food at other places. Would I go back...probably not.

Service is awesome.  Food is pretty good. We felt it was just an upscale  expensive version of an everyday Mexican restaurant. The guac was yummy, so were the Enchiladas Suizas. The Tacos de Tinga were a let down. Overall we would come again.

I have been waiting for this restaurant to open for a while, anticipating the great costal Mexican food that Panchos is famous for.  When I finally dined there the place was really underwhelming. First of all there is no carpet in the restaurant & it sounds like a warehouse. I ordered a chili verde burrito which is a staple in Mexican kitchens & it seemed that the pork was cooked separately from the sauce which enables them to use it with multiple sauces. The pork in Chile Verde should be cooked or braised in the sauce which emparts meat juice in the sauce. This unctuous experience was totally absent at Panchos & considering my companions mediocre dish I most definitely will not return to Panchos. This is a classic Americanized Mexican restaurant and I strongly prefer to eat at more authentic eateries!

We had appetizers which were ok, followed by lunch for each of us. I will start by saying that the best tasting appetizer on the combo plate were the chicken wings.  I had the burrito ranchero and found it to be bland and mushy in texture. The service was also lacking.  Our server was ok, but there was a long wait between the appetizers and lunch service, so long that we thought they may have forgotten our order. Did not feel that it was worth the $65 tab and do not plan to return.

We wanted to try this place since it opened and decided to go early at 5pm on a Saturday. It was completely dead! The atmosphere was great. It's really nice inside. There is a fountain, tall trees with lights and little birds hanging from the ceiling. Very cute! Unfortunately that's about all this place has to offer. The food and drinks are outrageously priced! My combination plate consisted of a cheese enchilada and a chicken tamale, rice and beans and it was $18.95! My husband got a combination plate with a taco and chicken tamale and it was also $18.95. He had a soda and I had water and our bill was $42, with tip it was $50. The food was not good. The tamales were very dry. My cheese enchilada had no taste to it. My husband said his taco was ok. I think Roberto's has much better food. We checked in with the Yelp app and we got a coupon for a free Fried Ice Cream. We thought ok, how can you mess up fried ice cream right? Wrong! It came in a fried tortilla shell bowl sitting in some dark brown watery substance. We had no idea what it was. Was is chocolate? Still have no idea. It kinda tasted like oil, cinnamon, sugar and a tad bit of caramel. We tried to spoon out some ice cream and it flipped over because it was a round ball floating in this strange substance. It tasted ok, but not like any fried ice cream I've ever had. 
Maybe I'd try this place again but not for food. Maybe for a drink in the bar. They really need to drop their prices. Just because it's located in Downtown Summerlin doesn't mean it should be overpriced. I'd rather go down the street to Macayos for much better food and half the price.
Same story as others have written.. Beautiful interior, below average food and extremely expensive. 'Nuff said...

Best place to eat real Mexican Food in Las Vegas. 
Miguel was our waiter and gave us excellent service. Would recommend to anyone that goes to Las Vegas.

If you want good sit down Mexican food this is definitely the place to go. Service was wonderful and although prices are a little steep the amazing food made up for it. Had ceviche to start then a delicious carne asada quesadilla and some enchiladas. Plus it's a cute place so nice for dates or even small family dinners. Best all around that I've had in Vegas

Beyond friendly service. Claudia, our server, was so helpful and attentive. Better than jar salsa and fresh chips beforehand (which they will gladly replenish while you wait). Portions are ENORMOUS (which is probably why they are on the pricey side). The Burrito Ranchero came fully loaded with rice and beans inside with an amazing cheese- blend topping and shredded beef. The Chimichanga Especial is crispy and delicious. The pork melts in your mouth. It comes with enough rice and beans to feed at least another person (did I mention the enormous portions?). 
A large but not crowded-feeling space. The tables, while plentiful, and not on top of each other.  Can't wait to come back.

Tacos De Camarones was bland & lacked flavor, not exaggerating!  Really disappointed, as there was no authentic flavors to taste. Took to long to receive our order.  The sitting is awkward as we sat in the corner, our view from the courtyard was blocked by oversized plants ..  Won't be returning ..
Good food, beautiful ambience, and great service!!  Will definitely be back!!  Loved reading about the history of the place.  If you are in Downtown Summerlin, check this place out!!

Beautiful  restaurant in Summerlin,  but I think  you  pay for ambiance not the food. Food is alright but way overpriced.  I prefer Casa Don Juan to Pancho's, I  don't think I'll try it again. Wait staff is very friendly but kind of slow.

I was soo excited for the restaurant to open since it looks so beautiful and it was much needed in this area.   The interior is gorgeous with the plants, fountain and grand staircase.  The food and service also didn't disappoint. I loved every bite.   BUT, the prices are too expensive.  $10 for a basic KIDS meal that doesn't include the kids drink.   A side of rice was $6.  I had the basic beef taco and cheese enchilada for $17.  These were LV "STRIP" prices.

Three classmates reuniting after 50 years at Panchos.  The place is awesome, colorful expressing the ethnicity. The food is very delicious, most and above all Cesar was smiley greeting us in a very friendly manner.  He did the utmost to make our reunion a very pleasant and happy event.  Cesar deserves FIVE stars.

This was my first time at Pancho's & I absolutely loved it! Our waiter Alfredo was awesome. He was personable, professional and on point! The customer service from the entire wait staff was on their A-Game. The bar tender Daniel was a mixologist & a great personality. 
The food was amazing! The flat iron steak in the quesadilla was oh so tender & authentically flavorful. The chips were warm, lightly salted & salsa  refreshing. Eating their food was like a party in my mouth!
From the food to the customer service to the decor & live music, I will be returning to this wonderful restaurant.

The service here was over and beyond. Everyone you encounter is kind and thoughtful. I wanted a lemonade as I am pregnant but didn't want a fountain lemonade. The server offered to have a fresh one made for me and made sure I was happy with the custom order. He left some extra for me on the table so I could have a refill. Manager came over and made small talk with us at the end of our meal. Found out we were expecting and gave us a complimentary dessert. Food was good too but service was memorable. Genuinely nice people.
First time here, love the fresh salsa and chips to start.!Food is exceptional!  Get a combination so you can try three different items. Chili relleno, taco and enchilada yummy Fun Mexican atmosphere!

Prices are high for the quality of the food. Ordered the green pork enchilada and was not impressed. Also, tried taco Tuesday in the bar area and it was a ghost town. Although our tacos were out within five minutes of ordering, they were not worth eating. They had absolutely no flavor and were greasy since the taco shells are fried. The ambience of the restaurant area is very nice, I just wish they had better food.

Went here for lunch the other day & I loved it!
Our waiter was friendly & the restaurant decor was very nice & festive.
The food was delicious & the servings were very large. We ended up needing to go boxes because we couldn't finish. Our entrees came with fruit & we got free chips & salsa before our meal came out. Our waiter even gave us a free dessert to sample afterwards!
We all left very full & satisfied!

LOVE this place!!!  This is the first Mexican restaurant in Vegas that I would actually return to.  Yes it's a little pricey, but my experience was well worth it.  Delicious food and margs, and outstanding service from everyone!  Thank you Pancho's!!

This place is not vegan friendly.  

We came here after searching for a vegan friendly restaurant. It seems like a nice place, but it is very limited on vegan options.  They cook their rice in chicken broth, which really limits the vegan options.  

The happy hour looks good and Monday evening is lady's

We had the Enchiladas with artichoke and avocado which was tasty and filling, but nothing really special.
Terrible and overpriced.  Lunch plate avg $15 a dish for a taco, enchilada and rice n beans...you have been warned

First time here, came for lunch.  I  ordered the scallop ceviche but was told it wasn't ready to be served so I settled for plain ceviche,  it was good,not great.  Their chips are NOT made in house, from a bag. My shrimp puffy tacos were incredible and my husband had the philly burrito, he says it was good but again not great.   The restaurant is a beautiful work of art.

Second time here,  just keeps getting better.  The food still delicious,  cocktails on point.  Celebrating my son's birthday and couldn't have chosen a better place.  I come for the food, love the decor but the service is what it should be.  We dined at the bar,  the bartender was all over it, we even met a regular who joined us and covered our tab (thank you again) but now I know why he is a regular.  I too now will make this my must stop by when in Vegas spot.

Happy hour is below average. Most appetizers $7+ beers and margaritas $5.50+. A little under staffed.

Large portions, mostly deep fried and quesadilla's. One salsa option with the free chips.

Live music a plus on Mondays.

Awesome service. I stumbled upon this randomly looking for a happy hour spot and everything from the food and drink to the service was great. We sat in the cantina and our waitress was able to balance all the tables without sacrificing the quality of service.

Also: The mole is top notch here!

2nd time here... food is either THE best or a very close 2nd for Mexican in Las Vegas. Chips and salsa are really good. The shredded beef they use in tacos and the burrito ranchero is really good. It's priced a little higher than most but you're in Summerlin, not the "historic district".
Food was very bland and very boring it came out in less than 5 min????  So it's not made to order?

Celebrating my mothers 79th birthday was a real treat here. 
The food and service was great. 
And so were the drinks. 
Prices very good. 
Ambiance was great. 
Would definitely return again. 
Even had a coupon for buy one get one free. 
A great bargain and deal all around.

I could not tell you how the food was, as I guess we were not good enough to be served.  This one star rating is strictly for service.  Upon arriving and being seated, my party and I waited approximately 10 minutes after being seated before we were brought chips and salsa.  We are still awaiting the arrival of our water, or even for a waiter to ask if we would like a drink.  It was time to go when we watched as a party of 5 was seated and immediately OUR waiter proceeded to take their drink and appetizer order before they could even push their chairs on all the way.   Terrible service,  which is huge in terms of the dining experience.  

As frequent visitors to Summerlin, always looking to try new eateries, especially Mexican food,  the lack of service received today at Pancho's was repelling to say the very least.

Eh.  It's ok.  

First impressions are great - it is a *beautiful* restaurant with a nice interior "courtyard" with a big staircase and nice fountain.   Service was also very solid, polite and efficient.   So why three stars?

The food was extremely generic and somewhat flavorless.   The chips tasted like they were out of a bag, the salsa had almost no flavor and each entree was just "meh".    I had a cheese enchilada and taco combo.  I've had tastier microwave Mexican.   There wasn't anything wrong with it, but you would have a better experience at any chain Mexican restaurant. 

The other big issue is the insanely high prices.  Expect to pay $17-20 for items that would be $9-11 at most other restaurants.   If the food was unique and flavorful this would be OK... but what we had?  Meh.

Best Mexican food in Vegas 
Friendly serve fresh food 
A+++++
Abbott is also making customers are happy 
Best Mexican food since the old Richardos was at the meadows

This is so far, my favorite Mexican restaurant in Vegas. I ordered the Pancho's combination plate and it was huge proportions. One deep fried beef taco, perfect chile rellano and cheese enchilada. Came with rice and refried beans cooked to perfection. Their classic margarita was strong and in a large glass too. Soda comes with your own tableside pitcher  for refills. The deep fried ice cream was covered in what looked like corn flakes but it was a chewy and I wouldn't order that dessert again. So 4/5 stars but I will be back.
Super cute atmosphere and the food was really good. Great service. Not sure why there are mediocre reviews about this place. Maybe they stepped up their game? Will be back. It's my new favorite!
Fun atmosphere, nice decor! Shrimp Diablo Puffy tacos great, carme asada really nice! The place to go for a birthday with the obligatory sombrero!

Pancho's rounds up to 4/5 stars due to its beautifully crafted location, but mediocre service and food.

Location: 5/5
This place is gorgeous.  There is plenty of beautiful art to gaze upon as you graze on your complimentary nachos.  There was live music when we came in about an hour and a half until closing, and it really lifted the atmosphere of the place.

Service 2.5/5
Our server was not very attentive to our table.  We didn't get our water until after our food came out, and we had to ask another waiter to get it.  I feel that many of the reviews have felt that the price for the food is a bit steep.  I wouldn't complain about the price if the service was a little better.

Food 3/5
I would say the food is about the same quality of food you would get from a Cheesecake Factory.  Again, the price is a bit steep for the quality of service that we received, but the live music and ambiance helped me forgive this.

Overall 3.7/5

We (about 5 of us) had our first visit to Pancho's last week Saturday. It is a beautiful place inside and out. We decided to sit in the cantina for the live entertainment. 

The food was a bit pricey but tasty. We ordered the queso fundido as an appetizer, seafood chimichanga, chicken chimichanga, seafood enchiladas, and langosta tacos. Our favorites were the queso fundido and their house salsa.  

The singer/keyboardist was amazingly talented and takes requests. He was a total crowd pleaser.

We already have plans to go there again tomorrow night. We are looking forward to another Saturday evening of delicious food and fabulous entertainment.
Awesome restaurant. Cool enviornment. Seated immediately. Food came super fast. A little expensive so consider sharing a dish

Beautiful restaurant and a nice menu.  The enchilada in the mole sauce was a bit bland for me.  However the chicken inside was good if a bit dry.  I like this place and will be back again.  I hope the next dish is better.  This was just ok.

Our server Karisa was very nice and pleasant . I will recommend this place to my friends and family !!! 

Madison was the best server ever!! :)

I will never go back. Food is not good. Service is mediocre and we couldn't get more than a handful of chips. No one asked if we wanted anything else to drink and our glasses were empty. The owner/manager was very condescending. Lots better options in the area. This is not like the Cali location at all.

This place is amazing best service ever, never been to a full service restaurant and had that much attention, Miguel was awesome and overall the group was really good running around the tables and making sure customers not looking around for help.
Highly recommended, food was amazing too and the important thing is service.
Thanks to Pancho's Restaurant and special thank to Miguel....     ............

Received a coupon in the mail so decided to try this place out again. Glad we did! Food was awesome, service was excellent! Our server, Miguel, was very knowledgeable, helpful, & gave us lots of options! We will be back soon.

I REALLY wanted to like this place. I love Mexican food. The food was pretty tasteless, just bland. Mexican food should never be bland, right?

I've been about four times. The service has always been great for me. The restaurant is pretty, and it's in a great location. I like that they have live music in the bar!

Just don't care for the food.

My wife and I were visiting Summerlin for family from Phoenix  Arizona. We we in absolutely shock when walking into this establishment, whoever designed this place deserves a bonus. Tiles, pictures, bricks, and plants were so authentic to Mexican culture (I say this from experience in different Mexican cities). The food was amazing and portion sizes were large. Still not quite sure why people are complaining about prices, they seem more then fair given the quality of food in such an amazing establishment. 

But anyways, We went two nights in a row, the first night in the garden for a romantic evening. And our second night in town we wanted a little more upbeat tempo, so we tried a couple  local bars nearby (lazy dogs and one other) and ultimately ended up back at Pancho's in the bar area. I wouldn't suggest going into the bar unless you want a lively and active environment like we did on this night, the garden and dining will give you the relaxing experiencing you are looking for. We didn't make it in for happy hour at the bar but were told t's from 2:30-6:30- half off appetizers and margaritas. Not sure if that is all days or not.  Also the mentions comedy nights and karaoke nights but not sure which nights those are either.

In conclusion this place is spectacular and will definitely be our go to spot for future visits.

I so badly wanted to like this place. My boyfriend and I ate there last night for the second time( first time being opening week not knowingly we had no expectations! This time it was even worse! The scallop ceviche tasted way to fishy. The $15 guacamole all I could taste were the onions....we shared a the Diablo shrimp! It was doused in sauce. We didn't even eat it, didn't send it back but we will not be returning. $60 and we both left hungry

John and I went for the first time after a movie this Friday night... Huge restaurant.. Two floors... About 6:30 PM.... Told we would have to wait for a table for 15 To 30 minutes.... Had our table in 10 minutes...Had to take our margaritas from the bar.... John had the Wahoo Fish Tacos.. I had the Seafood Quesidillas... And they were both very good and the service was excellent.. Very prompt! They team serve so it was very efficient! I look forward to visiting again.

Second time in this restaurant. Food very good but service was not as great. Waiter was barely checking on us and looked confused. He messed up in my drink once but I let it pass. Not too bad to get s bad tip though. The guy tried.

Downtown Summerlin Pancho's is My new "go to" place! 
Awesome atmosphere, delicious food, fabulous staff, kid friendly, and flowing champagne on Sunday!
If you can...sit in Miguel's section and tell him Diego sent you! Especially if you have kids. 
Live music every night and margaritas that will knock your socks off!
Have fun!!

So disappointed! The service sucked, food was worse and way overpriced!!! I wish I listened to the previous reviews. We had a coupon buy one get one free ( well $16 off and nothing really under $16 lol) needless to say still not worth it! Oh and don't waste your time on the free fried ice cream as it is so hard you can't eat it!  I hope management looks at these comments and make some changes.

We came here for a late lunch on 3/12/2017. There were 6 of us in our group. We didn't have to wait long to be seated. The waiter who took our orders was efficient, patient and personable.  We really enjoyed him. Wished I had gotten his name. The food was delicious, drinks awesome and ambiance relaxing and very nice. Service fast! We all enjoyed Panchos! We look forward on coming back.

Come here recently for Fathers Day with a group of 5. I had read about this place as one of the top 15 restaurants to eat in the Summerlin area. I don't know if his Pancho's is affiliated with a location that was once in My hometown of Houston, TX but I decided to bring my dad here. Everyone seemed to have loved the food they had chosen. I had eaten my full plate before I even knew it (within 15mins if receiving it). I believe we all either got some type of enchilada or burrito. I was the only one who ordered an adult beverage and tried the cucumber-jalape√±os margarita. I initially was going to get the regular jalape√±o margarita but the server said this other one was better. Unfortunately, the taste of the cucumber completely took away the spicy kick of the margarita. I was disappointed with it being a Mexican restaurant. To be fair, maybe because Houston, TX is the best place to get your authentic Mexican food and really delicious cocktails. We live our margaritas frozen, and I've only found one place that actually makes a stellar frozen margarita here in Vegas. I would advise not to get the cucumber jalape√±o margarita- just stick to the plain jalape√±o margarita instead. Besides the good food, I think the entree's were priced almost $2 too high. I definitely would go again if ever I find a date to have dinner with

Food, service and ambiance get 4 stars.
Value gets 2 stars - IMO very overpriced.

We went tonight for dinner, had a great time! I believe that life is what you put into it. If you go with a positive attitude you have a positive experience. I agree the food wasn't the super best I've ever had. But it was good. Probably not worth the prices they charge. We're talking $18 and up for an entr√©e. But the service was great and the place is very beautiful inside as others have noted. I will post a couple of pictures, our waiter was great. And since my daughter is hearing impaired and uses sign language they even brought over another waiter who knows sign language which I thought was really nice. The manager, or at least I think it was the manager, he didn't introduce himself, came over to our table a couple of times and thanked us for coming which I thought was very nice.

My boyfriend took me to downtown summerlin for our first tome & we decided to eat here! It was beautiful to walk in the waitress was very accommodating! We ordered and got it so fast which was awesome I got beer battered fish tacos my boyfriend got a crab shrimp burrito! It was amazing and I used my yelp check in offer and got free fried ice cream it was amazing we will be back!!!!

Wow, what a
Great place for Mexican food in Summerlin. We stopped by and we're pleasantly surprised. Food great !!!! Waiter great!!!! Saturday night place is packed but no wait , we were seated immediately. Highly recommend...... GET THE FRIED ICE CREAM ..... it's to die for !!!!

Great place to meet some friends for some drinks and have good margaritas especially for happy hour. They are yelp friendly as well.  The place seems to be ran well by their management team. You can tell. I had inadvertently left something behind and they held on to it and let me pick it up even when the store was closed.

Interesting interior decor isn't enough to make up for the the over priced, under seasoned food on a recent visit. We were greeted & seated by a less-than cordial hostess in an uncomfortable table located under a large plastic plant that smacked me on my head throughout the entire meal.  We started our  meal with the guacamole appetizer. It was nothing more than a mashed up avocado with no detectable seasonings. Our three entrees (two seafood entrees and a carne asada dish were lovely to look at, but lacked anything that could be described as interesting flavor. All three dishes required us to look to whatever we had on our table (leftover chip salsa and salt) to perk things up. Three house margaritas at $11 each were as nondescript as our food. Our notably underwhelming dinner for three including a shared appetizer and three house margaritas was $105, not including tip. While not entirely an unpleasant experience, it wasn't worth the price if tasty Mexican food is an expectation.

Pancho's is a great option for Mexican fare in the Downtown Summerlin area near Nordstrom Rack and Trader Joe's. After receiving a coupon in the mail for a BOGO entree, we decided to try it out and are happy we did.

First, the restaurant looks like a house and the main dining room has a courtyard feel. It is open and full of fake plants and trees (it's a bit much). Our server was polite and the server assistant also quickly came with their chips and salsa. Pancho's salsa was excellent with a nice kick and their chips were good as well. I ordered the wahoo fish tacos and my partner got a very large burrito of some kind. My tacos were also excellent and he said the burrito was great too! I did order a house margarita on the rocks and it was just ok. It was quite strong, not really that good, and was over $10! This was for their house margarita! To me, this is a bit overpriced, especially if the house margarita doesn't consist of premium ingredients.

All in all, we will definitely be back to Pancho's. My fish tacos were really quite good and I love a good salsa. I will definitely not order the house margarita and wish they would clean up all the clutter in the dining room as far as the fake plants and such. Again, the service was quite friendly and that will always being us back again and again.

Decor and atmosphere was very nice. I didn't like the tortilla chips they served bec they were too thick; made them hard to chew on. The food was good but overpriced. Considering the location, I guess they have to charge more to pay for rent. I don't know how long they can survive when appetizers start around $13 and main course is $18-20. I mean guacamole dip was $13..isn't that pricey for guacamole? I don't think I would go back just bec of the price.

This is not my 1st lackluster experience here, but it's at least my last. I really JUST wanted 2 hard chicken tacos. I was told I would have to order a combo plate to get them crunchy. That made precisely zero sense but I didn't feel like debating it. I'll be honest, I didn't check the price. Those 2 tacos (chicken, lettuce, cheese, pico) & a half a cup of rice & beans came to a whopping $19 pre-tip. I will pay for scrumptious food. Unfortunately, this was not. The chicken did not have a morsel of flavor & the beans were overcooked. It's also worth noting that making up the salsa were so many huge chunks of what looked like stewed tomatoes that I could have used them to make homemade pasta sauce. & there was so much cilantro in the salsa that it may as well have been a side salad. My assessment? Save your money & hit up Taco Bell.

I really enjoy Mexican food but this spot had me focusing myself to stop eating it was so good. The service was on point as well. I would and will be coming back. They also have entertainment in the evenings.  The have comedy and music and a bar area to watch sport events.

The architect and decor is beautiful but is definitely way overpriced. The food is bland nothing special. Based on the pricing I would rather head to the strip, then eat there again.. nothing special. Reviews were right

Food was decent not spectacular.   Prices are a bit over prices.  Margaritas were very good and the fajitas as well.  Enchiladas were decent not amazing. Atmosphere is amazing however the manager is a bit to friendly.   Very nice but I think he wanted my friends wife.
Visit #2, 11/27/2016: Tried the Mole Enchilada and Chorizo Quesadilla - both delicious! Our new favorites!  Service still excellent :)

Absolutely fantastic customer service. The best I've experienced in a long time. The ambiance was light bright and spacious. The food is definitely expensive but I will be returning because it was delicious, the service was impeccable and the general feel of the place is relaxing and chill.

TL;DR - overpriced for mediocre food. 

While their website says people love this place I can't say we had s good experience.  A friend went to pickup and order.  Strike #1, they don't take orders over the phone.  My friend went to the bar and ordered without looking at the menu since we did that online.  Strike #2, no prices online.  I get this for really expensive gourmet restaurants, but not Panchos, really?  He gets the food and the bill.  $127 before tip for 4 people!  He gets home and tells us this fact and eat only to find out that the food is DEFINITELY not worth the price we paid.  Strike #3, cost to value of the food is NOT worth it.  Major fail!  We will never go back or recommend this place.  The food was decent but the price was about twice what it should have been for most of the things we ordered ($15 for Guacamole, $20 for two fish tacos, $17 for two beef tacos w/ rice and beans...).  I'll continue to go to Lindo or Frijoles!
The food is not good. The margaritas are made from a mix and not good... I could not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Roommate and I had been wanting to try this place for a while and finally decided to go in today. The decor is fabulous! 
I'm a little surprised people are saying the food was overpriced. I ordered a combo plate with an enchilada and a taco, my roommate ordered a combo of 2 chicken tacos. Both had huge portions of rice and beans, and the tacos were served with guac and sour cream. We each got a Diet Coke and the bill was $39 and some change, roughly $20 each before tip. The value of the food for the price was as expected, and not outrageously over priced - to those people I would say that if you can't afford to eat out, simply stay at home; cook and serve your own food if you don't want to pay for it. 
As far as the actual food goes, it was very good. I've been looking for good Mexican food in Las Vegas ever since I came from California, I finally found it! :)

Well now! We went to Pancho's when it first opened and I must say that this place has really really gotten it's act together! Chips and salsa appeared on the table, the Margarita's are nice and mid strong and the food oh the food! GREAT portions and home made just like back home in New Mexico. I had the Trios Los Panchos and it was HUGE! This plate has the chicken, beef and cheese enchilada covered with special sauce (chili)  with sour cream and rice and beans. The beans are home made and the chicken was sooo tender! We had the Tres Leche cake for dessert and YUMMMMY! Light and fluffy milk cake with whipped creme frosting. The service was wonderful and our waiter Jose answered all questions regarding the spiciness of the food. Great atmosphere as the plants are real and the sound of a water fountain adds to the enjoyment of your meal. A definitely great dining experience!!

Came here last night for dinner and WOW. I had Pollo AL Diablo, the sauce had so many layers of flavor ending with a nice spicy note. The margaritas well I tried five different variations and they where all perfect. The entertainment in the bar was kinda surprising, you would think the would have native Mexican music, but it was not but the group was very good. During their break they stop by the table and chitchated a bit. The wait staff again perfect. The restaurant is beautifully decorated. The price was, for what I had, the entertainment was spot on.

A little pricey but it was worth it. I had their grilled fish tacos and really enjoyed it the portions were good since and the fish was not over done and flavorful.  The service was average my glass was kept full and chip basket was never empty.

Had a wonderful experience at Ponchos over the weekend. Stopped by for Happy Hour which is a huge plus on the weekend when most places in town don't. Tasty stuff drinks and exceptional tacos, a must if you're in Downtown Summerlin abs looking for a spot with good eats. I will make sure to bring my friends and family next time they come into town to visit.

Excited about eating here after our experience at Manhattan Beach location. But, alas... a huge disappointment.
    Service was excellent. Tortilla chicken soup was great! But, that's it. If you want to pay lots for average dinner, then this is the place.
Went for Sunday brunch with a group and had a great time. From the chips and salsa to the bloody mary and fried ice cream we enjoyed everything Ponchos has. Great location and atmosphere as well

Great atmosphere, pricey but good food. Beautiful live plants everywhere so it feels like a tropical garden somewhere in Mexico so A+ for the environment. Over estimated wait times so don't let it scare you away if they say 45 mins in my experience it was more  like 10-15 mins. Guess they're just covering their bases. Great location on DT Summerlin, near Trader Joes.

Overrated restaurant. Went with my 16 year old son. Inside is nicely decorated. Very relaxing......until you crack open the menu! No entrees under $17.95. Had the burrito. No flavor for "authentic." They could have taken the time to add some flavor to the dish. very bland. Didn't want to use any more sodium that was more than already in the dish. Very large portion. Surrounded with some sort of a white sauce. Took $40 and could only get the dinner, with no drinks...soda or beer. Way overpriced, won't go back.

This restaurant was amazing! Everything from the atmosphere to the staff and food was refreshing! The salsa is made fresh ever day and is so tasty. You might think the prices are a little high but the food is large in quantity and great quality. Our server Cynthia was a breath of fresh air. Marcos our bus person was on top of his game and very pleasant as well. Definitely will be back!
Awful service!  Way over priced, and over rated.  We didn't even stayed to eat.  We we sat and ignored for over 15 minutes.  Never going back.

I think the food is excellent. It comes as close to Southern California Mexican food that I have found to date in Las Vegas. The red sauce particularly on the oven burrito is delicious. I would eat here weekly, but there prices are a bit high. Certainly a restaurant to have on your short list!

We were really hoping to like this place because of its location. It's really a nice setting but that's about it. Ordered the enchiladas and really couldn't taste anything but bland red sauce. I am no expert but this was not like any other Mexican food I ever had.  Nice people but we will be finding a different place.

Where do I start. I had high hopes for this place due to the time it took to built and the pictures I've seen about the inside. Went their for lunch and had a steak quesadilla, chips n quac, and an iced tea. Total came out to $37. Flavors were meh and the service was good (sat at the bar). Won't be coming back because of the price.

Love the way the place looks. 

The food was great! Great waiters!

Guacamole was too expensive though...

But overall I would come back!
Food is good, service was excellent. I ate there twice, the second time they didn't make us pay for my dinner, mine was free for bringing my friends along who were visiting from LA. That was so cool

I very much enjoyed this restaurant. Visited during happy hour. Our server was bubbly and pleasant. We had margaritas (my friend had their kiwi flavoring that was fantastic), and a appetizer sampler. There was way more food then two people could eat, and it was delicious.

Pretty good Mexican food.  On my combination plate, the cheese enchilada, rice and beans were all prepared and presented as they should be, and I enjoyed them.  The chicken tamale, however, was not as good; it had large chunks of chicken breast which were dry and not especially flavorful.  I normally steer clear of chicken dishes in a Mexican restaurant, but that was the only kind of tamale they served and I had a hankering for a tamale.  My mistake.

The guacamole was plentiful and tasty, but with just a bit too much lime juice.  The salsa had way too much cilantro for my taste.  But the prices were reasonable, and the decor was pleasant.  The service was okay.  Our waiter was sometimes a little difficult to find, and there is more to friendly service than simply addressing the table as "mi amigos," but I really wasn't expecting the level of service at Le Cirque, so it was fine.

If I lived in Summerlin, I would go back to Pancho's.  But since it is a bit of a schlep from Spring Valley, I'll probably stick to places closer to home.  A truly good Mexican restaurant is tasty, cheap, and right around the corner.
Absolutely fantastic food, ambiance, and service. Food came out quick and everything was delicious. My new favorite Mexican restaurant. Impressed for how new they are. I'll be back for sure.

I would give it no stars if I could. Horrible tasting food. As a proud Mexican we take pride in our Dishes. These are missing taste and Items altogether. The prices are sky high. My son Ordered a personal pizza which was 1O dlrs for a microwaved Wallmart Pizza. Queso Fundido is a dish that is really hard to mess up and somehow they managed to mess that up too. They don't carry seafood!!!! What kind of Mexican restaurant does not carry seafood? Worst Mexican Restaurant I have ever been too and the worst food I've ever had. By the way this restaurant isn't ran by Mexicans either. It's just a Restaurant with a Mexican name to it to attract customers and rip them off. Don't eat there! You'll regret it. PS. They even messed up my Michelada WTF???

Bland.  Service is so so 
Too many choices on a hard to read menu. 
Food I had the veggies were undercooked. Others didn't care for their food either.

I am writing this the day after my less than stellar dining experience and I am still annoyed.  

I feel like a sucker for ignoring the overwhelmingly negative reviews of this place and giving them a chance. 

The short version is that this place sucks. Horrible food. Mediocre service and exorbitant pricing.  I promise you any other Mexican restaurant is better than this place.  EvenTaco Bell has better food

Consider yourself warned; don't waste your time or money on this poor excuse of a restaurant.

I grew up going to the one in Manhattan Beach, CA so I couldn't wait for this one to open in Summerlin, but wow you better come with Summerlin money cause this place is WAY WAY WAY overpriced!!  The decor and ambiance is amazing and the customer service was some of the best I've ever had in LV, but scallop ceviche for $20?!  I don't care how beautiful your restaurant is or how great your service is at the end of the day its still just Mexican food and just because your address is on Lavender Hill Dr. doesn't mean you can get away with those prices!  WOW!  Seriously consider before you go there because your wallet WILL feel the effects of eating there and quite frankly its just not worth it and a smack in the face to locals!

Not just your usual enchilada taco combo place!  They have that but do yourself a favor and order somethings from the specials of the house menu. You won't be disappointed. Great ambiance. Their first restaurant outside of California. Original in Manhattan Beach.
Really cozy place to eat with live music, good food, large servings and free fried ice cream when you check in with yelp and you can use a $16 off entire bill coupon that you get from the mail!

Such a great first experience!  Not only was the food really good but my 4 year old got such a nice surprise from the awesome team who sang to him and even gave us a picture of his reaction to take home with us.  The atmosphere is fun, service is wonderful and the experience will bring us back again and again.

Great atmosphere, great food, great service. 

Walking into this restaurant you feel like you are in Mexico.  The building is authentic and welcoming. Walking inside the venue is bright with windows on the ceiling. There are large plants and a water fountain as a center piece. You feel as if you are sitting outside on a patio without any bugs or bad weather to ruin your dining experience. 
We ordered a chicken chimmichamga and ranchero enchiladas and added chicken. Hands down the best enchiladas I've ever tasted. Prices are a little higher but the portion sizes make up for it. You are paying for quality and quantity. All the flavors were extraordinary. Their salsa had great flavor with a hint of heat, their coffee and iced tea tasted fresh and I couldn't stop myself from finishing my lunch even after I was full.
Servers and hosts were nice and welcoming. We never needed anything and the service team works together to make sure the guest is satisfied. 
This was my first visit here and will not be my last. I'm so happy we came in and tried a new Mexican restaurant from the norm. They offer different events on different days including taco Tuesday, live music, ect.

So I ordered the The Burrito Carnitas Especial.  And I won't lie, it was tasty.  Comes with a dollop of sour cream in the middle, with two slices of avocado on top of a burrito that is semi-glazed with some cheese sauce.

The atmosphere is nice, and so is the server, but when you had to wait about 20+ minutes for Mexican food off-Strip on a Monday night, it's either amazing, or there's something a bit wrong.

I'm actually shifting towards the latter.  The atmosphere is a great place, and perhaps they justify the cost due to it being in Downtown Summerlin.   But, there just wasn't anything enlightening about it.  Maybe it's just me.

The burrito I ordered cost about $19.  Honestly, it's probably worth about $12.  Unless the ingredients were all fresh, farm raised, organic and all that, I just don't see it.  Maybe they do... Trader Joe's is right across from there.  Somehow, I doubt it though.

Vegas isn't SoCal, and this wasn't a Strip experience.  Unfortunate.
This place was very average. Service was an almost fail and the food was ooooooook not excellent. Prices were a little steep for the quality of food. Sorry guys don't think I'll be back.
What a great place! The food was amazing! The service was outstanding! We had fantastic Margaritas! Happy 5 de Mayo! We ll be back!

This place is gorgeous, filled with artifacts from all over Mexico. Beautiful venue for a wedding or party. The food is great too. I highly recommend The Birria Chef Ramon dish, which was phenomenal. The flavors danced on my tongue Mexican songs of lament ;) the servers are great and there's an attached bar that plays sports as well as live music on the weekends. Definitely a great place to check out.

One of the most incredible parts of this beautiful place is knowing it was a parking lot a mere 6 months ago! The interior of the space is amazing! Truly transformative.

I had heard through the local grapevine they were having some opening bumps, and had decided to wait a bit to let them work it out. When recently invited to meet friends here for dinner, I thought it was perfect timing.

Right off the bat, you are greeted with big smiles, polite staff across the board.
Our waiter was awesome. All of that is perfect. 

So now you are asking....sounds great, why only 3 stars?
The reason for 3 stars is the food was really super mediocre. 
And I wanted it to be great! But, sadly it was definitely not. 
On top of being completely average, it was very expensive compared to other mexican places of this food caliber. I had an enchilada and a chili relleno, and it was just shy of $20. I could easily list 10 places that are close to 1/2 that price and better food. I suspect this is why the online menu does not have any pricing. Most people in the area will know that it is high. My sentiment regarding the food was the census at the table, no one was thrilled.

Don't get me wrong, I have NO ISSUE with a $20 entree! If the food is amazing, that is all I need to know! But here, the food is far from amazing. Bummer, because it is really a beautiful space, filled with an awesome staff!

We are originally from San Diego and have excellent Mexican food there, so it's been a little difficult finding comparable Mexican cuisine here in Las Vegas.  Ponchos was pretty good and the margaritas were very good.  The prices are a little steep from what I've had to pay for "real" Mexican food in San Diego.

There were 5 women standing at the front when we entered and not one person greeted us or asked if we needed anything. We sat ourselves in the bar area, the bartender was rude, the waitress seemed inconvenienced by having to serve us when we were the only table in her section. Food was good but over priced, and we will definitely not be returning.
Wayyyyy too expensive for mediocre food. Didn't realize how pricey it was. Won't ever dine here again. For the crazy prices they charge, I'd much rather go to Javier's!!

This is the PF Chang's of Mexican food. I don't mean it as a compliment, but I also understand the need for such places. It is regular Mexican fair at double the price. Maybe it's necessary because of the expense of the DS location. Yes, the food is good, not great, but I wasn't disappointed. The salsa actually had a kick to it. It wasn't watered down. But $15 for a burrito with no sides? I've tried to argue that I could've gotten the same burrito at Cardenas or Roberto's for half that, easy. But then again, Roberto's and Cardenas market food court isn't exactly where Summerlinites would go out for a family meal or a date. I get it.

Just look around you. How many actual hispanic people do you see there (besides the employees)? ZERO. Why would that be? I personally don't eat at Korean restaurants where there are no Koreans eating there no matter how nice the place looks. But I still gave them the benefit of the doubt because of the demographics of Summerlin. But Vegas as a whole has a big enough Hispanic community that you would see at least one person eating here on a busy Saturday afternoon if this place was really that good. The Michiochan restaurants are full of Hispanic families.

The entire decor is designed to attract the non Hispanic Summerlin crowd into thinking they're eating ethnic food without having to drive down to questionable parts of town to do so. I would rather eat at Cardenas market and get similar quality for half the price. But yes, it's not a viable option for some people. Again, I get it. So you must pay double for the atmosphere. 

But the final punch in the gut was paying $9.99 for a kids meal that was 1/3 frijoles, 1/3 rice, and 1 enchilada (or 1 taco, but to make it a fish taco was extra $). NO DRINKS included. I guess we live in Summerlin so we can afford to pay, right? It's what Upper-Middle Class people do, overpay for EVERYTHING.

The service was good, the bar was nice, but the food was not worth the cost. They brought us three flower wraps with a fajita dish the wife and I were sharing and charged us $3 dollars extra when we asked for a couple more. Go to Lindo's!!!! So much better!

Went back for a second time, today was the worst. 1 1/2 hours later food came out. There were six of us 2 meals were right the other 4 were all wrong. I think the price is to high and the food isn't worth it. $3.95 for a Coke and they give you a small glass. I will not be going back to this place :(

I'm giving Pancho's a 4 star rating because we did have a great experience. The staff was welcoming and informative, even management cake over and offered a money saving suggestion for next time. (Thanks Jimmy!)

My three littles each had enchiladas. They enjoyed them. No complaints.

I ordered Enchiladas de Avocado y Artichoke. It was lovely. Everything I could've hoped for after reading the description. My jalape√±o margarita scored a 7/10.

Hubby enjoyed some steak tacos & a beer. 

In addition to our entrees we also ordered a large Guac for the table. $15! I know we are in Summerlin but JESUS!

Our check came to $123. Roughly. Typically I wouldn't budget a dinner for the 5 of us for over $80. Fortunately I snagged a coupon for 1 free entree and left a $24 tip. So $130 out the door.

So to break it down for you:
Expensive. Great service. Good quality (fresh) food. Don't expect authentic Mexican cuisine. 
The restaurant itself is BEAUTIFUL. 

We will probably avoid coming back with the littles and stick to the happy hour and bar areas for just the two of us. Big savings over there.

I highly recommend dining here! David was our server and he did a fantastic job!! They have been open for 3 days and I give them a tremendous amount of respect for the how efficient they were! The food was fantastic! Summerlin definitely needed this gem of a restaurant! A big shout out to David, Sam, Hugo, Abbott & Doug! They made the evening run so smoothly considering how packed they were!

So this my deal with Panchos.  Our food was delicious. Everyone enjoyed the meal. Salsa was quite delicious. But, and it's a big deal, it's just too pricey. Everything was priced like a restaurant in one of the top Strip hotels. $7.50 for a Mexican draft beer. About $20 for a carne asada chimichanga. $23 for a marinated pork dish. Everything tastes great and the service was on point. But $130 for four entrees, two sodas and four beers is just way too expensive for a standalone Mexican restaurant, even in Summerlin. They need to rethink their pricing in my opinion, if they want to be around as long as Lindo Michiocan or Frank & Finas.

Just too expensive to rate higher than 3 stars.

Beautiful atmosphere food not bad but so not worth high price tag. I know this is in Downtown Summerlin where rent is high but... 90% of meals are over 15.00 Ridiculous! Two tables came in reviewed menu and I heard them also talking about the high prices. The lowest thing is a plain burrito at 13.95.  So - they started sending out coupons 2 for 1 for dinners but there's s catch.. you have to order two drinks. Watch it a simple soda is 3.75 each! Lol so u really get 8.50 off of highly expensive meals. Really only 50% off your second meal. 

Lower ur prices your not that great of food  and I was around people not coming back again.
The decor and location are nice but the food was not good. We had ceviche and enchiladas...no bueno!

Restaurant is beautiful, all our family had great hopes the foods was gonna be as nice as its looks, chips and salsa is OK but when the food came wow 25 dollar carne asada steak really bad quality it tasted like liver very dry and leathery, my wife had chicken and was undercooked and the flavor was horrible all of us left the food almost untouched, prices are high, service is not good and the food is terrible, if u are in a diet come to panchos because u end up eating nothing

The food I got was delicious. My husband's was too. I had the quesadilla..husband got the carnitas enchiladas. I do admit the prices were high, but what do you expect? You're in summerlin. Restaurant managers checked up on us which was awesome because that's what they should be doing! Pablo was our server and he was absolutely amazing and efficient. The bus person in his station (I'm sorry, I didn't catch his name) was attentive as well. Seriously, ask for Pablo!

Came here for the first time cause we felt like some New Mexican food. Was greeted by very friendly staff and even more friendly
Restaurant manager! Was taken care of the entire time by an attentive staff. Will definitely be recommending this place to friends and family! Food is a little pricey, but delicious nonetheless and made up for it in taste. You get free chips and salsa with your meal which is rare at a lot of Mexican restaurants nowadays.

As someone else pointed out, I gave two stars for the environment. Food is definitely overpriced. I wouldn't mind the price as long as the quality can back it up. Unfortunately, Pancho's fails to deliver. Service was extremely slow and the food was mediocre. It's perfect for a tourist from the Midwest or Eastcoast that has never experienced "good" Mexican food. I will stick to Viva Mercado or Juans Flaming Fajitas when I need my fix.
This is my new favorite mexican restaurant!  Food was amazing, staff was incredible!  Love the ambiance, and cant wait to come back!

Excellent service. Good food. I had a cold so I want to come back when my taste buds can really taste.  Had a nice little duet in the bar.  Served a full menu in the bar. Our server was Helen and she was great.  I would recommend that you try it.

Pancho's is by far my favorite Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas. They have great service, a beautiful atmosphere, and incredible food! I've tried several dishes but always go back to the Chimichanga Especial.   The fried ice cream is a must have!

Atmosphere was really cool and nicely decorated.  Chips and salsa were great. A few items on the menu are a tad pricey for a restaurant not being located on the Las Vegas strip. Guac is 14.95 and a side of beans is 5.95. I work on the strip over looking the strip itself and our guac is 8.95 and a side of beans is 1.50. So I was a bit blown away by some of the prices here. Our server Brian was great and very friendly.

Ended up here last minute for lunch. The decor inside really does remind you of a Mexican villa, beautiful! Service was fast, salsa was a little water down but they were quick to refill our chips/ salsa every time. 
I got the enchiladas Del Mar with crab and bf got the pancho combination. Food was delicious and they don't skimp on portions or meat! My enchiladas were overstuffed with crab. 
Biggest complaint was the prices are high especially compared to Viva Mercados...guess your paying extra for all that decor and being in Summerlin. Also wish entrees came with soup fideo and kinda weird all the food comes from upstairs.

This place has outstanding food and amazing service. Really good margaritas and highly recommend the white sangria.

Very attentive staff!! The manager Doug saw that one of our dishes was a little too spicy for my girlfriend and instantly came over to exchange it just to ensure we were both happy with our meals.  He was extremely kind and funny. (Awesome glasses by the way.) Jorg√©, our waiter, was great!!!

I highly recommend this place. We will definitely be back thanks to the amazing service here!!
Amazing "Rajitas" (fajitas) ! Salad was very tasty! Fried ice cream was delicious ! Highly recommend eating here.
Place has a great atmosphere and the service was super friendly. The manager gave all the kids coins to throw into the fountain. Food was ok and seemed a little pricey.

Great food.  Very good service. We are picky about food and I am especially picky about Mexican food in Nevada.  I am from southern California and the mex there is far superior for the moat part.
Pancho's is one of the best Mexican restaurants I have been to in Las Vegas in the 14 years I have lived here.
Nice ambiance and decor.  An over all fine dining experience.   Prices are right on for a upscale mex resturaunt.

This was the worst food I've ever had in my entire life. I always tend to to give the Benefit of the doubt to everyone when I'm first trying their food out, but on top of the food being disgusting & making me have food poisoning. They took so long to serve us!!! They even gave us the wrong check & the manager was walking around with our cards through out the whole restaurant for like 5-7 minuets!!!! All I have to say is HORRIBLE FOOD & horrible service. I'm Mexican & I know how Mexican food tastes like... and that wasn't it. ANDD.... the food is WAY over priced for some disgusting ass food. We spent $70 bucks on 3 people. Just horrible.

Food was just ok (they seem to have a fear of salt). Service was friendly but god awfully slow for a restaurant that was nearly empty at 8pm on a Sunday. The prices reflect the venue but definitely not the food or service. 

Chips needed salt. Took forever to get more salsa.  Had to have the manager go ask someone to get it. 

Had the mole enchilada...no good rich mole flavor. More like a bland and somewhat gritty sauce. 

Used the yelp offer for free fried ice cream. This was not fresh, probably one of a batch from early in the day or say before. Ice cream was hard frozen and icy in the middle and the cornflakes were chewy. 

Overall, for as well known as this place is in SoCal, this Vegas location needs help. The lack of crowds is showing it.

So Pancho's... I thought it was ok. I really liked the inside. Layout is cool, decorations are interesting and I love Downtown Summerlin right now. That is my list of impressive though. The menu looks good but nothing stood out. I get the vibe of just another tired Mexican spot. Trouble is pricing makes you think it's fancy (hint, it's not). The food was good but not on par with the cost. I'm a guy who doesn't mind paying more if there is value but I left feeling shorted. 

Add to that, service was pretty bad. Not like the waiter groped my date bad but still. We were sat and promptly forgotten. The busser came by after our waiter was a ghost for 10 minutes and grabbed our drinks. Took a while to get them and had to ask for chips and salsa. Yet another delay. Our waiter finally showed up with no personality and we never saw him again. 

I'd say bring the price in line with what you get or step up the cuisine. Only time I would recommend the spot is just to check it out. After that, there are better options.

Nice new interior and attentive staff.  I agree with many of the other reviewers; the prices are a bit steep for just average Mexican food.  Our party of 2 had one Margarita, one soda,  a shared appetizer, a taco entree and a fajita entree.  The bill including tax and tip was over $90; a bit high for the type and quality of food.  It was not bad and we will probably return but just not a WOW.  Also, this is an aside and perhaps just an issue for that evening but the bus staff was constantly bringing rolling carts of bus trays, glasses and dishes thru the main restaurant.  Our table was right in their path so we were constantly looking at carts of serving and kitchen supplies as were dining.  Again, maybe this was temporary but kind of odd to have bus bins 2 feet from your entree.

Beautiful fun atmosphere, there was live music when I went in . the manager was super nice they stayed open later for our group since we got there late after coming from a kindergarten graduation ceremony that ran way longer than we thought. The manager gave all the kids coins just throw into the fountain.  Was Little disappointed that they didn't have horchata maybe there an out for the day ? I don't know maybe but I feel like Mexican restaurants should have it. Good had very good flavor and came out quick

Came to Pancho's be cause a los of My coworkers were talking a lot about it, how beautiful the place was. Came in and I was not dissapointed. The place is beautiful, took me back to when I went to M√©xico, not just the restaurant the Service and specially the Food. You guys Should try it.

Service is excellent and the chips & salsa are tasty. The food is way overpriced for the bland taste...most dinner entrees are over 20 bucks.  Server claimed everything was "authentic and made from scratch".  No way!  Margaritas are $10+. I left feeling ripped off.

Decent food. Way over priced for what it is.  Chicken fajitas were just ok. For $23 I'd expect a bit more flavor. Steak burrito was tasty. The cocktail servers uniform is a bit too revealing and their hair wasn't tied back which is really disgusting. It was good, but because of the prices, we won't be back.
Foods okay... the skinny margaritas are yummy and the live music is too much fun...

We have refrained from Pancho's based on reviews that emphasized the high price of food. Our visit was prompted by a 2 for 1 coupon.
 
The restaurant is beautifully decorated with lots of plants, water features and colorful tiles. Our server Claudia was very friendly and helpful. She was busy with several tables but checked on  our satisfaction and drink refills several times. She definitely was interested in providing great service. The Cadillac Margaritas were excellent and comparably priced. 
The complementary chips and salsa were very good. Tasty salsa with large pieces of tomato.

Shrimp Diabla Puffy Tacos consist of two flour tortillas filled with shrimp sauteed in a mild Diabla Sauce topped with shredded cabbage and chipotle.  On the side were re-fried beans, rice, salsa and guacamole. This was a very tasty taco with plenty of shrimp. 
The bean burrito was large enough for two people. 

More competition in Mexican food has arrived in Summerlin and now provides several choices. Pancho's appears to have the edge on decor but not price.

Great atmosphere, food was good but did have a major problem. We ordered nachos with shredded chicken. As my child took a bite there were sharp bones left in the chicken. It hurt my child but he ended up being ok. Management came over and addressed the situation professionally. I was happy with how they handle it but hindered our experience there. I will give second shot as everything else was good.

Wow, I had a shrimp and crab burrito. It was tasty but several hours later I was as sick as a dog. Either the filling was unrefrigerated too long and not kept hot enough or there was cross contamination. I was in the food service for 25 years and have been through food service sanitation courses twice. The restaurant is very nicely decorated and the servers were great. However it cost over $23 for the burrito and iced tea. Too much in my estimation.  I can go to a hole in the wall and not get food poisoning.

There wasn't anything that anyone of us at the table liked. I don't know what the rave reviews were about, but there wasn't anything to brag about. The prices are crazy out of this world and not worth it

One and done...

If I came to a Mexican restaurant for atmosphere...this one would win...but it trails off quickly from there.

Service is good, but the food was a let down.

Was hoping for good, received below average.

The food and the service was very good. But don't think the prices are like McDonalds. They are far from they are quite expensive but the food is authentic and fresh. The only problem I had was waiting 10 minutes and the place was half empty. I would recommend this place if my bank account was larger.
Great restaurant. The food was great and the service was too. It was a little noisy only because they had live music. Will definitely be back

The place looks awesome! But the food is not good at all... Everything that came looked good. The service was fine but the food just wasn't good. Definitely not at these prices. I got the gold Margarita... actually might be the worst Margarita I have ever had. Watered down... Almost no lime. I love Margaritas and am not that picky. I'll drink a Stations 99 cent Margarita and find a way to enjoy it. I could have died for one of those. First time I've considered sending a drink back. If you are considering eating here.... I'd pass. My wife warned me. Even then I was still disappointed. With so many choices you'd think they would have a bar to reach. Not even close... If you have a choice go somewhere else. Go. This was bad enough for me to write a review... Usually I don't write anything but it's worth saving others. My friends want to go back for taco Tuesday. Think I'll decline.

I loooooove this place 
The service is always great!!!! You can never go wrong by going here

Had such a fun time at Pancho's - it really makes you feel like you're in a Mexican hacienda! Their margaritas are delicious and the mango and chicken salad was my fave!! Looking forward to checking out Ladies' Night!
