We've been waiting for a decent Mexican restaurant in Vegas forever. The wait continues. The 2 $ rating is ridiculous! This place was WAY over priced. $10 for a kids meal? The mini pizza was the size of a bagel bite. Not great for a 9 year old. The food was so bland you could barely taste it. Took 15 minutes to get soda and another 10 minutes to get a glass of water. The staff was nice but that's where the "good" ended. The menu showed that kids meals included drinks but when the check came we were charged $3.25 for 3 kids drinks. When I asked about it, 6 people told me they weren't sure if we were supposed to be charged. Really? We definitely won't be going back there. SO NOT WORTH IT!

This is really a 4.5!
Pancho's was great. Nice place and great service. We had a party if 11 and there was plenty of room and the room were sat in was nice and loud like we are. Food was great with large portions and good flavor but is overpriced slightly.
I recommend the shrimp and crab quesadilla and enchiladas deal mar!!

OMG Mexican food has finally made it to Las Vegas!!!  I wish there was a 6 star option, because Pancho's would get it from me.   When we moved out here 6 years ago we were so disappointed with the lack of great Mexican food.  Lindo Michoac√°n and Flaming Fajitas are good options we have stuck with, but nothing is really "great" here.  Pancho' has changed that!  Their chicken tortilla soup has the flavor of my grandmother's chicken soup as the base -- the tastiest!  And the mole... yum!  I've ordered mole so many times in vegas and been disappointed that I finally gave up.  My husband ordered it because I refused to take another risk.  Boy was it excellent!  And the service was top notch.  Miguel should get an award for his friendliness.  The bussers stopped by frequently as well, and we even had the manager stop by a few times.  I can't rave enough about this place!  The brunch includes fruit and champagne as standard, even if you don't order off the brunch menu.  We will definitely be back.  I'm disappointed it took us so long to come and try it!

Stopped in on a Friday night. Was busy but there was no wait for two. Got seated right away. Walking in I was very impressed. True Spanish style decorative art and more. Got drinks pretty quickly and service was excellent. On to the food. Chips and salsa were typical. Salsa was soupy with small chunks of tomato. Had a little spicy flavor to it but it was not unbearable. Had wahoo fish tacos and cheese enchiladas for entr√©es. Fish was flavorful and came with  a creamy sauce to garnish the tacos. Cheese enchiladas were very good and better than most Mexican restaurants. Beans and rice were good but when food was delivered the beans and rice were warm and not hot. A little disappointed the hot meal ordered was not hot. The worst part of the night was when the bill came. The prices here are extremely high and not worth it.

This place was a rip off 
1. This place doesn't have agua  frescas . Come on it's a Mexican restaurant. No, let me take that back its not a Mexican restaurant it
Just looks like one . 
We had the chimichanga. For 18.95 this should have been 6.00 for bad taste and and size .
And the price I was like I'm at Mexican restaurant . 
Service was terrible . I should of checked Yelp before going  here. 
Never coming here again

What Mexican restaurant does not have Aguas frescas.. The salsa served with their chips tasted like canned salsa.. Dont get me started on the prices.. The server never came by and asked how we were doing.. i walked in with a party of 13 the place was empty and we still waited 20 min for a table.. To bad too because we live  so close...

This place is amazing! I've gone two weeks in a row for the Sunday Champagne Brunch! Sat in bar bc football was on.....  JASON is the BOMB! Service was on point!!!!!! He went above and beyond at every stop. The atmosphere was great. Food is delicious! Happy hour is a great value as well!
The food was awesome!!!!! The place looks really nice and everybody is very friendly. For sure we will come again.

After reading some of the reviews on Yelp, I wonder if those people had actually eaten at Pancho's.

First, I thought the service was excellent.  We were greeted and seated immediately.  As soon as we sat down, we were served chips and salsa.

There is a lot of food on the menu, but I don't see that as a bad thing.  There's a lot to choose from which means you don't have to get the same thing over and over when you come back.  I had the Trio Los Pancho's and they were amazing.  My girlfriend had the artichoke quesadilla and devoured it.

Some of the reviews say this place is a bit pricey, but I guess they've never eaten in Las Vegas before.  I felt the price was right on par for downtown Summerlin.

Before we left, we were greeted by the manager, Mallory, and asked about our dining experience.  Mallory was extremely receptive to our feedback and was genuinely interested in what she and the restaurant could do better.

I would highly recommend Pancho's to anyone whose looking for something other than the same ole dining experience.

Been coming to Pancho's for a couple of months, love hitting happy hour for cocktails chips and salsa and appetizers. Food is pretty darn good, the wait staff and bartenders are awesome. Love that they have live music. I recommend checking this place out, I think you will like.
The prices are exorbitant for Mexican food.  The tacos are Roberto's quality but four times the price.  The Chili Colorado is better at Tony's Mexican food for 1/3 the price.  Not coming back.

Had lunch with my mom and a friend yesterday,  absolutely love the atmosphere.  Our server Claudia was awesome and answered all our questions about the menu.  I had the ground beef enchiladas,  omg they were amazing,  hands down the best I've had in vegas in over 24 years. Definitely going back and highly recommend.
The ambiance in this place is great. Has a nice vibe. The staff was friendly. The food was okay but over priced as were the drinks.

Great service provided by CYNTHIA & DAVID!!!
Huge portions, 
BURRITO RANCHERO & TACOS CARNE ASADA!
Thanks for the good food & excellent guest service!
Awesome margarita. Muy sambroso queso.  Burrito regular so-so. Atmosphere very authentic. Cabo especial very yummy!

If you read my reviews, you know I am aware of prices and quality. Unfortunately, this place misses the mark on both. I was a guest for a business lunch recently. Thumbing through the menu, looking for the lunch menu, there is not one. Looking at the prices at the cheapest entree is $14.95 and it goes way up from there.   Strip pricing meets Downtown Summerlin.

Someone sure spent a lot of money on the building and its very nice on the inside. I ordered the two beef tacos with double rice, Tasted bland was not anything extraordinary at all.

My clients bill was $65 which was for 3 entrees and 3 iced teas- too much especially at lunch.

I am going to keep my business at Viva Mercado.

The atmosphere is great, as was the service. Unfortunately the food was just OK. Looks appetizing but lacks flavor and skimpy on the meat. Definitely overpriced for what it is. I hope the quality of the food improves because appreciate the attention they have given to everything else.  Until then, go to Mo's or Zaba's if you are at Downtown Summerlin and have a taste for Mexican food.

This place SUCKS!!! The service was horrible. I had to get up and find my waitress to ask her if we could get our drinks. No apology or anything, she simply said "yeah sure" and walked away. I was blown away. Then the food came.. First of all, the food was expensive so I figured it would be delicious. I was sadly mistaken. The food was HORRIBLE. I DO NOT recommend this place to my enemy. Please please please don't waste your time here.

This is a hard review for me!  So we break it down into sections.
Arrival:  numerous empty tables but we wait for 15 minutes and others are seated.  We opt to go to the bar.
The bar:  fast service & friendly.  The bar itself is awkward due to the build to eat from. 
The whole evening was frustrating...I am willing to try it again and update the review should things be better on the second round.

We were so excited for Pancho's to open. We watched it being built and couldn't wait for it to open.  I signed up for information and updates on their website before they opened. I never received any updates or emails,maybe that was an omen?  When we did visit the restaurant we were impressed with the design and decor, its really beautiful. Unfortunately, that was the best part.  The hostesses at the front seemed confused and took a long time to figure out where to seat our party of 4, even thought the restaurant had lots of open tables.  Service was underwhelming, took a long time to get drinks and order our food.  Food was fine, nothing special considering the prices were very high compared to other Mexican restaurants in the area.  They can't beat Juan's Flaming Fajitas for great Mexican food, awesome service and reasonable prices.  I was hoping to find a great Mexican alternative closer to home, but Panchos isn't it for our family unfortunately.

The ambiance and service are impeccable, and the food is absolutely wonderful. I've tried a few different menu items on different visits and I've never been disappointed. The Waite staff is very attentive - even those who are not responsible for your table. Not overpriced. I've just moved to Las Vegas from TX - and the cuisine at Pancho's is every bit as good as my favorite Mexican restaurant in the Lone Star State.  I'm a definite customer from now on.  I really have nothing negative to say about any of my visits to Pancho's.

I LOVE Pancho's Mexican!!!

Chimichanga shredded chicken dish was mouth watering!!! Last time I had the cheese Enchiladas with Avocado and sour cream so delicious. Cadillac Margarita has a special mix (yummy)"Great job to the mixologist"! I love the festive spirit and pretty decorations and lights that make it a great atmosphere. The bar side is equal fun with a great band to spark up your Saturday night!! I came back twice in one month,since I had such a nice dining experience. A special thanks to the lady food server working in the bar.


 I was at the Summerlin Downtown location last night off Sahara and the 215.
Thank you, for the great service!!!

Went here for my husbands birthday with the family. We were seated without 5 minutes. The waiter was nice. The menu prices were pricey and so we had high expectations for the flavoring of the food. My husband ordered the shrimp puffy tacos and I had the pollo de quesadilla. I have had better chicken quesadillas and my husband was disappointed that his food was bland tasting. I appreciated the manager checking in on us after we received our food. I love how most of the restaurants do that, like at Olive Garden and even at Cane's chicken. I checked in on Yelp and received a free fried ice cream which they only allow one per table. after waiting quite sometime for the check I had to get up and ask the lady at the front to get our waiter. If you don't mind the high prices and average Mexican food then this is your place.

By far the most expensive Mexican restaurant I have ever been to. Many Mexican places in town are half the price for the same items. Yes it is gorgeous but still not worth the price. Go to Michoac√°n and save the money.

The place looks great and the service was excellent. Everything looks clean and the staff were really friendly. However, the food is not exactly outstanding for the steep price. $16 for a chicken suissa, $3.50 for coffee and $10 kid meal. The price wouldn't have mattered if the food tasted great but it almost comparable to any regular fast food that would cost between $3-9 . 

I would recommend it for those who wants to have good ambiance. But I'm no longer coming back until someone tells me they're food tastes better.

HaHaHaHaHaHaHaHaHaHa!!!!!


First off - $20 for a steak quesadilla, guacamole for $15 - AYFKM?

I could go on and on about what a ridiculous absurdity this place is, but I think it's best summed up by the following:

Pancho's - please FOAD!

I have this strange desire to laugh out loud in the face of the fool who opened this place - even if it gets me a sock in the eye.

I ordered the carne asada quesadilla and a beer.I figure a quesadilla is as good of benchmark for Mexican food as any, after all you get a tortilla to see if it is freshly made or not, steak or chicken to see how they season their meat, guacamole and salsa all in one dish. The kitchen took 20 minutes to make the quesadilla, but clearly spent no more than 20 seconds plating it. The presentation was what I would expect from Taco Bell, not a top dollar Mexican restaurant. 

If after looking at the pictures you agree that it does not look appetizing, just wait till you lift up the first piece and see the waterfall of grease pouring down. I seriously had to grab a handful of napkins to soak up some of the grease that would not drip off of each piece on its own. After each slice of quesadilla was removed and de-greased, the plate was left with an ocean of grease that was starting to declare war on the guacamole. 

But I wouldn't feel sorry for the guacamole, at $15 a serving, it has the budget to defend itself.

If there was something you could add to insult, after insult was added to injury, it was already added to that nasty quesadilla - it was just plain awful. The steak had a flavor, but a flavor that should be added to rodent repellent, not food. It left a nasty taste in your mouth that would not go away, even after drinking a gallon of salsa.

The salsa was decent, I have to admit. But then again it was free. The guacamole wasn't bad, but it certainly wasn't worth $15.

I never got to judge the tortilla, it was soaked in so much fat there was no way to tell if it was handmade or not.


Let's just sum this crap-hole restaurant up this way:

"Poncho's - please leave Downtown Summerlin and never return. You are a cancer on an otherwise precious young flower that deserves a chance to bloom."

Having said that, the bartender Steve was a pretty decent bloke.

Couldn't wait for this place to open... When it finally did I waited to see what kind of reviews it was getting ..
A friend decided to have lunch there so we did.. 
The decor is nice but that's it.. The place was pretty empty so we got our table right away .. We ordered two margaritas , they were just ok nothing worth getting excited over especially the high price !!
Next we ordered guacamole for an appetizer .. I was expecting a table side creation but that wasn't the case , waitress went to the kitchen and brings a cute "little " bowl of guacamole and chips!! Tasteless , flavorless and down right bland!! We had to add salsa to it to give it some sort of taste !! 
Next up ..... Chicken quesadilla and carne asada quesadilla .. We split both and I preferred the carne asada ... 
It was ok but again nothing worth $18 for .. 
So for 2 margaritas , guacamole , 2 quesadillas.. It came out to $77 FOR LUNCH! $HIT really ! 
Service was fine , food was subpar .. I figured that because they are located in downtown Summerlin they think they can fool the locals with subpar food and gouge the shit out of us!! Seriously Panchos ?? Think about what you're doing .. I'm a Tex-Mex and have lived here for 25 years, you have no idea what Mexican food is.. Stop trying to fool people with your crappy over priced food .. Totally out of line ... Either drop your prices by 50% or make better food by 100%.. 
I tried talking a friend out of going but he had to learn the hard way .. He too was very disappointed and said his $23 carne asada plate wasn't worth 1/2 that.. 
Needless to say we won't be back..

Bart Simpson couldn't have said it better..."AY CARUMBA!!!"

Pancho's, while your atmosphere looked beautiful, I was hoping that the food would look and taste just as good, but that's where it went south of the border...WAY south! Our party of 6 decided to check it out after hanging out at nearby TPC Summerlin all day.

The building and decor kinda made you feel like you weren't in Vegas anymore, but when it comes down to it, TASTE is everything. Heading straight for the entrees section of the menu, I like to try a Mexican restaurant's Chile Relleno as a test, so I ordered the three item combo which also came with an enchilada and a taco. Chips and store bought tasting salsa are also brought to the table as well. Entrees arrive, and as I bite into the chile relleno, it has a slight crunch!? A sign of the pepper not being roasted enough before being peeled and stuffed.
The enchilada was okay, and the taco shell was stale with the meat being dry. I also tried a bite of Wifey's Seafood Burrito and the seafood definitely wasn't the freshest.

Apparently, there are two kinds of rice served here. A green, and a red. Those in our party who had the green rice enjoyed their order, while people with the red rice had crunchy bits in them. a sign of either sitting out uncovered, or prolonged time under the heating lamp as orders were being filled. Prices here are ridiculously up there(I believe all entrees were $16 or higher). The Company was good and service was pleasant, but I wish I could say the same for the food quality here. With tons of other dining options in Downtown Summerlin, you are seriously better off elsewhere. Just read the reviews and tips if you still plan to take a chance here.  ALOHA!!!

Shaka Meter:  \uuu/  \uuu/ Dos, no mas!

This place has really nice decor, lots of plants and a solid Chili Verde. But there is nothing else that really stands out to me to make this place a "Solid" Mexican Restaurant. First lets start with pricing. Geez. They make Lindo Michoacan look cheap. Micheladas.....Seriously! How do you NOT carry Clamato....SMH...Only specialty cocktail on the "Non-Existent" cocktail menu is called a, Naughty Maggie which combines regular Cuervo Gold with a float of Grand Marnier. Never have I heard or seen a mariachi band at this place other than a 2 person 80's band that played for 5 ppl at the bar. I hope this place get is together and realizes they are not in CA and they are in Summerlin, NEVADA. Way different clientele. If not they won't be open for long.

This place gets two stars because the interior decor is gorgeous (for the most part) and the chips are nommy.  The waitstaff is good about filling beverages and chips. That's it.  You are paying for the decor and construction costs, and not getting quality or tasty food in return. 

I ate here last week for lunch, after being told there was a two hour wait on opening day (despite the restaurant not being full).  I was seated immediately this time, after the hostess rudely remarking that she remembered me from the previous week.  I was brought to a table near the base of the stairs... So far so good.  Although the water in the fountain was green and cloudy.

I ordered a chicken chimi and iced tea. This was around 2:30 pm and it still took about 45 minutes for my food to come out.  By that time I'd eaten way too many chips (yeah they're good although the salsa is just meh) and wasn't very hungry.  Which is good because my chimi was the smallest burrito I've ever seen.  It was dry and lacking in flavor and I left half of it and the beans and rice (also meh) on my plate.  Definitely not impressed.

I've had better food for a fifth of the price at Roberto's Taco Shop, and that's saying something, since I think Roberto's is also crap!

I have gotten to love this place. When they first opened, the wait was too long and I didn't find the quality of food and drinks to be worth the prices that are considered by some on the high-end for Mexican. When you consider what you're getting, it's not really overpriced. It's authentic style Mexican. So if you're looking for Chiles style cheaper meals, you won't like it here. The atmosphere is great, the service is spectacular and the margaritas are divine. We get the "special" margaritas with the extra Grand Marnier on top. The guacamole is delicious. I usually get fajitas, but this last visit, I ordered the steak quesadilla and split it with my daughter. It was also delicious. My husband usually orders something the waiter recommends and is always pleased. To our surprise, our waiter remembered what my husband had ordered a month prior and asked if he'd like the same or to try something else. This is what sealed the deal for us. When the wait staff is this attentive, management is as well and the entire restaurant reflects these attitudes. Towards the end of the meal, the manager stopped by and was super friendly and just like our waiter, seemed to enjoy his job. He asked for some feedback, and I shared with him how the word around town (or at least amongst our friends) is that they are overpriced. He asked what I thought, and I explained how after this visit, I have come to realize you pay for what you get. I further explained about the atmosphere, food and drink quality and staff are what we are also paying for. He appreciated our comments and bought us a round of shots. Now that is how I like to be treated! And I do love their Margaritas.
DELICIOUS food! EXCELLENT service...I highly recommend this restaurant ... My new favorite Mexican restaurant :)
This is our 3rd time in 3 weeks.  Love the food, service and hanging out. Chile Relleno is the bomb.

I wanted to love Panchos because of its proximity to my home. So after not loving my first visit, I went back a second time in an effort to convince myself that I did. The ambiance is top notch, but the buck- I'd say it stopped there, but when you scan the menu... you'll see they've passed the buck onto you. For example a taco plate is $22.- for tacos! Not Kobe beef tacos- just regular tacos. 
I ordered a Titos Cosmo, it was served in a tiny martini glass with a teaspoon of Titos in it. It was more like receiving a communal sip of juice. Hardly enough to flush away this girls sins. The mahi ceviche was a 6.5 out of 10, and my √† la carte  cheese enchilada was a disastrous, wet mess. My girlfriend ordered a simple cheese quesadilla which she found most palatable- at the tune of $17 (or more), I tried to verify this by looking the price up on their Internet menu, but... they don't show the prices on the Internet, curiously supportive of my claim that you're about to be gouged for food that you're likely to be disappointed with. 
The live band that was playing in the bar area was remarkable. The foliage and finely detailed surroundings are unlike any local restaurant. Due to the uniquely executed ambiance their rent must be extraordinary, unfortunately their food is not.

This is the 3rd time I have been at Pancho's and will be my last. Each time there has been some issue and it's never resolved completely. Today I ordered the Pancho's combo. Not only was the plate obviously left sitting under the warmer too long as the food all had a crust on top and the cheese from the enchilada was oozing out with barely any left inside, the rellano was burnt on the outside and the inside was hard like play doh, the rice was crispy not soft and moist. In addition to that the only solution they offered was for me to get a new plate (no time for that) or order something else. At least the taco was good. I find it's too expensive and service is not great. After today we will go elsewhere.

Wayyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyy overpriced. Like crazy overpriced. The food was bland and not anything special. Even the chips and salsa were boring. The service was fine, but for the price, it tasted like a meal that should have been 5 bucks, not 20. There are no moderately priced items on the menu. Even guacamole is 15 dollars.

Let me tell you about panchos. 

Firstly the ambiance is amazing. They had a live band playing and they were awesome. Playing a great variety of music beautifully. We were sat next to the water fountain and it was beautiful. 

Secondly the wait staff. Jose was our main waiter but every single person who passed our table took a brief moment to check on us. Whether it be to fill our drinks or ask about the food. You can tell they all have each other's back. 

Third the food, it was amazing. And print. We sat at 645 and they had out food to us by 7 and that's with us not knowing what to order! 

It was a little pricey but it was so very worth it.
Nope. Nothing under $16 except soup. Margarita's ok. Did the job. Chips ok but salsa too heavy on pepper. Nice building.

Great and friendly service.  We were quickly sat down and received chips & salsa.  Fresh and delicious Chips & Salsa! The food is absolutely delicious!  I had a Tostada with shredded beef, my husband had Sopas, and our son had Carne Asada Tacos.  We absolutely recommend!  Magnificent Ambience!

This place is beautiful, bright and airy.
Service staff is professional and very nice. Our busser was outstanding. Our food came out lightning speed. Everything was my liking but the Food. 
It's so sad they can't serve better food. 
I don't mind paying little more for the better location, the better service and the BETTER FOOD! We ordered the tacos, enchiladas, tamales, salad and guacamole and none of them are up to par. They are not bad, just not that good. It's a shame. 
Five stars for the service and the  atmosphere and three stars for the food.

Decor and atmosphere was very festive and fun. Drunk prices were very reasonable.  Food was a bit expensive  but the portions were huge. Had carnitas burrito and chicken chimichanga. Food was wonderful.

I came here with my family for lunch. The food was not bad, it's just that it was, for lack of a better word, unremarkable. I don't think anyone was overly impressed with their entr√©es. Average price for standard rice and beans entr√©es was $15 to &16. I feel better can be found for less.

This is our 2nd visit here, both have been an awesome experience!  The queso fundido is amazing!!! Happy Hour and ladies night on Monday what else can you ask for? Claudia is amazing,  great smile and personality!!! Thank you Pancho ' s we'll be making this a regular date night spot!!

We had a wonderful meal today at Pancho's . We originally intended to have lunch at Red Robin but we couldn't resist the aroma coming from here ! We came in and were greeted and seated immediately . The chips and salsa were amazing ! I ordered the #6 combination and it's sooo much food ! Really good service , food and the ambiance is so cool . We will return .

Very happy with our visit here. We ordered a carne asana burrito and quesadilla with a margarita. The food was tasty and got the free fried ice cream with check in. Service was exceptionally good- Cynthia was our server she was exceptional. We will be coming back

I was anxious for an evening away from home! Ok so the restaurant itself is beautiful with a lovely ambiance. The service is fair to good but the food and value is poor. Shrimp fajitas around $26 and if you want a combination of shrimp and chicken then shuck out $31. And that doesn't include a drink, tax  and tip. Around $40 for fajitas that were awful. I'm not a huge fan of Baja Fresh but even their fajitas taste better. This is a huge problem. I'll go to Lindo Michoac√°n any day over Pancho's. Save your tastebuds and your wallet and choose another restaurant.

First of all ask for Miguel!! The service from him & his side kick was 5 star! Second of all, the food is awesome. Salsa- great! I am vegetarian and they have amazing vegetarian options. I had the artichoke avocado enchiladas - superb. Black beans are wow! Don't order the rice as it has chicken stock in it (if you are vegetarian). We got treated like we are in a five-star restaurant. Margaritas excellent- we got the Cadillac margarita. Beer on tap - top notch! For "checking in" we are getting free fried ice cream and are following it with a Bailey's and coffee. We have about five restaurants that we cycle & we have just added this one to our list. I consider us very picky and all three of us loved this dinner! We are foodies in our DNA!
Usually eat the fajitas which are always excellent and enough for 2-3 servings.  Never had a bad meal and the service has always been 5 STARS.

Oh, brother.  We live nearby and friends invited us to join them.  We had a reservation and did not have to wait on a Saturday evening.   The place was PACKED and SO LOUD we couldn't even carry on a conversation.   The prices are outrageous and the food average.  The drink prices are crazy-high as well.  We will never return.  There are SO many good Mexican restaurants in Las Vegas I really don't see why anyone would go here, but to each his own, as "they" say...

Nice atmosphere and great location.  However, overpriced, $40 for lunch for two. Complimentary chips and salsa were very good.  Entrees mediocre at best. Hubby had Tacos de Carnitas. Meat was obviously overcooked, dried out and looked like yesterday's leftovers.  We will not be back.

Beautifully themed restaurant but the prices are very expensive. I had a burrito, it was $18 and didn't include any rice and beans. The burrito was very small for the price. The drinks are very small and the salsa they give is too spicy. Food was great but not worth the price. For a special occasion, maybe. Loved that there were two stories. Staff constantly refilled our chips and drinks so that was great.

During my 2 years while working on a cruise line in Hawaii we always used to stop on the side of the big island of Hawaii which was called Kona and tender boat in and they had this amazing mexican restaurant called Pancho & Leftys. I know this Pancho is related to one in California and not sure if the one in Kona is related in any way but the chips and salsa and everything about there menu reminds me of that restaurant in Kona.If I could give this restaurant more stars I would as it is some of the best mexican in Las Vegas.I am a die hard mexican food fan and have been to some of the top rated mexican restaurants in southern california to southern texas and let me say this food is so good.For Vegas this is one of the best out there and it may not touch some of the best out there I recommend it.

This is an awesome Mexican restaurant. 
Great ambience. Great food. Great service. 
The Especiale is our favorite. 
Love their salsa. 
We are from Texas and have searched for a place like this since we moved here in 05. 
Try it. You will love it.

Very cool interior; felt like you were in someone's home. Service was solid and food was good, but prices are WAY too high for being a neighborhood restaurant. Wouldn't be a place I'd frequent because of that. There are other local Mexican restaurants that are just as good and much more reasonably priced.
Great enchiladas. Waiters are attentive and polite. The food is really good and the decor is beautiful, just beautiful. The food portions are huge and they give you free chips and salsa.

This place is in downtown Summerlin. Ambiance was chill and relaxing. Our server Martha was absolutely great. We were a party of 15 and she remembered all of our names. When looking for something to eat the price caught my attention! The prices were unreasonable! For example 2 tacos rice and beans was 22.95! It was so hard to choose something to eat and not hurt my pocket! I just chose the meatball soup! It was delicious but for the portion and the price it wasn't worth the 7.95! It was my friends birthday so the staff came to our table, put a sombrero and sang for him! They also provided fried ice cream and a shot of tequila! That was pretty fun! The overall experience was really nice! I would come back if they would lower the prices.. But I doubt they would so I may not be back unless have to!
This is one of my favorite places! The restaurant is so breath taking and the food is so good! Not to mention the very nice people who work there!

Okay let me start by saying the interior of this place is adorable I love it. Second! The food is amazing we FINALLY found our Mexican place! Thank god three years in Vegas and we found It! Third and absolutely most important is the service.. Holy hell the manager greeted us instantly jokes with us and made us feel at home the waiters are incredible on top of refills recommending meals just coming by to check on us to make sure everything is okay. We had Alfredo as our waiter and Miguel helped us as well and I don't think I've laughed so hard. The manager is the sweetest guy and really attentive to every table! I can't say enough amazing things about this place no review could describe the experience we had here. We will be back!

the only star I am giving to this restaurant is for our waitress, she was very nice. The food was nothing special and they are very proud of it because the prices here are insane for the quality of the food. The "front desk" service first put us in a table in front of the kitchen exit, not a place to have a table and I asked her to give us another table, so she moved us to upstairs and the table was almost in the middle of the hallway next to the stairs railing... well half of it. Restaurants are planned to sit people comfortable... here you have the feeling they are trying to add as many tables as they can. We are not coming back because 2 Magueritas (not impressed at all both with size and taste) one appetizer (they basically warmed up CREAM cheese... yes cream cheese, and diced up some jalapenos and called that a cheese dip) a Taco salad and a quesadilla for $80.00 it is to much.. We normally have the same stuff on other competitor's locations and we don't spend more than $50... with more volume, and the most important... wayyyyyyy better food, with very comfortable tables.

Mmmhhhhmmm! Great food and excellent service!!!! Absolutely loved the atmosphere. Dim lights, beautifully  decorated, and the tables aren't stacked on top of each other. Awesome happy hour specials (in bar area only). Ordered several plates and shared. Its been a bit as I can't remember exactly what we got but, I liked every single  dish! Great menu selection anything from seafood Mexican style to your traditional Mexican dishes. Portions are huge couldn't put a dent in it! Loved the selection of margaritas especially the jalape√±o margaritas! Our server was absolutely amazing and very fast. It is pricey but I think it was worth it.

I'm from California so I'm extremely selective about the Mexican restaurants I go to and give my endorsement. Pancho's from its inception here in Downtown Summerlin has definitely earned its endorsement from me. The atmosphere is amazing, the service is great, generally the manager is always walking around--checking in and making sure everyone is comfortable. They have live entertainment and karaoke nights in the bar area on some nights...oh yeah, and the food is amazing. I've tried several things here, the burrito ranchero is probably my favorite dish. If you're a die hard beef burrito fan...you can't go wrong with that selection. If you're looking to have a great nite out with your friends and in you're in the mood for Mexican food--do yourself a favor and come to Pancho's...just as a side note...the price points are a little higher than most of the Mexican restaurants I've gone to, but just know it's worth it!

So first, it's in downtown summerlin so it's way more pricey than it should be. 
Decent food but not exceptional.  You can get better Mexican for cheaper.  Not bad at all though. 
Don't think I'd go back without a coupon but I'll keep going when I get them.  There was a long wait so we sat in the cantina. It's pretty and the live music was good. Good ambiance. Good service as well. 
They have a lot of happy hours, even on the weekend. Only real downside is the price.

Beautiful authentic atmosphere! Unique style to this building and a long complex menu.
Service was perfect!!! And that's hard to find these days.
Food & drinks were delicious, although on the pricey side.
Average cocktail $10-12
Average meal $20-25

Excellent tasting & decent portions! The refried beans were great- my one requirement for trying any Mexican restaurant! Ask for Helen (of Troy) because she was super quick & checked on us many times! Fantastic blended margaritas & $5 on Monday nights from 4pm- close! Yummy! Chicken taquitos & beef nachos were Bomb!!

Very over priced for what it is!! Pretty much $20 a plate, that's NOT including rice n beans with most of the meals. Definitely don't need to go back, nothing special and would not pay that kind of money for food like that!

Wow. Incredible design and amazing ambiance.
My wife and I were seated fast and next to a water fountain! Salsa was on point and tortilla soup was great to. My wife had ceviche and I am chimichanga, fish was fresh and the chicken seasoned well.
Best of all MR. Doug Was a wonderful host. 
I'll def be back.

Food was alright , able to digest. WORST EXPERIENCE in my life... I've work in the food industry and I've never seen something so disrespectful. After me and my family paid our bill and continued to enjoy conversation for a hour the manager came over telling us we had to leave . The reason was because they needed the table BUT yet the restaurant was empty, there was open tables, and it was only 3pm. You are never to tell the guest they have to leave for simply paying and enjoying company. #NEVERAGAIN... And the enchiladas had bones in it ..

Last minute decision, to have dinner here. Yelp rating on this spot could be misleading. It clearly is way out - 3 stars really -- Panchos is closer to 4.5 - 5 stars.

Our experience was 100% five stars

As you enter this restaurant, you are transported to wealthy Mexican house - wow what a foyer - decorated with classic Mexican art

We were quickly seated, table for two, the restaurant was packed, we got the last two seater. Within seconds we were attended by, one of best server experiences we have had in Las Vegas, Lee. We are new to Mexican cuisine, a fact, we shared with Lee to - right away we were give a full introduction to the highlights of the cuisine and based on our taste preferences what we should try. A prudent way to introduce you to cuisine you know little about. 

So for appetizers, we were served a guacamole and hop spicy dip along with Corn chips. That went really well with us, and we waited probably 5-7 mins for our entree. My wife and me shared a entree - it was Grilled Chicken, salad, rice and beans. It is a big meal
 
The Chicken was really delicious, very well grilled with back ended BBQ flavor. Done just right.My wife enjoyed the bean and rice, I was not a huge fan. But overall the meal was very good, full marks to the chef. 

After the Entree, we were offered Fried Ice Cream, to me that was good - not amazing like the 
Entree and Appetizer. You can get this free with your Yelp Check-in 

What really deserves 5 stars was the Service, Lee the server was amazing, the Manager dropped in - was polite and genuinely wants to look after his guests, there is warm feeling at Panchos - they want you to enjoy your meal - like being in their house. 

Highly recommend this location for party or date night. 
One word of caution, book ahead - it was busy when we were there, last Friday.

Mediocre food and service and completely overpriced.  

My husband, daughter and myself were in the DTS area and decided to have dinner.  Wanting Mexican, we decided to try it out.  

We were given a lackluster greeting by a young girl who clearly was bored and taken through the dining room to our seat. We were promptly given chips and salsa and then shortly after asked for our drink order.  We looked through the menu and were totally floored at the cost of what appeared to be pretty basic food choices.  We were going to order guacamole until we realized it was $15 and  NOT even table side. Decided against it and ordered just entrees.  We nibbled on chips and boring salsa with too much heat while we waited for our food.  Our meals were delivered by someone other than our server and we were not asked if we needed anything else. Our server came by shortly thereafter though and asked.  We requested sour cream which he quickly brought.  But that was the last we saw him.  He never returned to ask how the food was. If he had, I would have told him the chicken tamale was dry with a disgusting flavor.  When he did return it was to clear our plates. But he never inquired why I hadn't finished my plate or if I wanted it boxed. Maybe he knew it was gross.  And I couldn't even wash it down because my glass was empty. ALL of ours were. No offer to refill just a question about dessert.  We decided to cut our losses, pay the $65 tab and leave.  When we walked by the hostess, there was no thank you, goodbye, how was it.  They were too busy chatting amongst themselves. 

EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED.

Very friendly staff, great selection on menu, delicious flavor. However one issue is that our guacamole appetizer was barley served 2 minutes after our salads and then our meals were brought to the table in less than a minute after the guacamole was delivered. Timing was off!! 
I also felt that the menu is over priced $5-$6. 
I've spent less money at 5-star Mexican restaurants. 
The atmosphere was very Traditional, inviting, and beautiful. I'm very interested in exploring their happy hour specials.

What a bummer! This place is so cute! The ambiance and service were great. The food was not. 

The restaurant is very cool. It's like a big open atrium inside with lots of trees, hanging birds, a fountain and so on. A huge negative - we were seated right next to the fountain and it smelled like mold/sewer. Every time some passed by it wafted towards our table. Very unappealing. They have a big menu with loads of options; the prices definitely run a little high. 

Unfortunately, we were very disappointed with our food. They serve complimentary chips and salsa And the salsa is tasty. We ordered the artichoke queso fundido. It was like no other queso fundido I've ever had. It was essentially a skillet of warm sour cream/cream cheese. The consistency was like a dip, not like ooey gooey cheese. No caramelization. No bueno. We also ordered the beef taquitos described as spicy. They were bland. No flavor. I had the sopa de albondigas (meatball soup); this did have nice flavor!! Others at the table were disappointed with enchiladas, chile rellano and a seafood entree. Everything lacked flavor and pizazz and seemed overpriced. 

I didn't have a cocktail or I might say to come for the surroundings and a drink.  

I likely won't return. Too many other tasty Mexican choices

We went for brunch. We had great service. The restaurant was very nice. Skylights everywhere with a ton of plants. Loved the atmosphere. I had huevos rancheros it was great.  They have a pretty cool drink menu that we'll have to come back to check out.

Beautiful atmosphere, but subpar overpriced food. Not much flavor and the salsa tasted 'off'. This was our second time going. The first time was just only a bit better. I wish the food was as good as the decor. Unfortunately, we won't be back.

Ugh, enough of the 7 nights a week live entertainment. Shit fire I can't hear myself think.  The Whitney Huston cover music really, really does not fit in.

Ah hell....! $6.50 for a Corona...!  Come on guys.  The staff was great, the food pretty good, but damn, $80 with tip for 2 people.  

No bueno.

Life is about managing expectations and mine were too high before going to Ponchos.  I don't get it.  

Place is beautifully appointed with the upscale Mexican decor and vibe, staff was attentive and friendly.  I am never insulted by prices, but for the food and drink I received, I noticed no difference in my culinary experience than I would not have found at Lindo Michocan down the street.  My fish tacos and refried beans were good, but I felt they were the exact same quality I could get other places. 

Sure my fish tacos came on a lovely Michael Aram looking silver platter, sure the staff checked on us attentively a dozen times in the hour we were sitting there, sure this location in the Summerlin hot spot of Downtown Summerlin, but the quality of food is nothing off the charts to warrant the price nor my return visit.  I am not saying I would not ever go back, but if given a choice, I would choose not to and go elsewhere.

Bring your wallet! Just because this place is in Downtown Summerlin, they think they can get away with charging outrageous -- and I do mean OUTRAGEOUS -- prices for simple Americanized Mexican food. Yes, the restaurant is gorgeous inside, with colorful clay tiles and a fountain in the middle of the dining room, but they are putting the high cost of their primo real estate onto unsuspecting customers' backs. 

I love Mexican food and Pancho's drew me in with an appealing menu. The first sign that this was going to be a disappointing meal was when the waiter brought out complimentary chips and salsa for the table. I judge a place by its chips, and these were pretty awful. They were cold, not salted at all, and honestly tasted like they were out of a big bag. They had to be. Ditto for the salsa, runny and bland and just gross. Pass. 

Next up was the queso fundido with artichoke hearts. This tasted more like Paula Deen's artichoke dip than Mexican queso, so don't order this if you just want tasty melted cheese. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't good either. Wouldn't get this again. 

I was dining with two friends and one had a beef quesadilla with a margarita, and the other had fajitas. I ordered the Especial de Cabo. The food ranged from truly inedible to mediocre, and all of it was grossly overpriced (see the pattern here)? NOBODY was happy with their meal. 

The kitchen was easy to work with and swapped out grilled vegetables for the rice, which I appreciated. The veggies were good and the flavor of the dish was acceptable, but what was so nasty was the huge puddle of water that settled into the bottom of my plate. It was extremely unpleasant to have to dig my food out of this murky water. The kitchen needs to do a better job draining the water and grease off of the food! As expected, my meal was very light on the meat (chicken breast, shrimp and crab meat -- it had like 3 shrimp total and one little scoop of crab meat), but there were at least some decent sized avocado chunks. This was a pretty good low carb dish in terms of creativity and flavor, but it was just too pricey for me to justify eating it regularly.  

The biggest offense here is that the tortillas aren't homemade. Every good Mexican restaurant ought to make their own tortillas. (At least they brew their own iced tea, and it was delicious). 

One friend ordered the fried ice cream for us to share and it was the superstar of the meal. But really, how can dessert NOT be delicious? I laughed at the miniature American and Mexican flags that were stuck in the top of our dessert because this had to be the most inauthentic Mexican meal I have ever had! 

The service was abysmal too. We had to wait forever for drink refills and for the check, and our server brought out our queso appetizer without any chips or any plates, so we had to sit there while our queso got colder and colder. Epic fail on the inattentive service. 

The three of us were left with disappointing meals and a disappointing experience all around and a whopping check for $165 for lunch. LUNCH! One hundred and sixty five dollars!!!! Talk about a genuine rip-off in the greatest sense of the word!

I won't be returning to Pancho's.

We ate here last night for the first time. It was a great experience!  The food was great, the atmosphere was fun and the staff were excellent!  The manager walked around and engaged the customers and genuinely cared that you had a good experience. Definitely my new favorite Mexican food restaurant!!

Had lunch with few friends to see how the food is and everything was good but the portions were large for lunch and pricey. Maybe a lunch menu would be wise in the future. 

Overall good service with a very friendly staff and food was great!

Ambience was great. 
Food was just okay. No real flavor. Just spice. 
Expensive. I ordered a chicken plate for 16.99 and it was mainly rice and beans. Maybe had 6 small chunks of chicken. They forgot my soup that was supposed to be included. No lunch special deals. 
Service was okay. They didn't refill our waters when empty. Service was on the slow side. 
The place is nicely decorated. I really enjoyed he atmosphere. Too bad on the rest of our experience.

First impressions would lead you to believe that your are about to experience Authentic Mexican Cusine but you will be sorely mistaken. I ordered the Carne asada  platter if you will. The meat was way under seasoned, actually void of any flavor. The beans are good and the rice is adequate. The chips and salsa are complimentary and provided the best flavors for the meal. The price is way out of line with the quality of food served here. The one thing that does stand out is the great service we received.

The one star is for the salsa which is mediocre at best. Our waiter was very nice and did a fine job but the food, alcohol, the desert all incredibly overpriced!!! I'd rather eat great food on a plastic milk crate sitting on cinderblocks than go back to this hole. Ordered a pork dish that was bland and flavorless. Ordered the chili Rellano and The poblano was still crunchy and cheese was not melted in the middle. Two people $70... Should've went to Tavoli!!!!! Avoid this place at all costs if you enjoy good Mexican food because you will not find it here. This place needs to GTFO of Summerlin. You don't believe me read the reviews! Horrible.

Pretty Bad. I was embarrassed with my guests. On the plus side is the interior which is festive and colorful. On the negative, almost everything else. We went there tonight at 6 p.m. with a party of four. Started with premium margaritas all around which were weak and tasted like a lime slurpee. We asked for no salt on all ... nope. Wait staff was very kind and courteous; however, when we received three of our entree's ... the fourth never came. Not for a while. After we decided to "go ahead" figuring the fourth entree' would be right out ... the manager stopped by. He asked how everything was going and we replied that we had been waiting for one of the ordered entree's, "carnitas". He was very apologetic BUT after another 5 or 10 minutes  or so, the entree came ... Fish Tacos. What? The manager came back and was bumbling with excuses about how carnitas couldn't be properly cooked here in Las Vegas unlike in Manhattan Beach, California where the other Pancho's is located. He said, "Princess it must be perfect to serve &  I'm sorry we will not charge you for the entree that you didn't get". Really? So while we waited for the entree' I ordered a Carona Lite (after finishing my watery margarita). We ate the food and all complained how salty it was but so be it... that's a matter of taste (even though all 4 of us said the same thing). The icing on the evening was I never received the beer I ordered. Again, the manager apologized and took one entree (that was never received) and a beer (that was never received) off the bill of well over $120. I paid the bill but needless to say this place failed miserably. Our first time here and we'll not return and tell everybody we know how crappy it was. We have lived in Las Vegas for over 25 years and are used to waiting ... the restaurant was packed. Don't know why as our experience was disappointing compared to even Macayo Vegas which has better quality and for less than half the cost ... BUT they don't have those fun, pretty festive colors. No Mas !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Had dinner with the family. The food was good, but way overpriced. We wanted to get the guac appitizer but at $15 that would be a no. Sodas come out in what looks like a large shot glass. Two sips and you're done. For the three of us, with no alchocol, it was $85 with a tip. I'm not opposed to paying $20 + a person, just not for mexican.

Great atmosphere!!!! Food is decently priced.  However, I must admit my food was a little
On the salty side.  Tortilla soup was delicious!

My wife and i went to pancho's a couple of times and the food was good.  But this 4th of july i took my wife and parents to pancho's, my wife and i got fajita's chicken and beef combo, my mother got beef fajita's and father got chicken fajita's.  We all got really sick and remained sick for a few days, stomach pains, diarrhea.  It was very bad.  I wouldnt recommend anyone go there.

I feel like the food has decreased in quality and taste.  I had the birria today and though I wasn't expecting it to be authentic taste, I did expect the cilantro and onion to be fresh.  The tortillas were a little stale too.  Our server was excellent though, kudos to her, she seemed to be working way too many tables but still kept her composure and smile.

Bad experience. The food is over priced, the portions are small and my lunch tasted like a Mexican TV dinner.  My husband and I were disappointed and we will not return. You can find better food at the local Taco Shops for 1/3 the price.
WHAT CAN I SAY!!!! LOVE LOVE LOVE atmosphere, ambiance, customer service, al get % STARS!!! thanks for a wonderful dinner

OMG! We visited Pancho's at Downtown summerlin, and cannot wait to go back! A little pricey, but the d√©cor is beautiful and the food was AMAZING! Our server was Alfredo.. and he rocks!We will definitely be back!

Kiwi margarita, chips and salsa, and taquitos were so delicious. The wait for the dining room was forever so my husband and I opted for a high top at the bar. They were only serving appetizers tonight but we didn't mind. 

My kiwi margarita was delicious. Made from real fruit! The salsa was on point. Taquitos were super yummy and so was the guac they were covered in. 

My husband and I can't wait to go back and explore the rest of the menu. 

I will update my review after I see more of what they have to offer.

Located in the Summerlin shopping area by Trader Joes, Pancho's offers good Mexican food and a nice atmosphere. 
After a 20 minute wait on a Friday night, our buzzer went off and we were seated at our table of 7. Our waiter came over to deliver chips and salsa, take our drink orders and answer questions. My hubby rapped in Spanish with him after noticing some food item mentioned Tijuana and really the food origin was Mexico City.  After discovering the waiter and us had lived very close to one another in Mexico City, he brought us over guacamole. Delish!!! 
Food items ordered; chicken fajitas (very good, mushrooms with onions and sliced bell peppers), chicken mole (good), a mixed pork and chicken platter (said to be tasty) and chicken tacos and a taco salad for the kids (all said to be very good). It's definitely not "authentic" Mexican, it's that Americanized Tex-Mex, but it's still good. The prices are a bit steep, but that's to be expected in this area of Summerlin. Total bill for 7, 4 kids meals, 3 adults, no cocktails was $145, tip not included. We ordered cocktails at the bar, 2 beers and a vodka-club was $40-ish. 
Service was amazing, drinks refilled immediately and our waiter and multiple bussers came to add drinks, clear plates, etc. 
We lied and said it was our friend's bday and could they sing happy bday to him. They came over at the end of the meal and gave him fried ice cream, put on the sombrero and sang. Oh, the stupid stuff we do for a 40 second laugh... We're lame....
Yesterday we had our Super Bowl party catered by Pancho's; platters of chicken enchiladas, carne asada, marinated chicken, rice, beans, chips,salsa, very good! 
Will definitely return to Pancho's when we need our Mexican food fix.

Dropped in today with my wife and Mom after voting. I had the Chicken Fajaitas, my wife had the Cheese Enchiladas and Mom had Fish Tacos. Warning, the portions are very large but the food and service are both top notch. This is possibly the best Mexican restaurant in town. Our server Agustin provide entertainment as well as service at its very best. The place is knock down beautiful and very well lit during the day thanks to the skylights. A little pricey but we will come again.

Super over priced. A family of four at a Mexican food restaurant shouldn't have to pay almost $80.00. My kids even ate off of the kids menu. Charging 13.95 for guacamole is preposterous. Some of it was my fault for not checking the menu but I didn't expect to pay 13.95 for guacamole. I got the bill and my jaw hit the floor. The are much better options for half the price else where around Las Vegas. The food and experience id not worth the high price.
I've been here 3 times and the first time was good. The second time they messed up my order and the third time my burrito came with Saran Wrap in it! I won't be going back, overpriced too.

Great Service
Beautiful Atmosphere.
Meal was very good...
How does this place justify a
2 Beef Tacos with
Rice n Beans for
$17.50 ???

1st visit wasn't good. Well over an hour wait and they didn't look busy at all. Was told to call a day ahead. Really? On a Thursday night? We decided to give it another chance and the same thing. The girls at the entrance have no personality, smile, or have a welcoming presence. The servers were nice though. Here at lunch time and the lunch menu is the same as the dinner menu. Food is no different than any other Mexican joint.  We get the check and we are being charged more than what the prices on the menu showed. Really??? Yeah, I'm straight!!!

I really really wanted to like this restaurant. It's at Downtown Summerlin, so I'm thinking "elevated". Not so much. First, the service was AWESOME! Also, the decor and ambiance was fantastic. That's where it gets 2 stars. 

The food was just not good. I got the chicken fajitas thinking it was nice and basic. How could you go wrong? Dry chicken, spices that made it taste horrible, brown guacamole and dry rice. Very high priced and a chain restaurant like Chili's leaves it in the dust, which is a shame. 

My friend's meal wasn't much better. 

This place has potential to be awesome. They have great service from the minute you walk in until the minute you leave. The restaurant itself is beautiful. But the food needs a lot of work for how much you're spending. 

Honestly, greasy Roberto's or some of the small taco stands have better food. It's very disappointing.

This place had such an amazing ambience and even more promising buildup as I eagerly was seated with my party way ahead of reservation time.......... Unfortunately little did I know ..... This was the peak of my evening. Overly creative menus and no investment in a cocktail menu left me puzzled and frustrated only to lean on my Negro modelo "standby" beverage w a side shot of ice water . As I sipped on my mildly cold beer and forced my stomach to indulge in some flavor challenged guacamole, I kept thinking to myself - " this has to get better."  Flavorless chicken fajitas and rubbery Camerones (shrimp) left me hating myself after I paid for my overpriced letdown. The only advice I have for anybody reading this is Lindo is down the freeway - if your Yelp motivation is to enjoy better food and less dent to your wallet.

Read the reviews and still checked it out. what a mistake. So just like the other reviews place is pricey but that's ok if quality is up to par. I ordered the carnitas burrito. The cheese on burrito was absolutely disgusting. Also, 70% of the carnitas in the burrito were so old and over cooked it was like rubber. I opened up the burrito after one bite and showed the bartender. He took it away and removed off the bill.
Tried this place three times. Food is ok, nothing special.  Way overpriced.

I am giving this place one star simply because I can't give them zero. 

We sat down at our table and two people who sat down after us were greeted prior to anyone coming to our table. We sat down for about 10 minutes and then asked the host to please send a server over. When our server finally came over, she was just okay. She brought us our food and never came back to check on us or see if we needed anything else. We had to ask the busser for additional items we needed. After seeing our server nowhere in sight, we asked someone else for our bill. 

On top of the horrible service, the menu is extremely overpriced. I spent $17 on a steak quesadilla and $12.75 on a regular margarita that wasn't even that great. 

Needless to say, save your money. The food isn't worth the misery this place puts you through.

Ultimately disappointed. The food is good but just good. One would expect much better quality food with the prices Panchos lists. The building itself is very nicely setup and decorated. The staff is very attentive and friendly also. But $18 for a "queso dip" - listed as an appetizer mind you - that is composed of mostly cream cheese is exactly the type of robbery you can expect from this place! Note: I'm only giving an extra star for the friendly service and warm environment.

If you're vegan I'd stay away from this place. I went in the other day with my mom super excited because of the location and how pretty it looked. Plus I was seriously craving mexican. Most places have a vegan/vegetarian menu or can accommodate me. Well they had two vegan items. One was a salad (who wants a salad at a mexican place? Not this girl) and the other option had a wheat flour tortilla and I can't have wheat. I asked if there was anything else they could do to help accommodate me and they said no. I then ordered just a side of beans which they brought and it was covered in cheese lol I didn't want to complain since I already felt like a pain and just let my mom eat the beans. I promptly left and went somewhere else to eat. Seriously disappointed considering  nice of a place this is and I love the location.
The food was not good. In fact, I would be hard pressed to remember a meal this anti-climatic.  The service was great and the building is lovely. Won't be going back. Ever.
Looked so good, but a big let down.  The nachos are a big mushy pile of melted cheese...and carrots?  Skip Panchos, much better places to get Mexican in Las Vegas.

Are here last night with my family. Great service and good food! Cultivated atmosphere. Love when the managers at restaurants ask how their service is going! They also gave special treatment to my daughter with some ice cream and balloons just because :).

Reminds me of their location in Manhattan Beach. Food was excellent. Although our appetizer was served with our entrees. Kids menu is pricey. Overall a good dining experience. The service staff was very attentive. Good ambiance.

Came back a second time, sat in the bar where they had live music which was fun. Food is still pricey and just ok, we had a coupon is which is why we came back to try it again. I would go back and sit in the bar for the live music and just order drinks and maybe an appetizer. My husband ordered the carne asada he only liked the cheese enchilada that came with it. I had the chicken fajitas, they were good.

Went here recently.  I was not blown away.  Mixed review I guess.  Dinner was good, but nothing spectacular.  Salad was great !!.  In the meal, the chicken was a bit off and the onions other veggies overcooked.  Rice and beans were rice and beans.  Great service by very nice server, but the inside was a bit underwhelming from what I was expecting and the way it was talked up.  Staff were sprinting (pounding) up and down stairs so not that relaxing and bar music was blaring.  Stairs took up most of the floor space.   Large portions but the price is high.  I think for the price and all the talk about the inside I was expecting more.  We may go back sometime.  Not bad, but not really great either.  Glad we tired it.

I love loved their deco! I just wished they had some Mexican music playing since they didn't have the live band. Anyways that's not the reason why I give it 3 stars. I don't know if its me just expecting too much from Mexican restaurants?! I just thought the food was not amazing and it was overpriced. (Average $17+) They could also do a better job with their food presentation. 
On the other hand, their service was great!. Was busy on Sunday brunch time and got seated right away. Friendly staff always made sure we were ok.

I have to say that this is one of the most beautiful Mexican restaurants I have ever been to but that's about it. My husband and I sat upstairs , again the the view of the restaurant is pretty, but service is really slow but thankfully friendly. 
The reason why I give three out five is the price of the food. To be honest, it's very basic and plain for the price. I know several restaurants that are way cheaper and the food is flavorful. 
Other than price, it's a nice restaurant.

Larger inside than it appears outside. Staff friendly. Prepare yourself for large servings. I had the crab and shrimp quesadilla and one mahi mahi crispy taco (made crispy on my request). The quesadilla was tasty. Couldn't eat all of it. The fish taco was extremely fishy. I didn't eat it. I had a skinny margarita with the organic house made tequila which was also tasty.

I was soooooo looking forward to this place opening since being a SoCal native and been to the Manhattan Beach location! Beautiful interior nothing like it here in Las Vegas! I wanted to seriously love this place but $14.00 for plain nachos? Really? Hello? Wake up call- this is not SoCal and this is not Manhattan Beach! $18.00 for an enchilada? These prices are unrealistic even for Summerlin! This is Mexican Food! The cheapest food you can buy and make! I know you spent 3 million on the building and I can imagine your rent but with there prices I give you 6 months then Via Con Dios! Plenty of near by places cheaper with established service and food...lower your prices if you want to survive here in Las Vegas! I don't mind spending money on food but really? Expensive Mexican food is an oxy moron at this point!

I always bring home my leftovers, but rarely eat them.  This time, I not only ate them, but was sad that I didn't leave more.  I had the Ranchero burrito with shredded beef and pinto beans.  I really enjoyed it!  The chips and salsa they brought to the table when we first sat down were perfect!  And I'm very picky with my chips & salsa.  My son ordered the beef taco salad, and enjoyed it as well!  I will be going back very soon.

Surely wish we had read the reviews prior to dining there. Having lived in Mexico, I do miss  Mexican cuisine. We were there in the evening after Christmas shopping. There was a horrible musician (that should have been a clue to leave). Politely put, I had Food Poisoning.

My husband and I ordered a two item combo (taco & chile relleno), guacamole, two margaritas (one mango, one traditional on the rocks). My husband had three margaritas & we split the entree, no other food ordered. We thought it was quite expensive. Our bill with tip was $102. That's without the guacamole which they gave us complimentary due to our wait for drinks, even though we never complained. That was nice. The guacamole portion was very large, but the entree was average size with a small portion of rice & beans. The food was good but nothing "wowed" either of us. The taco was our favorite. The guacamole needed salt. The service was not great, but we tried to give them the benefit of the doubt since the restaurant had just opened the day before. We waited a long time for our initial drinks. We sat in the bar and it was pretty full, two or three empty tables. The restaurant is beautiful inside. Exactly what you'd expect from a Mexican place.
We came to the conclusion that if we are going out for Mexican we'll go to Juan's Flaming Fajitas on West Tropicana. It's cheaper, the service is great, the atmosphere is decent, & the food is outstanding.
Conclusion- been there, checked it out, will go again if a friend wants to meet up there for a drink at their suggestion, but I wouldn't suggest it.

Waited for dinner on Saturday night 45 min wait, we where offered a drink for waiting..never recieved  the  drink!!! Finally we where seated upstairs on a cat walk, no room for waiters or people to walk by, felt like I was in everyone's way. Ordered our drinks from the bus boy Louis the only bright spot of this dinning experience. Louis was very attentive. As for our waitress krisa,she was the worst!! My meal was wrong had to wait another 15/20 minuets. she did apologize for screwing up, but made no offer to discount the meal or bring a manager!  The food was not great, very over priced!!  This resturant has been open for 2 weeks, sadly I will not return! I also witnessed one of the owners drinking..taking a shot at the service bar. 
If I could, I wouldn't give this resturant  1 star.

I grew up going to Old Town San Diego for some hearty (albeit touristy) Mexican food, which nevertheless, was always enjoyable. Pancho's looks like it belongs right in the heart of Old Town and it was a nice suprise that reminded me a little of home. 

The ambiance is wonderful. You ffeel like you're sitting outside but not in the insufferable heat or wind that Vegas has. The servers running up and down the stairs was a little unnerving.

The food is a little pricier than Lindo (which was our previous preferred spot for disappointing Mexican food) but you're paying for ambiance, and for us, convenience. The service was very attentive and sincere.

We enjoyed the pescado ceviche (yum! - the more sour the better), Carne Asada quesdilla (meat was tender and flavorful), and the shrimp/crab enchiladas (I was so happy to be able to choose one of each!). For dessert we had the FREE... FREEEEEE fried ice cream! It was a good ending to our meal, especially since it was free (when you check in on YELP). 

I wish they had horchata to round out my meal. They do have an extensive selection of spirits and cocktails which looked good.

I'll come back for sure! I'm always getting coupons for Panchos in the mail so even better!

Weakest attempt at a Mexican restaurant. Chips taste like they come from a package rather than fresh. Top shelf margarita has a flavor like Pinesol smells. Others dishes were ok but nothing worth writing about. Add to that, irs expensive for what you get. I gave It a second star because the service people were nice and friendly. This was our first and last trip to Pancho's.

Here was second experience.  BOTH times the food was:

1.  Expensive food ~ $14.95 for side of guacamole? 
2.  So-so Margaritas - watered down and hardly a happy hour price at $8.00
3. Bland food - first time EVER added salt to shrimp tacos
4. Good server and nice atmosphere
5. $8.00 for a small bowl of soup?

Prices jacked WAY UP for downtown Summerlin.  Better Mexican at several places nearby.  Sorry to say, it's doubtful we will return or recommend.  Seems other people feel the same according to the reviews.

Here's the deal, if you grew up in LA and you like enchilada sauce and white style Mexican food, you'll like this place. Sure, there are places that are more rustic and more authentic, perhaps less cliche, but this place fills a void in the Las Vegas arena of Mexican fine dining. Everything was tasty! Bring your parents here! It has a place in my rotation for sure and I am a regular at the more authentic places. Great job on the decor too, it felt like a place that's been around a long time.

My only criticism is price. It's 10-15% more expensive than I'd like. Let's face it, that building wasn't cheap! Maybe when things settle they'll give us a break or some coupons or something.

As far as the negative reviews, most of them sound like what happens when you open a new place. It'll get better.

The fountain was clean by the way!

Panchos is a great restaurant! The food, service and atmosphere is fantastic. Like other yelpers, the prices will affect repeat business. Being that it is located in Summerlin, it will probably be very successful. I wish them the best and will be back only on special occasions.

Decent food but definitely not worth the price. 
Way over priced. $18 for a burrito and $19 for a salad. 
Kids menu is $10. 
There are a lot of options for Mexican food in town and most are not this expensive.  That will be the only thing keeping me from going back.

Can you say overrated? Can you say expensive? That is exactly what I think about when I think of Pancho's. Don't get me wrong it's nice as heck in there, but not worth the prices. I been to Pancho's about 4 times and I'm just shocked on why it's so expensive. 

I ordered some carne asada tacos and it only came with two ok size tacos for 17 bucks! You get the other nonsense like beans and rice. Let's be honest we are there to eat the tacos not the beans. I thought they gave you soup with every meal, that isn't true. So why is it so expensive for some decent tacos! 

You get chips & salsa which is always nice. If they ask you for guacamole say NO it's 9 bucks! The food flavor is just normal. Trust me the only thing that stands out with this place is the scenery inside. Not worth the price for average tasting food.
Omg! What a rip off! Better off going to Robertos Taco Shop! $80 for steak tacos, enchilada and a side of guac & chips and a margarita. We should have walked out when we saw the menu.

I went here last weekend and was fairly unimpressed.  The building looks nice, but then we were sat at the first table upstairs, tucked into a corner with a bunch of bushes.  The table in front of us already had a family at it, and we were maybe two feet reaching distance from them.  It was just odd.  Food was decent; tacos pretty bland, but goodness was it EXPENSIVE.  It's twice the price of similar restaurants and maybe not as good.  It was decent to try, but I'm not going to be going back on the reg.
Prices were a little high (it was 75$ for 3 plates and 3 sodas, but I'm also cheap). Food was really good (I don't know about 20$ per plate good), but the service was amazing!
Leaves something to be desired. The customer service was excellent, unfortunately that is the only thing that was.

This was our first visit, I was excited about a New Mexican restaurant in town. 
What a let down... Food  was blah... Salsa is runny, chips were cold and stale. Service was bad, our waitress Ruth was completely uninterested in helping us, and the prices are outrageously high for what is served.
People through out the restaurant were complaining about service. Good luck to Pancho's .. We won't be back

Best Mexican food I had in a long time.  Prices are a little high but worth every penny.  Meat used was top notch and service was great.  Free fried ice cream with Yelp check in and it's good for 2-3 people.  Will definitely be back

Well, pros and cons. The food is quite expensive and tonight is was salty. We started out with the queso with artichokes. It was not that great. It did not come with tortillas,  which I thought was standard, my mistake. For my main course, I had the enchiladas del Mar with crab and shrimp. The enchiladas by themselves were alright,  but the rice & beans were awful. The garnishment on the rice looked like a side salad of carrots and cabbage....WAY TOO MUCH!  Service was decent. The layout of the restaurant is horrible on the upper level. There is not much space for aisle walking and you walk right past other tables, almost brushing them. I think if I was fat, I would've hit the guests.  Our wait time was 1 hr 45 minutes, we ended up waiting about an hour, which we were happy about. The last thing we ended with was the tres leches, it was the best part of the whole night. Only thing missing is fresh strawberries on top. I won't be back. If you want good Mexican food, go to Lindo Michoacan in Centennial.

Preposterous. Avoid this place at all costs unless you like to be ripped off. As a Vegas local, I do NOT like to be price gouged just because a business has an expensive building and high overhead. I have a million other choices. Just because it is Summerlin also does not excuse how ridiculously marked up Pancho's entire menu is. There are plenty of restaurants in downtown Summerlin that are good and don't have these outrageous prices. 

I made the mistake of not checking Yelp reviews before trying this place. I wanted an unbiased opinion because my friends and I have been waiting for this place to open for so long. It seems a lot of the Yelp reviews echo our thoughts as well. The exterior and interior *are* very beautiful. I like the openness feeling when you walk into the front entrance. The seating for waiting is a little awkward, some wooden benches and not enough of them. There is a fairly sizable bar area but we did not get a drink in the bar. My visit was on 12-5-15 on a Saturday night at around 7:30pm. We were given a pager and waited about 20 or 25 minutes, then we were led up the staircase to a small table overlooking the downstairs. 

The ceiling and decor are elaborate, yes. It's very beautifully decorated. Our server was nice and friendly enough. I didn't catch her name, but service wasn't anything to write home about. And that's where anything positive ends. 

They don't have a drink menu anywhere, and the little drink signs on the tables only list the brand of draft beer. NO prices anywhere. My friend ordered a Pacifico draft and I ordered a Titos vodka and club soda, and ice water. Guess it was our bad to not ask how much the drinks were... 

This place isn't authentic Mexican anything. Complimentary chips and salsa are cold chips and store-bought jarred salsa with zero flavor. No hot sauce to be seen anywhere on the tables. 

My friend ordered carnitas enchiladas ($19.95) and I ordered tacos de pescado (with salmon) also $19.95. It seemed that NOTHING on this menu is under $19.95... everything was extremely overpriced. The price did not reflect quality. My tacos came out and there are just two of them, and a slop of some weird beans. Yuck. I tried to pick up a salmon taco but it just falls apart. It had a lot of fillers in it, where the heck is the salmon? It's chopped up into tiny pieces, and the rest of the taco is filled with tomatoes and chopped iceberg lettuce. Disgusting. It lacked flavor, so BLAND! I tried to pick it all apart with my fork, it just wasn't worth the price. 

How many freakin people do you need to constantly interrupt us to check on our table? I can count at least 6 people besides our waitress who kept trying to take our plates away. I felt a bit rushed and I don't like that. My plate didn't even look like I touched it, and my friend had quite a lot of food still, and an older gentleman came over to our table and asked if he could take our plates away. He already had his hand on my platter before I said anything, and by this time... I was SO over it. Just take it. It's too bad, I was still hungry but completely lost my appetite here. 

There was some band setting up downstairs in the bar area and we could hear them practicing. Our waitress, although she was nice... seemed to rush us with the bill. Then when we got the bill, holy cow we both about lost it. $9.75 for a short glass of vodka and club soda!!?!?! $7.50 for a Pacifico DRAFT!??! WHAT!!! Our bill for two people, two drinks each, and two basic dinner entrees came to $79.95!! I saw they had tres leches on the dessert menu but seriously, $9.95 for a piece of moist cake? No thanks. 

After seeing the bill with the drink prices, my friend and I were completely ticked off. And then, suddenly when we wanted to pay there was no one to be found upstairs.
