After all those people that were stopping at our tables, suddenly they all just disappeared. We flagged down a different waiter and settled our bill. Just a total let down experience overall. 

If you want real Mexican food at reasonable prices with REAL homemade margaritas and salsa.... take my advice and go to Juan's Flaming Fajitas on Ft Apache and Tropicana on the southwest side of town. They treat you way better at Juan's and their food is so much better. Wish we went there. 

Shame on the owners and management for overcharging! Never coming here again.

This little jewel is a fabulous destination, a favorite of mine when visiting Las Vegas. Great location, the decor is so charming you feel like you are in your Abuelitta's kitchen. This visit I had the Burrito Carnitas Especial, and fried ice cream. Excellent vegan and vegetarian choices! Our sever Miguel was the best! Do yourself a favor and pay them a visit!

$16 for one burrito with no beans or rice included.  Meal was room temperature not hot.  Wondered why there were no drink prices on menu...............$3.75 for lemonade or soda! Burrito flavor was okay but needed a magnifying glass to find the meat. Won't be returning.

What a great place!! Very clean and love the atmosphere. The food was wonderful. Two of us ordered the Flauntas and the serving was so large we weren't able to finish it. The side orders of rice and beans are very generous. They definitely do not skimp on portion size here! The flavored are amazing! The salsa is very flavorful with just the right amount of heat. Waiters are constantly coming around to refill your drinks and chips/salsa. I would highly recommend eating here, I don't think you will be disappointed!
Way over priced!!  They want $18 for a breakfast burrito.  The food is just ok.  I'd rather eat Taco Bell.
I liked panchos, not exactly Mexican food but it was good.. I liked the tortilla soup.. the waiter Chris was really nice

Amazing place, delicious food, best Mexican food here in town!! And great costumer service, Octavio, Hugo and Cinthia made our lunch very pleasant and they always make sure all the time that everything was okay

Worst Mexican food ever! 
We went here when it first opened, with high hopes. Was very disappointed. Tried it again about a month ago. Very disappointed again. The food is awful: it always comes out cold, very overpriced, and taste like all they use is chunks of cold cheese and flavors are not good. I've lived in San Diego over 10 years, where they truly have great Mexican, and I also have in-laws who are Mexican, and we make better food at home. Do not eat here!

It's a little bit pricey but the food was fantastic. I had the tostada vegetariana and I was so stuff I couldn't finish it. Claudia, our waitress was very nice. Our drinks never got below half full. The inside is GORGEOUS! So many plants. Will definitely be coming back!

My family and I have been to Pancho's 5 or 6 times and every time we've had amazing service. Let me say, the food is always great and the prices are fair. The manager, Doug is always pleasant and welcoming. He's so personable with everyone that visits. Thank you for the great service.

I read all of the negative reviews and came with a skeptical view. I have to say that it was really good! We had dinner at the bar, so I can't rate the table service but the bartenders are great! #chavonnerocks We had the taquitos with guacamole to start. Very good. Not the best I have ever had but very solid offering with good home made guac. Chips and Salsa also very good. Previous review of sub-standard salsa is BS. My wife had the Burrito Del Mar with shrimp. Flavor and quality were great but could have included more shrimp than rice (we mentioned that after the fact, because it was not so serious that we would send it back - they comped us tequila shots as an apology #niceform). I had the chicken mole enchiladas. Best Mole in LV! Seriously strong. Really good food, beautiful place, nice bar tenders. We will be back! Regularly! And all of the complaints about pricing? Really? Look at the menu. Read the prices. It is not cheap but given the quality and portion size, I think that it is fair. Not cheap, but not out of line with other high-end mex like Mercardito at Red Rock. Hope that this is helpful and you will give this place a chance. Cheers!

Beautiful restaurant with fresh plants and excellent lighting. The restaurant is open and has authentic paintings, fixtures and furniture. Most importantly the food is phenomenal! I am a regular at the Manhattan Beach Panchos and the new Panchos in Las Vegas is beyond belief! Excellent food and service in an authentic, beautiful atmosphere! The bar offers top quality cocktails and wine and the bartenders are professional and experienced. Just what Vegas needed!

Came in for happy hour which is from 2-7pm during the week. Ordered chicken quesadilla ($7) and strawberry margaritas per the recommendation of the bartender. The margaritas on the rocks are on point!!! Definitely worth the $7.75 per pour. Chicken quesadilla had pulled chicken and was very tasty. Chips and salsa are complimentary- salsa a little spicy but good.

$70 for a taco plate and chimichanga and one glass of wine! Nothing special in the menu. Same thing offered anywhere. The decor was authentic but the poor wait staff - kitchen is up 2 flights of stairs. I tipped extra just because I felt sorry for them.

I'm not sure why people are hating so hard on this place, especially considering the lack of margarita-making establishments in the area. 

Yes, it's pricey, but it's Downtown Summerlin - also the portions are legit. I came during lunch and have to say - I'm down with the authentic ambience. Plus, the high ceilings are decor are awesome. 

I ordered the Birria and it was delicious! The two people I ate with were also very happy with the food. It was definitely a more expensive lunch than normal...BUT they also have a good happy hour. I didn't get a chance to experience it but it looked like a great deal.

Bottom line - don't trust the bad reviews, go try Pancho's for yourself. The food was much better than I expected and if you don't love it, at least it's nice to look at!

Had an amazing time at this perfect place with ambiance. Perfect shrimp salad and tried the skirt steak. Super yummy beans both pinto and refried. Got to sit next to the fountain and had really amazing and attentive service. 
Food was super flavorful and staff beyond attentive. Check it out for something special.

Wow! This was the worst Mexican food I've had, ever. The rice was bad, the enchilada tortilla's tasted out of date, and I wouldn't be surprised is the chile relleno was for a health choice microwave dish. The place looks awesome. The prices are a little more than most mall Mexican restaurants. Service was prompt. But if you actually want to eat at a restaurant go anywhere else. Anywhere. I'll be surprised if this place stays a float for another year without changing the quality of food.
Cadillac Margarita was not. Came with lemon peel. Cheese enchiladas are unremarkable. Service is less than stellar. Prices are strip prices for bland, uninspired Mexican.
Awesome Mexican food!  Fabulous service and really cool atmosphere!!  Best margaritas in Las Vegas!
The service was good and the restaurant is gorgeous but the food was not what I expected from an "authentic" Mexican restaurant. Lovely as this place is, I will not be going back.

Great atmosphere, food, and service! Spot on flavors! Free chips and salsa. Free fruit and champagne for Sunday brunch... And free fried ice cream with yelp check in. Even without the freebies, we will be regulars. We are fans of Old Town SD and local Lindo Michoacan. Super happy family of four!

We were SO excited about their opening! We had read all about the Manhattan Beach location and had high hopes. Unfortunately, management made the call to open way too early. Servers were not trained at all nor well versed in the menu. Our order came out wrong and had to be sent back. Like other reviewers mentioned, at $18-24 a plate portions are on the small side and with no side dishes included...the prices are exorbitant! The food was average at best. Sad because we were looking for something outstanding.

This place is so yummy!!  I love Mexican food and this is the first place that's got great atmosphere AND food!  Finally.  The service will s always great too.  Prices a bit steep, but they have coupons, so makes up for it.

This place is outta sight! I love the steak quesadilla! OMG! And the SALSA is incredible!! I have been there 3 times in 1 month and the service is always on point! You have to try it! Although it is a bit pricey, it definitely worth it!!!
oh wow, their chicken chimichanga is delicious!  Everyone is friendly, yummy chips but salsa is too spicy for us.

Panchos Located in Downtown Summerlin Las Vegas NV.

Gorgeous Mexican Restaurant!! Beautifully Decorated Throughout.

Super Staff! Friendly and Efficient 

Appetizers Are Really Good- note- Get The shredded beef nachos ;)

Atmosphere is perfect for a family gathering or a nice dinner for two. 

Dinner was pretty good. Our waitress Carrissa was extremely professional, friendly and offered Wonderful customer service. That is ALWAYS a  plus when you go out to eat!

Our Appetizer (Shredded Beef Nachos) came out promptly. It was more than enough for the 3 of us to share. 

The shredded beef was really good and the nachos had an exact amount of cheese, shredded beef, jalape√±os ratio going on to make it a delicious meal within itself.

My enchilada sauce was a bit different. Not quite red, not quite brown basically a combo of the two colors. It wasn't hot at all. Maybe it was tex-mex? I'm not sure. I personally did not care for it. I think I will go with a Verde next time.  

Husband had a shredded beef burrito which was delicious minus the cheese sauce NO BUENO. It wasn't good at all.

 Personally, I believe, if the sauces were changed it would help the dish be the amazing dish is was meant to be!! Nothing can kill a dish more than a  meh- nah sauce that drowns out the delicious flavors under it. For now,  I recommend skipping the sauces. Just my opinion of course. 

In all fairness- My suggestion is that  I  would love to see this restaurant create another Red Chile sauce. You know more traditional Mexican Red Chile Sauce please :)

 Beans and rice were pretty good.

Based on Location, Atmosphere, Customer Service, And Delicious Appetizers I Would Recommend.

We had brunch on a Sunday and it was absolutely FANTASTIC!!  We got chips and salsa and a fruit salad as a starter.  Each adult was served a glass of champagne (with refills).  The servings sizes were perfect and the food came quickly and was fresh.  I HIGHLY recommend the brunch menu.  The Huevos Rancheros were AMAZING and I can't wait to go back and have them again!  Miguel took fantastic care of us.  I will ask for him by name next time.

First,  you can't beat the building and decorations. It's pretty cool to step into Mexico for dinner.  The small guacamole was more than enough for my wife and I. The fish tacos had a lot of fish in them and tasted great but the crab and shrimp quesadilla was fantastic! Get it!

Panchos has great food, great margaritas and the ambiance is awesome. 
The inside is like sitting outside in a Mexican villa. Tropical trees and a winding staircase make it seem intimate even though it's just one room. The food is excellent and they have a gluten free menu. I usually get the mole chicken, it comes with the rice and beans as usual. I get corn tortilla to sop up the sauce. The margaritas are a nice size and they don't skimp on the tequila. You can get any one of the dozens of tequilas they have on the menu. I tried the queso fun dido but I didn't like it. They told me it was their own spin, meaning people must order it then complain. The fun of fun dido is wrapping The gooey cheese around a fork and wiping it in the tortilla. Panchos is very runny and I didn't care for it.  The free chips and salsa are excellent, one of the best salsas I've had. Got a little kick to it, which is how I like it. I recommend this place highly

Been looking forward to trying out this new restaurant despite a lot of negative reviews. My wife and i went in today around 2pm and they were busy. 
Had to wait about 15 minutes for a table so we went to the bar for a beer and a margarita. $18.95 for 2 drinks, ok a little pricey which now pushed my expectations to a higher level.
We both had soup, the Albondigas and their Chicken Tortilla soup were both very good, hot and flavorful. Our entrees were Carnitas Ramon and the Artichoke and Avocado burrito. portions were huge and both dishes were very good. The carnitas was very very lean. Over all the food was plentiful, and delicious. Our server was very polite and helpful. Besides being a little pricey we enjoyed our experience and will be back.

Service was fine, food was OK, prices are insane.

This is a great looking restaurant, and I was so excited to visit that I went on the second day it was open. I won't judge the service too much since it's always crazy during the opening, although I'm not sure why waiters always feel comfortable complaining about their day and other customers to me (this happens at many restaurants, not just this one).

Pancho's is basically a '90s throwback Mexican restaurant with Americanized Mexican food, which isn't a bad thing. The obsession with authenticity has made me miss this stuff, but I can't imagine the reviewers who are calling this authentic have ever been outside their all-inclusive in Cancun.

We ordered an appetizer platter, which was about $18, and while it was big, it would've been cheaper at any other Mexican restaurant. The quesadillas were great, and the rest was standard. My husband got the steak fajitas, and this was the tiniest serving of fajitas I've ever seen, but he said the steak was excellent. I got the Pancho's trio of enchiladas, and they were your usual enchiladas, both in size and flavor.

We thought about ordering the $16 guacamole, but the waiter said we can try the side portion that comes with our appetizer platter. It's pretty much just mashed up avocado. No flavor whatsoever, and they charge more than any place I've ever been to, including those on the Strip.

All the food was good but in no way justifies the fact that they charge twice as much as every other Mexican restaurant. This is probably the most expensive Mexican place I've seen, and there was absolutely nothing special about the food. They'll need to cut the prices by nearly half to keep a regular clientele. We spent $67 on those three items, and went to Casa Don Juan the next week and got the same stuff for $28, and it tasted much better.

Another problem was that there were little kids running around all over the place. None of them were with the same party, but for whatever reason, everyone felt comfortable letting their kids run around in circles in a packed restaurant full of rushing waiters. It's common to see someone who doesn't care what their kid is doing, but it's just weird when it's a room full of careless parents.

The waiter said seafood is their specialty, so I'll go back to try it and see if it's any better than the rest. Unlike what the last reviewer said, we are not cheap. We regularly eat at restaurants that are more expensive than this, but the quality matches the price at those places. Pancho's just doesn't do it. I figure this restaurant will attract the same flavorless Summerlin soccer mom crowd as Crave.

This place is interesting. Chips and salsa was good. I had a beef taco and a chicken tamale. The beef taco was full of flavor and was really good. The tamale was so dry I couldn't eat it. The price point was kind of high. The fried ice cream is a scoop of ice cream covered in Frosted Flakes... not what I was expecting at all

I'll give it 3 Stars because it isn't horrible. The food is ok. It is just over priced.

The building is beautiful and I am sure they have high rent to pay, but I'm not paying it anymore...even for the convenience of being close to my to my house. I have been about 10 times.

The do send out a 2 for 1 val pack coupon. I would recommend using that.

Sit down Mehxican restaurant.
The place is beautiful, 5 stars if that was all you were rating on.
Go into the bathroom, i mean holy cow!
We went on a Monday, to catch the Vegas Cakes show and the place was pretty quiet.
We sat in the cantina since that was where they were showing it and it was occupied by one other table of people and sat with a shark floating overhead.
They have high tops and a couple regular height tables to choose from.
Not sure if it was because we sat in the cantina, but the four of us received one menu and one happy hour flyer, the good news is we were going to be there a while so we passed the menu around.
Ordered a couple margarita and they packed a punch, children had virgin daiquiris which they enjoyed.
You get chips and salsa which is nice, chips were edible, but nothing to get excited about. The salsa was decent, but expected a lot more flavor for a high end Mexican place.
Monday had 2.50 tacos in the cantina, we should have stuck with these, the tacos were decent and 2.50 would be a good deal.
Two tacos, maybe half a cup of rice and same for beans will cost you 6 times that.
The chili relleno was soggy, tasted alright though.
My son beamed over his chimichanga
Service was pretty good after we ordered.
Check in on yelp to get a free fried ice cream.
This is a fried ice cream with a lot of cinnamon. Cannot complain since it was free and it was dessert!
So the food was decent, better than the rest of the countless Mexican restaurants in the valley? No.

So it boils down to okay food, good drinks and awesome decor.
Our bill was well over $125 before adding a tip, with 4 drinks two of which had alcohol.
Way too much, sorry.

Absolutely the worst service. Took an hour just to get our ice tea, and after sitting their for an hour and receiving my sons food- we waited 34 minutes for our waitress to come around to bring us ketchup. Don't waste your time.
The service was good but their food is not impressive. I have had a lot better and the prices are kinda high. Don't order the queso... It was cream cheese... And it was $15.

I have been waiting for this place to open a long time.  It did not disappoint!  Food is fresh and authentic. Service is great with Jesus Garcia as the server and Luis Valenzuela as busser. When I asked Cesar Cardona to recommend a dish, he was happy to go to the kitchen to get me taste of it. With so many great dishes on the menu, I can hardly wait to come back.

Decided to grab lunch after strolling downtown Summerlin. Our server was Claudia and we had a fantastic lunch with great service. The name Pancho's attracted me to check this place out because I remember the name when I lived in Houston which was phenomenal. I don't think they're the same owners. However, we enjoyed the tacos al pastor and chicken quesadillas. The portions are pretty large, since I had a big appetite and bringing home leftovers. We enjoyed the house chips and spicy salsa. Oh yeah, when we checked in on yelp we received a complimentary fried ice cream dessert to share! It's was a pretty good size and delicious! I love the festive decor and ambiance. I'm sure it would look beautiful at night with all of the lights. Will be back and maybe bring my parents for dinner.

Good food but not great, especially for the price.. There are so many of these fancier Mexican spots that all have that same americanized taste! Service was good and the ambiance is well executed, just not enough flavor and that's the most important part.

The rajitas were soooo delicious. We ordered shrimp and steak combo. Was perfectly seasoned and succulent. The queso dip appetizer is also a must try. The guacamole was a huge portion that could feed 4-6 easily. It's a nice cozy vibe inside with dim lighting and music that's not overbearing. Definitely coming back.
My hubby and I just enjoyed a delicious lunch brunch while watching football. The food was very tasty, and the service was good. We will be back

Looks goods from the outside. They advertise a happy hour in the bar, $5.50 for a Bud Light draft, I knew I was in trouble, just another over priced Mexican joint. 2 tacos, rice and beans $14.95, WOW.

Me and one of my friends went to Pancho's in downtown summerlin last Sunday - they had just opened October 15/ with a soft opening on the 14th - our server had informed us. 

Anyways, the location is awesome, as the downtown summerlin mall continues to grow, everyone loves Mexican food . So, the location was a no brainer. I personally, could see this place as one of my new happy hour spots. One of those places that could be, "the place", this could be it. 

So, me and my friend come to eat here after I tell her I ve been waiting for this place to open, I call and found out this place just opened ! 

The ambiance and architecture are beautiful. When you go inside, you feel like you went on a vacation, it doesn't feel like the Las Vegas desert anymore ! It feels tropical and the glass windows add something new and inviting ! 

We got free champagne and the lobster taco s were amazing ! My friend's breakfast she said was just ok! Breakfast may not be their speciality ! 

I love the place so far . I d say to lower prices somewhat and add more marketing and incentives for happy hour and ladies' night . In addition, they did say they do karaoke and play music. The bar area is huge ! I ll be back otherwise !

Man today we stumbled up Panchos and I wish I had tried this place out sooner.. we discovered it from the directory in downtown summerlins shopping area but decided to try to check this place out . It is in the parking lot where Trader Joe's is and has lots of parking .

Upon entry I fell in love with the decor ..

We were here around lunch time and had Agustin as our server he was super friendly . Their menu is large and it isn't "cheap" which I admit at first alarmed me but let me tell you the quality of the food definitely made up for the cost .

We got our free chips and salsa and chowed those down a long with our Diet Coke which came with a little pitcher that lasted our whole meal . It's a pet peeve of mine to run out of soda so I was stoked about that .. I definitely saw tons of stuff on the menu I wanted but opted to let our server choose by asking his favorite item on the menu .

Just my luck he loved the Philly Cheesesteak Burrito and helped my Mom pick this chicken and mango salad and they both were awesome . Which was delivered to our table with a smile and friendly greeting from Gustavo.

The steak was super tender and the veggies delicious but not too over powering and the red sauce on top was top  notch neither of us could finish our whole portion but man did we try! I tasted the salad my mom GoT and the chicken was really flavorful and not chewy and the greens and fruit were super fresh it had mango and grapes and pepita seeds ? I think but either way it was yummy!

If you check in here you can currently get a free fried icecream but we were too full to try it out ..

Over all for $40something we got two sodas and entrees and could of had dessert.. but even Hector was super friendly while clearing our table ...

When we were leaving I stopped to take pictures of the bar area ... guess who else is super nice??? Daniel the bartender who wanted to pose for a photo and who comes around the corner ? My server Agustin to joke around saying I don't want one of him..

It's clear to me this place employs the right people who must have good management keeping them happy .. definitely can't wait to come try some margaritas and happy hour specials

Seriously????? How they get five stars review?? Extremely overpriced,food is ok & sad part is even the waiter doesn't know anything about their food, we ask for a suggestion he says he has no clue,now they're sending me two for one,lol I'll never ever go to this restaurant good luck to them!!

So after many past debates on coming into Panchos, we decided to visit today on National Margarita Day during happy hour. Since their opening, we've heard the same reviews (and Yelp reviews confirm the rumors) that the food is yummy but very overpriced. We heard the best time to go is during Happy Hour so we finally decided to check them out during their Happy Hour. Quickly into our visit, we immediately agreed the prices were very high, including happy hour. The ambiance is awesome and makes you feel like you're not in Vegas but the prices remind you that you haven't left the city, even with the happy hour prices.

We sat at the bar and the service was great from bartender, manager and food runner but ugh that doesn't compensate the high menu prices. Mexican food is affordably reasonable but $15 for guacamole??? I couldn't convince myself to pay that price. My bf ordered the Wahoos tacos ($19, 2 tacos with rice & beans) but that was his only meal for the day so he splurged. He said they were yummy but expensive.  

Also their menu is very long. You feel like you're reading a book when browsing through the options which immediately turned me off. Honestly it took me a bit to find the guacamole b/c I was scamming the menu looking for it and it blended right into the other menu items.

Great ambiance but high prices to pay for it
Ambiance is great but food falls short of being authentic. Food is very bland. Price is high for sub par food. Service is okay. Disappointing reunion dinner with friends. Won't be going back.

The service was nice, but took a while.  My friends who I went with are regulars... They said t was unusual the food takes this long.  Chips and salsa kept coming, yummy!  Food was eh, I wouldn't call it bad though... Got the free fried ice cream, YUMMY!! Didn't mind going, but wouldn't go again.

Had to try it.  All the reviews were different and it was hard to determine if it was worth it. Well I loved it. Staff is warm and friendly.  Great food options and large menu.  Typical traditional Mexican food.  Very good.  I thought very flavorful. Tacos were great. I'll be back.

First the good...
The building is very nice and the decor also.  The service was also pretty good but the place wasn't full. That's it.

The bad...
The food was expensive, probably averaging $20 a plate.  The food also wasn't very good.  Very bland.  Totally disappointing.  Without some serious changes I'd be surprised if the place will be in business at this time next year.

I came here for the first time last week and the food in one word, amazing.  The price is what keep me away for a while but let me tell you it is worth it, very authentic and flavorful. On top of this the employees were very nice, I asked for recommendations and I got so much helpful information and while we were eating our food the owner/manager came over and made us feel so welcome and even covered our alcohol charges! Will rush back!

This was the grossest Mexican food I've ever had. I was so embarassed for my life being at this establishment. It was so so so expensive (20$ for 2 tacos?!) LOL

Me and bf got the trios enchiladas (chicken beef and cheese) and some birreria de something it was basically shredded beef chunks with pinto beans and rice. The enchiladas were so good except for the chicken one! I received a side plate and opened it up it was literally chicken mush?! It looked and tasted like baby food so I sent it back but nice enough the manager comped my meal. The other entree was good except for the bland sauce and the weird microwaved looking oily bland tortilla soup.

The drinks were okay, 13$ for a margarita and 8$ for my michelada. My michelada was delicious. The server was pretty good, attentive and responded well whenever I flagged him down!

I will come back to try other dishes hoping the food is better

Awesome!!!! Delicious fresh Mexican food.  Ice cold beer nachos, tacos, fajitas everything was great.  Service was fast and friendly.  They kept the chips and salsa coming which was very nice.  Classic Mexican food and delicious.

Wow!!! I like other reviewers wrote I wish I would have read the reviews before dining at this place. I will start out by saying that this is not to intend harm on Pancho's but there is a point to where a restaurant should offer soe sort of value to its patrons. This place doesn't. My actual rating would be about 1.5 star so I'm rounding it up.

The atmosphere:
I've seen this place many times before and watched the construction. We decided to dine there on a Sunday for lunch. It's decor reminds me of something you would find near San Diego and the atmosphere is decent. But to me atmosphere doesn't make the place.

The food:
My step-daughter and I ordered the chicken chimichanga which was about $18-19. Definitely pricey for lunch. At first glance I noticed it wasn't in the large side nor was it extremely small. The flavor was ok but the chicken was very dry. The rice and beans that came with the meal could be replaced with any other average rice and beans from another restaurant and I would not have noticed. My wife had the chili relle√±o. I asked her how hers was and she said she's had better. My daughter had a chicken quesadilla which was, get this, $17. Now, she said that it was really good. But this is coming from a 10 year old girl who thinks microwave popcorn is the bomb. 

The service:
Our waitress did definitely make herself seen. The bus person always filled our waters. But no was was overly friendly.

The Overall:
I base a restaurant on whether I would visit it again. This one I would not. All-in-all the meal was under $80 and that is with all of us only ordering water. Really? $80 for lunch? Add in a tip and my bill total was over $92. I've definitely had better food and larger portions at local taco shops and spent less than a 1/3 of that for my entire family.

Sorry Pancho's but listen to your customers reviews. A lot of them are saying the exact same thing as I am. Even though most of those reviewers may not be back, you can protect future patrons. And only very few people decide to leave reviews. You have no idea how many people, who decide not to write their opinion that decide they will not come back because of the value.

Too expensive for what it is! Beautiful decor and giant bar with stage but just not cool to have dinner prices at lunch! Plus not a good place for families 9.95 a kid meal and when you have 5 kids with you o geeeeeezzzeee!

The atmosphere:
5 stars.We had a party of 7 plus a child and made reservations for 630. Reservations highly recommended as this place is rightfully busy! The service was amazing from the hostesses seating us immediately, to the very understanding, accommodating and efficient server,  even the manager, Doug, was friendly and entertaining. 
The Food:
5 stars. We have a very pocky, highly needy (allergies, likes and dislikes) group of friends. This place was spot on! Extremely accommodating, fast, delicious, hot and fresh. Gluten allergies, dairy allergies, vegetarians, you name we have it. The menu offers a very large array of choices. Food was seasoned succulently, prepared quickly and correctly. It was purely amazing! Pancho's is an instant favorite for sure.

Well - I can see why this brand new restaurant only has 3 stars.

Ambiance - 5 stars
Service - 2 stars
Food Quality - 3 stars
Price - 1 star

Unfortunately, ambiance doesn't a good meal make.

We walk in w/ a party of 8 on Sunday at 6pm.  The hostesses look at us, one rolls her eyes, then they ask if we have a reservation.  We didn't, but asked if they could accommodate us and they said it would  be a few minutes.

We walked into the bar area to get a drink while we waited.  The bartender was fantastic, I wanted a skinny margarita w/ no triple sec.  He made a delicious concoction with a grand marnier float and it was fabulous.

They call us up and ask my husband if we want the 18% auto-grat added.  He declined as if the service is good, we generally tip 20% or more.  

They seat us up on the second level, which again, was beautiful.  We are greeted promptly by the server and bussers and we order additional non alcoholic drinks.  Not long after, we had some chips & salsa delivered to the table that were rather good.

We start looking through the menu and realize everything (and i mean EVERYTHING) is over priced.  $20 for Ceviche?  $15 for Guacamole?!? Are you kidding me???

Anyway, we were there w/ family so we decided to just deal.  My husband and I are vegan and noticed very few vegan options on the menu.  No big deal, we'll just modify.  They have a Vegetarian Salad (THIS IS WHAT THEY CALL IT) that includes the Mexican style rice.  Thing is - the Mexican style rice ISN'T vegetarian!! It's made w/ chicken stock!!!  Why would you put a non-vegetarian item in a vegetarian dish??  I am SO GLAD my gut told me to ask.

That being said, I ordered that salad, no rice, no cheese, no sour cream and it was actually rather good.  The dressing they put on it was great too and it was loaded w/ squash and carrots.  I did ask for beans since I wasn't getting the rice, cheese, and cream and they happily obliged.  However, this was a $17 salad.

My brother in law is pretty picky and ordered the philly burritto w/ o the onions or peppers - basically just meat and cheese.  My sister-in-law ordered the beef & beans burrito.  My bro in law's burrito came out w/ just meat.  My sister in law's came out chicken & beans, instead of beef & beans.  Neither came with ANY sides.  For $15 (it might have even been more), it should come with SOMETHING on the side.  My brother in law sent his burrito back and decided he would just wait to eat until he go thome instead of overpaying for the dish.  My sister in law ate hers, but said it was just "meh" - she could get better for a fraction of the price at Roberto's.

We had to ask for ketchup for my nephew's dish 3 times, and had to ask for the check twice (the second time almost 20 minutes after the first).

The manager came over and told my brother in law he wouldn't need to pay for the burrito (said it multiple times like it was some big favor he was doing us).  It was nice he stopped by, but that was a given - I sure hope we aren't paying for food that we sent back because it was deemed sub-par.

I ordered a second margarita, and started to explain to the server what I wanted but then stopped and said, you know what - the bartender will remember, he just made my first one.  The server smiled, shook his head, then walked away.  After I get my second margarita and it tastes NOTHING like the first, I see there's another bar upstairs.  He knew I came up w/ my first margarita...why didn't he ask me to continue because he would be ordering from a different bartender??

I'm just thoroughly disappointed, I really wanted to like this place and was excited about a late night bar (the bar is open until 2) that isn't a pub opening up in the area, however everything is way over priced (just because you're in Summerlin doesn't mean you can overcharge), the food was average and the service was subpar.  I will only likely return if invited for another group event.  It's a shame, because we could have been regulars.

This place is awesome! I got a coupon in the mail for a buy 1 get 1 entree, so I figured I'd take my sisters out to lunch! The ambiance creates the whole environment! I got the enchiladas espinaca and it was deee-lishhh-usss!!! Stuffed with spinach and mushroom with a side of rice and beans made the perfect lunch!! My sisters got the pork burrito and oven burrito, and they enjoyed theirs as well!! The staff is wonderful, we never had an empty glass or empty chip bowl. Wonderful experience for our first time! :) 

*p.s. - if you check in on yelp you get a free fried ice cream!!! And that was amazingly tasty!!

Decided to give this place a shot today (instead of the hamburger place next door) and I'm glad we did!! We came on a Sunday and was asked if we would like fruit and a glass of champagne (no charge) which is a special for Sunday brunch  & the chips and salsa were very fresh and salsa was flavorful too.  My friend had the lobster enchiladas that she said were absolutely delicious!! I had the steak fajitas and the meat was very tender and fajita veggies seasoned perfectly (I got mine minus mushrooms and the cooked tomato on top) it was so much food that we had to take 1/2 of each of our meal home but, that's ok because that's dinner for later & not to mention the delicious fried ice cream that I received at no charge for checking in on Yelp  thank you!!

Went for lunch, feeling sick tonight.  Ordered a burrito from the vegetarian menu.  Waiter looked really confused, he did not know they had a vegetarian menu.  Had the worst burrito in my entire life.  Really, it had broccoli in the burrito ! Total  gringo food.  Really expensive too !

We live in Summerlin and love having Downtown Summerlin so close to be able to go to so many great spots to eat, shop and see movies.  

4 of my girlfriends met at Pancho's to celebrate my birthday at 7p.m. and had one of the BEST EXPERIENCES AND FOOD EVER! 

 Everything was TOP NOTCH.  The waiters and staff were all super friendly, funny, attentive.....just great.  And I use to be a waitress at Tony Roma's back in the day for 2 years....so I appreciate good service.  I'm very picky.   
The food was delicious!  We all ordered a variety of different dishes and we all loved what we got!  Finished everything on our plates.

The prices were not bad at all.  Same as any other place in town, but the atmosphere, service and food were better than anywhere else I've been in town!  And I've been here for over 40 years!

I HIGHLY RECOMMEND PANCHO'S!

I've already told all my friends about it....you'll love it!

Excellent food and service!!! Claudia was exceptional!!! 
The atmosphere was amazing!! 
I will be back!!!

While it is a nice looking restaurant, the food is run of the mill Tex Mex that you can get anywhere. The only difference is that at Pancho's, the food is double the price. The drinks were good and I may go back for happy hour, but I cannot recommend this place. I would be really surprised if they survive another year.

Yum!! I had the cheese enchilada and a chili relleno plate. It was so good, cheesy and fresh and the servings are huge. Service was fast and friendly- even being super busy we were attended to quickly. It is a little pricy but I also think most places is summerlin are. If you want cheap Mexican go to Roberto's, ya get what you pay for and I thought Pancho's was worth the price. I'll definitely be back. Mmm and their salsa was nice and spicy.

Food was pretty good! Unfortunately I feel like I got Panched in the Noggin with there ridiculous prices. I got a 2 enchilada combo plate for $17.99. Wife got a bean and cheese burrito for $14.99. Each got 1 alcohol beverage and the bill was $59.60. Yes I seen the prices before I ordered but figured what the hell and that's exactly what I got at the end when it was time to pay up. I guess my fault but will not be returning unless those Summerlin Mexican hot plate prices drop a little. My head is still spinning....
The service is great the food is good but the  price range is high and to top it all off they don't serve menudo or pozole are you kidding me it's a Mexican restaurant

Had an awesome time Martha was our server and she was absolutely amazing. never had to wait. The food was amazing. Home made salsa rocked our world. Only thing is was a little pricier than i would have liked.

I've wanted to try them since they opened up but just never got the chance to.. we finally tried them last night and i was a bit disappointed. Our waiter was great he was very nice and didn't leave us waiting too long before checking if we needed anything, he even comped us the tortilla soup, however, for the price of the food, I don't think it's worth it. It wasn't very flavorful, I had the diablo puffy tacos and it wasn't spicy at all. Great environment though!

It's a beautiful restaurant with a nice, semi romantic ambiance. Our server, Ivan, was really good, attentive, charming and gave great recommendations for cocktails and food. Complimentary chips with a spicy red salsa and warm chips were an awesome start. I got the chimichanga de mar, grilled shrimp, onions, pico and I think it had cheese and maybe a little rice in it, really liked it but it was huge so I have leftovers. We will definitely go back, our bill was 71 with a $15 tip so just a little expensive but worth it for a nice date or family dinner. It was my boyfriend and I,  we each got a house cocktail and an entree.

Nice decor and service was okay, but one of the worst meals my husband and I have had in a long time. You can taste the preservatives.  It took us four hours to not feel nauseous from the meal. Like a belly boom. We will not be going back.  Anyone giving this more than 3 stars has very poor taste!
Delicious food, great atmosphere, excellent service and LIVE entertainment!! What more could you ask for? This place just opened and will be THE spot before you know it.

What a beautiful place! Be sure to check out the entire place even if you don't like the food. I only ordered the nachos (on the appetizer menu) and it was not bad. Everyone else in my group loved the food despite its high prices. There's music every night starting around 9 or 10 PM. I'd come back although I will not sit in the bar area as it has bad acoustics, thus making the place super loud.
I enjoyed the Puffy Shrimp Tacos while watching Pancho's hilarious comedy show in the huge cantina! If you're looking for quality Mexican food with a great margarita, this is the place to go!

Had lunch there this Saturday.   The atmosphere was very good and the service was Outstanding.  Our server, Lee, was very attentive and helpful.   The food was some of the best Mexican we have had in Vegas and the prices were reasonable, especially for the amount and quality you get..   Will definitely be going back there again for dinner

This is a very nice Mexican restaurant.  The service was great , the food was great , and the restaurant was very nicely decorated.  Beautiful Mexican tiles, Tiffany lamps, and a French bar .  You can read all about it on the last page of the menu .  The mole sauce was excellent and the Rajitas were sizzling at table side .  I will definitely be back .

Had a great dinner at Panchos tonight. The wait was long, expected that because it's brand new, but time went by quick while I had a drink in the bar and watched MNF(Monday night football)... Awesome bar area with good HD TV's.. The scenery in this place is great. Definitely the best Mexican food I've had since I moved here a year ago.

So I happened to be at downtown Summerlin, and I stopped in to try this place on a Sunday, and discovered a gem. The restaurant itself is gorgeous, and the bar is awe inspiring. It is probably the best designed Mexican restaurant I have seen.

The fruit and champagne was a great way to start. I ordered the puffy shrimp tacos, and could barely finish them. All of that plus the cinnamon  bunuelos made the price of $20.99 worth it.  I did think that some of the items were overpriced, like the guacamole and huevos ranchero, but enjoyed my meal.

I stopped in again on Monday which is ladies' night and had an even better experience. 1/2 prices apps, and $5 margaritas, plus live music, by a guy named Edgar, whose mix of classic Latin sound crossed with some modern songs made my night.

The service I received from Jason who was behind the bar was amazing. Not only was he attentive, making sure I never had to ask for anything, but the guy makes a mean margarita! He talked me into trying one of his bloody Mary's.  The best one I have ever had was at a bar in Los Angeles back in 1989. His blew that one away! As I watched him make it, his ratio of ingredients should not have worked, but was I wrong.  It will be even longer before I find someone to top him!

Jason talked me into trying the chile verde, which was a great call. I would not have been able to finish it even if I had not ordered an app before hand.  Portion size was ridiculous.

This has no become my favorite Monday night hang out because of the amazing cantina area, great bartender, and entertainment.  Well done, guys!

AVOID THIS PLACE UNLESS YOU DON'T MIND PAYING THROUGH THE NOSE FOR BASIC MEXICAN FOOD! I did check Yelp prior to going in and there was only two $$ so I figured it would be reasonably priced. WRONG! We ordered two margaritas which were OK but nothing to write home about. Then we perused the menu. Outrageous prices. Our baby started getting whiny so we used him as an excuse to bone out. $26.00 for 2 margaritas. Dinner would have easily been over $100 and the menu choices are basic. But hey, maybe you guys are rich??

We have been searching for good Mexican food and we have struck gold. Good food, great, prompt, friendly service, and a fun inviting environment. Must try the fried ice cream! It is the best I have ever had!

I was disappointed because we were welcome into the bar area and ate and drank. They were having disco night and we were enjoying the music and Jason asked us if we weren't going to order anymore. If not could we leave. We had a party of seven and I have never been asked to leave. How rude.
First time here & let's just say amazing! Great authentic Mexican food for a decent price. Definitely reminded me of Mexico love this place!

Really over priced for very average Mexican food. I had a burrito and it was like $19 .. Crazy. 

The decor is nice so I gave them 2 stars. 

I probably wouldn't come back.
I am unsure what negatives are saying. Great place. GORGEOUS... Unbelievably nice people work here. Management is amazing and very involved. Really worth trying...

Terrible mexican food. No flavor, dry pork, watery soup, below standard drinks and all at high steak house prices. True, the attmosphere is nice, service good and the guacamole and salsa fresh but not enough to fix the bad food and high prices. Don't bother going in, you would do far better at numerous other mexican places.
The environment is authentic and very green. If you are looking for live entertainment and Mexican backgrounded selfies, choose their concert or happy hour time. Food was average and way overpriced.

I gave 2 stars because of the overall visit but I am willing to give it another shot being that this place is just a few months old. Our server was awesome and very pleasant and accommodating. The food selection was great and everyone else in our party had a great dinner. But what messed it up for me was when my food came out with rock-hard rice kernels, it just ruined it completely. I hope they learn to check their rice cooker for old and expired rice. It's just gross.

I asked for the manager and he was very understanding and offered a free dinner of my choice upon my return.

Last Friday, the 16th, we dined for the first time at Pancho's and due to high prices, instead chose happy hour in the bar.   But alas!  The prices were so much more than all the other happy hours in town that we decided to split an order of $17 FAJITAS on regular menu.  I wanted a margarita but my only choice was $7.50 so I opted for a $5.00 Negro Modelo.   The chips and salsa were very good and so were the nicely charred chicken fajitas, an ample portion.

The best part of our experience was our very competent & personable server Claudia who belongs in a 5 star restaurant.  We also appreciated the ambiance and the fact that their TV screens are terrific & well situated for watching a game.

With the huge population of Mexican restaurants in our city, as well as happy hours at almost any restaurant, Pancho's has much competition.  They could begin by dropping the prices and changing the music.  We're waiting (way too long) for this town to come out of the clouds & take advantage of fine music for ALL generations.  Let's begin to EDUCATE, think outside the box, & not do "business as usual."

Food was good but pricey.... service was horrible ... came with broken glass.. forgot our appetizer , and the bill had errors .. 

So will I come back ..: a big fat NO ... next time I want to spend $20.00 on a burrito I will go somewhere else..

I was craving fajitas and decided to check this place out versus going to Juan's Flaming Fajitas (a favorite spot for Mexican Food). Their fajitas are ok, the meat is very tender and has a different flavor, however there wasn't much of it. Tried the cake for dessert and it was a very large portion that tasted OK. I've never had Tres Leches cake before so I can't compare it to anything, but I probably wouldn't order it again. 

There was no drink menu on the table which I thought was kind of odd. Two managers (I think they were Managers) came to the table more than once and interrupted us. I appreciate their concern, but more than 3 times of checking on us is a bit excessive - let the servers do their job! 

I agree with other reviews regarding their price point, it is a bit high and I'm not sure why -- Nothing about the food was special and IMO being in Summerlin is not a good reason. Although we didn't explore the menu at all and stuck with a boring dish such as fajitas, we probably won't go back.

Just to be objective in my assessment, this is visit #3.
I ordered Enchiladas de Mole, traditional Mole Poblano made from Ancho and Pasilla chiles, sesame seeds and peanuts. It was good BUT, what I should have ordered was the Pollo en Mole Verde with a green cilantro lime rice. The food after three visits here both at lunch and dinner is consistently good, spot on high quality ingredients. 
The service: in all fairness, my first visit was chaos because it was opening week. The following two visits both dinner and now lunch, the bar staff is exceptionally engaging and gregarious (Kelly & Jessica). 
The Margaritas: base tequila is Cuervo Gold. Total liquor is 2.25-oz. at a painful $10.50. The three closest competitors within less than a 5mi radius use a 100% Agave tequila unlike Cuervo's (mixto), pour 3-oz of liquor at $11. One establishment has it at $10 using Patron at 2.75-oz.
The bottom line: Food is good, service is good, booze is above average albeit value-wise it fails. One final note; it is truly a shame that anyone can Google their Manhattan Beach menu and see that the Las Vegas pricing is a whopping $3 more straight across the board! Did they not think that the Las Vegas locals were not smart enough to investigate that??? The happy hour is loooong! Starting at 2/2:30 through 6pm but, it is so complicated!! And, worse yet, of no real value. A $2 savings is not a happy hour although, I suppose if you milk it by staying the entire 3+ hours then MAYbe it's a better value.

I went for opening night.  The food was awesome and the d√©cor was stunning.  The servers were nice and well trained despite it being opening night.  I highly recommend Panchos.   I have been to Panchos in Manhattan Beach and this place like the original  will soon become the go to place for big parties, family celebrations, intimate dinners and a night out on the town with live music and great margaritas.

Great service! Great environment!  Nice HD TVs, cool bartenders. . . Incredibly overpriced. Food is great but holy shit, it's Mexican food, $18.95 for a Carne asada quesadilla, $7.50 for Negra Modelo draft. . . Am I on the strip or something? Even though food and service were great,  never coming back here.
The Service is awesome - the Birria Chef Ramon is outstanding - very comfortable - a little pricy but who is not this day and age - all in all good place to check out

Great service, brought all 4 kids and 2 adults and they were nothing but happy and helpful to us. The manager even brought my kids coins to throw in the water fountain to make a wish and kids got free ice cream!! Fun atmosphere and good as Mexican played food gets

Living 2 blocks from Panchos, I was surprised to see that the new restaurant was located in Downtown Summerlin.
We decided to stop for lunch after shopping today.
Upon entering we decided to sit at the Bar as it was closest and usually we get better service sitting at the Bar. Our Bartender/server was very nice.
 I asked for menus and water.
Upon getting the menu I proceeded to check it out.  The cheapest entree for lunch was $15.00. Come on,  really  2 tacos $15.00. 2 enchiladas $15.00.
  a house green salad $7.00.  The Margaritas are made with sweet and sour.  Jesus. They don't even know how to make a real margarita  My enchiladas were so bad I only ate one. 
I give Panchos 6 months and Adios. Shame because it would be nice to have a fun, quality place close to home.

The ambience is great - and the service and welcome attitude is beyond compare-  we went after a long day of tennis and were super hungry and tired- order the typical Mexican food - enchiladas etc - very good Mexican American - food - can tell the kitchen uses top ingredients -! 

We will be back

This place is so much more than the typical Mexican American restaurant.  First, the building is purpose built and has a very authentic feeling.  The stained glass windows throw beautiful light throughout.

The restaurant is much larger than it looks with areas that are broken up.  If you sit in the courtyard area, it can be a bit noisy, but charming.

We enjoyed the chips and salsa.  The salsa while not hot, has a bit of a kick which makes you come back for more.  I had the seafood stuffed poblano pepper which was very enjoyable.  My wife had the fish tacos which were quite flavorful.  The sides of the rice and beans were heads above other Mexican restaurants.  

I wish I had room to try desert, but will have to wait till next time.  We will be back!!!!

Had dinner here last night around 7 pm, it seemed busy from the parking lot but then when we came inside found out otherwise, the hostess greeted us, and even gave us a few options for the table location, witch was nice, then we had been at the table for a few minutes and a table attendant came and brought chips and salsa( as most Mexican restaurant do) we enjoyed a few chips when another table attendant came and asked us if we were ok, we then asked him if we could at least have some water while we waited for our server, then as that gentleman was bringing our waters the server Gustavo passed buy us to offer drinks to the table next to us, there was only two people at the table when we arrived, the rest of the party showed up later, and still received service before us. Finally he came to or table and asked us if we had questions or if we were ready, never did he let us know he was our server, or apologize for him taking so long. We were ready of-cores and had no questions, he then took the menus and was gone for about two minutes, when a food runner brought out some chicken suizas ( chicken enchiladas topped with avocado and sour cream, accompanied with rice and beans, he told me the plate was extremely hot witch it was, the food on the plate was less then lukewarm. And was dumbfounded by the fact that the alb√≥ndigas soup witch my girlfriend ordered came out six minutes later, when we ordered it at the same time???( to me it seemed that what had happened was that food that was brought to me was just sitting in the service window, because the server never came back to ask if it was cooked properly or hot or even to see if we wanted anything else( witch we did). And then manager( who had on a light gray shirt), walked by a few times and made eye contact but never even came over to see what was a matter, I would have loved a fresh plate of food, but no one came by so I ate half and left dissatisfied all around!!!! And service was worse. We had been coming here since they opened here ate Downtown Summerlin. The experience was so awful that I took time out of my day to create a yelp account so that other people would not be as surprised as I was!!

Honestly this was not the restaurant that I thought I wanted to dine at. I knew I was gonna be in the area for shopping, and I knew that part of the name was Pancho's, and when I looked on yelp I thought I was going to the place that I had bookmarked. I don't know how I made such a mistake but what brought me to the supposed restaurant were the pictures, the vegan menu options and such. Nope this was not it! and I didn't realize my mistake until after we placed our order, and was wondering why there was only a breakfast menu and a dinner menu. I thought, 'oh, it must be the weekend so there is no lunch menu'. So I looked on yelp again, and saw the actual menus which didn't look nowhere near the ones I just looked at. oh well..

Anyway, it was too late to leave even though while looking at the menu I realized it was a little pricey for Mexican food. I felt like maybe it was because the area we were in? I'm not totally sure but what we ordered was one taco and cheese enchilada combo, which comes with rice and refried beans,  and the divorced eggs, which is a beef enchilada sandwiched between two over medium eggs, and rice and black beans. I never heard of divorced eggs entrees and I thought if we gonna spend a little more try something new. I liked how the refried beans came out with cheese on top and looks like it was broiled. 

It was ok, nothing special. I was a little disappointed in myself for making such a mistake. I don't like to pay for expensive mexican food that's just standard. There are too many other places around, such as Roberto's taco shop that I am quite fine with. 

The restaurant itself had nice decor, with a bar area and an upstairs. The hostesses, bussers and waiters are nicely dressed. The service is definitely good. 

the bill
diet coke  $3.75
Huevos Divorciados $17.95
#1 combo $18.95

Lesson learned...Yelp more carefully!

Service was ok. Brunch & lunch menus available on Sunday @ 12:30PM & the extra options were nice. Chips were ok. Salsa was ok. Food is quite pricy, but maybe that is more "location" than the norm? Kiddo ordered an oven burrito for $16. Just a burrito. No extras. Hunny offered a carne asada chimi for $19.95 & it came beans, rice, guac & sour cream. The inside of the chimi looked like left over steak fajitas, but it wasn't bad tasting. Overall, it was just ok. Finally tried it so I can check this place off my Downtown Summerlin bingo card  but we will probably skip it in the future.
Good food, good ambiance and good service. We were very satisfied with the food. My wife really loved the enchiladas rancheros. I had the seafood quesadilla and was very good.

The ambiance of this restaurant is very nice. The interior is stunning. The server was attentive and made us feel at home. However, the food is slightly overpriced. The taste and quality does not amount to the absurd prices. I understand it's a nice building and location, but I will not be going back because of the prices. Giving it a 4-star review because everything BUT the prices was great.

Fantastic lunch! Beautiful traditional decor with real paintings, colorful tile everywhere, and stained glass windows. Staff in nice matching 'uniforms' provided very good service. The (justifiably proud) owner came to our table to check on how it was going. 
Food was all deliciously flavorful without being  overpowering or smothered in cheese like so many. My new favorite Mexican restaurant.

This restaurant is really pretty. The food we ordered was good but a little Americanized, which I kinda expected for Summerlin. The portion sizes were pretty big. We had seafood enchiladas and we were surprised at how much seafood was actually in them. All of the staff we dealt with was super friendly.
Panchos was awesome!! My moms 64th birthday was extra special!!! Thank you for the great service and the staff was great

Went there to meet some friends last week during happy hour.  Sat in the bar, which had a good atmosphere.  The menu was expensive.  The Happy Hour Menu was "1/2 off" except for the fish dishes, ie. ceviche and fish tacos, which I thought was lame.  The bartenders were very personable.  There were two large televisions behind the bar and a few more which were good for watching sports.  There was live music starting at 10pm which I did not stay for.  I did not get a chance to eat in the restaurant.

I feel very happy with our visit to Pancho's today! The place is stunning inside and out! I was incredibly impressed with the service we received considering the place was incredibly busy!! I was very happy with quick service, our drinks were out in a flash! ( I had the strawberry margarita on the rocks and a Cadillac margarita on the rocks as well! Both were absolutely amazing) 
I was very happy that the kids food was brought out first since they kids are always fidgety and impatient. Kids ordered a quesadilla came with beans and our choice of fries and macaroni and cheese- the boys devoured their meal and they're usually quite picky when it comes to restaurants! I ordered the burrito ranchero de carnitas and it was worth every penny! Our waiter was very attentive to all our needs, definitely felt the place is family oriented as our kids greatly approved of this restaurant! Definitely making this a regular for Mexican!

Panchos has outdone themselves with Christmas decorations! Beautiful decorations will get you in the spirit of Christmas. I was there last week and returning this week with friends. The food is outstanding, always fresh and delicious. Definitely the top Mexican restaurant in Vegas/Summerlin. The service is friendly and attentive.

Let me start with initial impressions.  Making a reservation was efficient, friendly and painless.  The building is beautiful and it is obvious that it was well thought out.  The interior is equally beautiful with a great looking theme. 

Unfortunately the praise stops there.   After we were seated it was just under 9 minutes before our server acknowledged out existence and took our drink order.  Upon his return, he got two of the three incorrect.  Upon his second return he still had one of them incorrect.  

After the drinks merry-go-round we ordered our meals. While awaiting our entrees we munched away on the fresh made chips that honestly were the shining star of the food offered here.   A server assistant wandered by and proceeded to refill the half empty glass of Sprite with water.  We pointed out the error and he replaced it fairly quickly.  

Our entrees arrived in a reasonable amount of time but unfortunately only two of them along with a partial order for another table.  The third entree was delivered by the manager a couple of minutes later.  Part of me wishes that they never brought them to us.  What an uninspired, boring, and quite frankly tasteless group of entrees.  The chicken tacos has some very flavorful meat tucked inside a corn tortilla with little else.  The refried beans appear to be out of a can and the rice was bland.  This was an $18.00 entree!

The chicken burrito was just downright awful.  I think I have had a more flavorful burrito at Roberto's and Cafe Rio.   The chili verde burrito had some life in it.  The pork was properly cooked, the verde sauce was flavorful and it was presented nicely.   It was not served with the normally present beans/rice which was the same for the chicken burrito.   You would think that for $17.00 it would be a meal not just a burrito on a plate.  

I spoke to the manager at length when he came by and sat down at the empty fourth seat.  Nice enough fellow who apologized for the service issues and heard my critique of the meal. I don't think he took my honesty to heart.   

Overall I can say this place has some systemic issues that will close the doors within a year if they don't correct them.  The service is awful, the food is mediocre at best, the pricing is way out of line for comparable establishments in the Summerlin Mall.  I won't be back and will not be surprised when the name changes to RANDOM_NAME Michoacan.  What a waste of my money and whomever opened this place.   :(

Really expensive for frozen food quality.  Also the lack of customer service is baffling.  I told the waiter that we were celebrating a birthday.  He didn't even ask if we wanted to order dessert.  Our dishes took forever too.  We were seated upstairs where it was dark as a cave...Probably so that we wouldn't be able to see our food.  My enchiladas were flavorless and my rice was hard.  I gave the one star for the cute decor.  I don't recommend this place.  Taco Bell is higher quality.  I bet the rent is expensive in DT Summerlin, but that doesn't justify $70 for 2 TV dinners:(

Average food, but great service. Be sure to make a reservation as this place gets packed...as evident on a Thursday night with every table full. I hosted a group of clients and everyone enjoyed themselves. Beautiful decor, especially the downstairs area with fountain.

Had dinner there last night. Food was good but service was spotty. We waited a while for the appetizers to come out. After they finally did, the main courses came out 3 minutes later. We asked them to bring them back to the kitchen and to bring them out when we had finished the appetizers. Duh! When they brought them out (for the second time), they weren't very warm. They probably just reheated them.
Prices are a bit on the expensive side but we had a BOGO coupon so that made it affordable.

Pancho's overall they do a great job here. Jimmy and a few others always make myself and friends feel like we are at home. Visited twenty times plus for different occasions and most of them are in the front lounge area. Enjoy the lounge because I can eat a decent meal have a few drinks and watch the game or work via wi-if. Try the Philly Burrito it's fantastic.
Absolutely beautiful restaurant! Extremely overpriced! Incredibly slow service on a Friday @ 5:30. Strawberry margarita was probably the worst I've ever had.

I'm a fan! I definitely wish that it was closer to home, because I find it hard to drive all the way to Summerlin for dinner.

I met some friends here for lunch prior to some shopping in Downtown Summerlin. It was our first time eating at Pancho's, although I had heard a lot of good things about the restaurant. We definitely enjoyed ourselves.

We started with guacamole, which I believe was around $7. Only thing is, it was a HUGE portion and we didn't even come close to finishing it. It was really good.

I ordered one of their combo meals (cheese enchilada and chile relleno), which came with rice and beans. Everything was fresh and tasty. We enjoyed their chips and salsa as well (probably too much). Our server was really friendly and I loved the decor. It reminded me of being home in San Diego and going down to Old Town to eat. I don't really think it's that overpriced, especially considering the portion sizes and the area.

I have to agree with most of the reviews. It's average at best and for a few reasons. 

We came on Friday night after trying to decide where to go. We had received a coupon (ha!) in the mail and thought really this is the only way to justify overpriced Mexican. 

The bar was really bright and they had a cover band  singing  80's/90's rock which was very odd. We opted not for the bar and sat in dining room. It's actually really pretty inside with palm trees, string lights,  fountains, and Spanish tile. 

The salsa was good. The guac is 14.95 which is a joke. We didn't receive it after ordering so we canceled it and saved ourselves 15bucks. The food was good enough and decent portions. Still hard to justify 20 bucks on menu items like quesadillas and burritos. 

Glad I gave it a try since I see it so often, it's close to home and I love Mexican. Prob would go back to try happy hour (maybe) but def not for regular priced entrees. With so many other great places in the area, it feels semi insulting to offer average food at such a high price point in an inauthentic atmosphere. Esp when there's Roberto's around the corner ;)

The worst Mexican food in Las Vegas.  The Wahoo Fish Tacos was not fresh.  The uses of flour tortillas was a disappointment instead of the corn tortillas.  The Sopes was also not great.  I am not a fan of beans and lettuces on Sopes.  Just made the whole dish soggy.  It also look like three mini Taco salads.  Just really did not stand out for me.  The prices did not fit the quality of the food.  The waiter and bus person were very attentive.  The restaurant was very beautiful.

Okay - I have to admit, it is a little pricey. But you also don't have drive all over town searching for anything more. 

Great Food, Bar (and Happy Hour), LIVE Music and Atmosphere.

If you're on a strict budget, probably not your first choice. But if you want a well rounded, Summerlin experience. Give it a try. All of the musicians we have seen, are well worth it.

I am writing this review feeling very disappointed. I was looking forward to this restaurant opening and hoping for really great, authentic ( or at least USA style authentic), Mexican food. The building is very nice and the server was very polite and attentive....other than that.....

We went early on a Thursday afternoon ( 4 PM) and the restaurant was not busy at this point. The hostess took us to what must be the worst table in the restaurant. It was in the back and near the kitchen door and  the server station. Normally, I would have objected and asked for another table, but this being our first time there, I wanted to see what else was in store. I am familiar with the concept of filling tables back to front, but this was a bit extreme based on the hour and the number of customers. It did give me a good view of part of the kitchen, which looked clean and well maintained. The server was at our table almost immediately and took our drink order. I ordered a traditional Margarita on the rocks. Hubby had a draft beer. The Margarita had a minimal amount of Tequila and was not at all remarkable in taste.Chips and salsa came to the table, and the salsa ,while a bit spicy , was lacking in any depth of flavor.
I decided to go with  a classic combo, beef taco and cheese enchilada and my husband ordered the Carne Asada Al La Ab. The combo, priced at $17.95,does not come with salad or soup. Unusual in my experience. My husband's entr√©e did get the soup or salad choice. The Carne Asada has Hanger steak and my husband was not asked how he liked it cooked, which I assume represents that it's already prepared. The entrees were delivered in a timely manner.
My entire plate was lackluster and had none of the savory deliciousness that I would expect from that plate. The shredded beef in the taco, the cheese enchilada and even the rice and beans were all very bland. My husband's Hanger steak tasted OK, it was medium well to well done...but had some taste to it. The other components on the plate were the same as mine.
Unfortunately, I see no reason to return to this place. The food is pricey for Mexican, which would be OK if it was really good, and it was, at best, just OK.

I'm giving Pancho's 5 stars for the overall experience. We enjoyed all of the food with just 2 exceptions. The complimentary corn chips were dense and hard. This could just be a matter of taste but I like them light and crispy. I asked for them to fry up some flower tortilla chips, which every other Mex restaurant I've asked to do that, does so with a smile. The waiter asked the kitchen and reported back that the flower tortillas were to thin. I had flower tortillas with my meal, they were normal tortillas, so, translation, I don't want to. And the guacamole was on the bland side. This is quite possibly the most expensive restaurant I've ever been to but when you read the last page of the menu, you discover why. I'm guessing a build out of well over a million. After dinner we went downstairs to have drinks and listen to a rock cover band, a much needed venue in DT Summerlin. We've said since DT Summerlin's opening that a music venue was sorely lacking. thanx Pancho's for filling the gap.

I'm not normally one to leave bad reviews, but we had an all around terrible experience. 

The waiter managed to get both of our orders completely wrong. However, not wanting to waste the food, my girlfriend accepted the incorrect taco plate after we discussed the issue with the waiter. 

Only problem was it was much more expensive than what she actually ordered, and the guy charged us for the more expensive plate. Wow.

I did not accept the wrong food, but was inexplicably charged for the more expensive combo he had originally brought me. Unbelievable. 

Then on top of that, the food was very mediocre. That's probably being kind. My enchiladas tasted like they were made with American cheese. 

We won't be back. Prices here are out of control considering you could go to Javier's for the same price and actually get some great food.
Just found this place. I feel like I'm in Mexico! Can't wait to try some more items. Gustavo, our waiter, was very patient and informative. Husband loved the albondigas!

So I hardly ever write reviews unless I'm extremely satisfied. I would have to say this is my first negative review and simply because I don't go out of my way to tell people how horrible they are. However this time I can't let this go without telling people. This is my second time coming to this restaurant. The first time I came here it was amazing. This time I can't say the same. One thing I will say is our server Carissa was amazing. She was so sweet and came to check on us several times. For the management I can't say the same. There was a older gentleman that would walk around and say hi to the tables and make sure everything is ok. The whole time we sat there he did not come up to us once. The tables around us, yes he did but seemed to just pass us by every time. I thought it was odd until I brought it up to the other two other people with me. They noticed the exact same thing. What did all these tables have in common? They were all white and so was the manager. There were two other  tables he did not go up to. Another table whom were Hispanic like us and a table with Asians. This manager will sit and chat with each table once or twice but yet never made it to our table or the other two tables. I'm sorry I hate to play the race card but I never experienced something like this in my whole life. A restaurant that serves Mexican food and they didn't even acknowledge not just us but two other tables. But the other 6 to 7 tables he could. Blows my mind.

Well... $18.00 for a carne asada burrito is a bit steep. My boyfriend and I had a 2 for 1 coupon and thank god we did.  These prices are ridiculous.  We ordered 2 margaritas and wish we hadn't. Food was okay. Nothing memorable. We sat in the bar area and our server ghosted us. We had to ask other people for refills and other things Etc. save your pesos.

Pancho's es fabuloso! The hostess greeted our group of four with cheer. My son was mesmerized with the suspended shark which decorates the 21 and older bar area, but were able to capture a photo of the two of them together. Our Sunday afternoon in Las Vegas, shopping in Downtown Summerlin, was thoroughly enjoyed with Mexican sumptuousness.

Miguel our server managed a magnificent job with us.  He split our order of an Ensalada de Camarones con Miel. The greens and jicama were fresh, cool and crispy.  The mango slices were sweet and abundant.  He recommended an accommodation to the Children's Menu for us when I requested a side order of one grilled chicken breast (similar to the chicken breast available for the salad).  He replaced the Chicken Tenders entr√©e with a marinated, grilled and cut chicken breast, with a side of pinto beans de la holla and rice (with a cilantro pesto). Children's Plates served with rice, beans, or fries children 12 years and under. 

The bean choice are the whole pinto bean cooked in a pot, black beans, or traditional refried beans.  Also, there are two types of rice of choice. Each of our meals were accompanied with a fresh, fruit bowl appetizer including watermelon, apple, pineapple and cantaloupe chunks. Crisp chips were paired with a red, zesty tomato salsa.  

There are several reasons for Pancho's to be a kid-friendly restaurant. The women's bathroom has a changing table. The d√©cor is festive and fun. Music plays lightly in the background and on designated evenings there is live music.  I am looking forward to mariachi music perhaps the middle of September!  A child's dinner includes a scoop of vanilla ice cream. Chocolate milk is a drink option.  

For Pancho's to gain one more star from me, I would like to see organic and free-range options on the menu.  Also, the emphasis on local produce would be a nice addition to community support.  And since I am always reaching for the stars, I would like to find a restaurant where patrons can watch tortilleros hard at work while enjoying an authentic Mexican meal.

My boyfriend and I came here on a Friday night.  Great Mexican food. This place has been open in Manhattan Beach for over 40 years and their first expansion is in Vegas by Downtown Summerlin. They're doing something right. We love the So Cal decor and lively vibe inside the restaurant. 

What I'm going to rave about are the margaritas. I love the use of fresh fruit! The flavor is so much better than the sugary product other establishments use for their blended cocktails. 

Jos√© and Ivan did a great job making sure our table was not left wanting. Very friendly staff overall. We will be back.

First time coming here and I must say, it's super nice! The staff were all so friendly, especially our waitress, Marta. The restaurant itself is beautiful with a lot of greenery. It feels like I'm inside a traditional Mexican home, eating traditional Mexican food. I'd definitely be back soon

This is like most of the average Mexican restaurants around town. They are so so, when we went there it was almost dead inside hardly anyone there, but yet the parking lot looked really busy. But it seemed like it took for ever to get our drink orders and then had to keep asking for chips and salsa to be refilled. We had a party of about 6-7 but they seemed like we were more of burden than dinner guests. I mean if you want to try them then you can but I dont think you will be really thrilled since there are much better places to eat.

We've been to Pancho's a couple times and they have both been pleasant visits. The servers are attentive and courteous, people continuously come by to pick up empty dishes and refill drinks. The food is totally delish. We have had both brunch and regular menu dishes and we always get to take some home since the plates are pretty big. We will come back for sure.
Very surprise of how wonderful this place is, highly recommend for family or a date Dinner. Food was tasty delicious, defiantly going back again.

Our first time having dinner at Pancho's restaurant @ Summerlin ... By far THE WORSE experience ever!!! Not just over price $$$$ , tortillas from a package not fresh, my tortillas from Costco are way better .. 2 managers on shift going around to every single table and greeting and asking guest, how was dinner ?.....But they skip our table all the time .. Don't know if they assumed we don't understand or spoke English? Maybe we were the only Mexican's having dinner in the restaurant??? I will never recommend to anyone !!

As the new Mexican restaurant on the block in Downtown Summerlin, I decided it was time to give Pancho's a try.
