Upon our arrival at night the restaurant was loud with live rock music from singers on a stage, but the decor was lovely hacienda style.  Guacamole in a metate with a tortilla chip base was real spicy, but there was a ton of it.   We waited a substantial time before anyone appeared to take our order, and then were first contacted by the manager, followed by the hostess, and finally our waiter.  Not too many chips were in the basket provided, so we had to request more; they were quickly supplied.  

I enjoyed a good Shredded Beef Taco and an ultra-cheesy Burrito Ranchero with shredded beef, but the interior of Diane's Quesadilla Del Mar (with shrimp) was made wrong, and it seemed to take forever to correct the error.  The lights in the kitchen went off before arrival of the correct version, and we thought the entire kitchen staff had gone home.  But not to worry--the belated replacement entree arrived at our table shortly thereafter, and was accurately prepared to order.

3-1/2 stars overall, but as others have noted, one can find better Mexican fare elsewhere in the city at a much lower price point.  So, it seems dining patrons are being charged extra for the fine special authentic hacienda ambiance.

Wonderful atmosphere. Very friendly staff. I was kind of put off by the price but then I saw the portions! You get what you pay for! Kids portions were huge! My kids could have split one dish  but I have to say that this was very good Mexican food and I would gladly come back again.

I like the food. It wasn't half bad and it was a huge portion. We sat in the bar because it was a 20 min wait on a table. Chips were good and so was the salsa. They had great food. Too many tables in bar area, and I wonder if they cut corners with this place. I saw a guy fall out of the bar stool because the top broke off. Kinda scared me because the stools make you sit high. And because of all the tables and stools it looked like he landed into some of the stuff. Over crowded.
They had many tvs playing all kinds of sports. Kinda quiet. Wish I had sat inside, it looked much more beautiful, and then maybe up stairs would be great.

So this place is super expensive.  If you want "blow your socks off" Mexican food then don't go to this place.  The restaurant does have a cool atmosphere, and I was super excited to try it but honestly I was disappointed in the food for the price.  Also guacamole for $15?! that better be made with avocados with gold in the center.  The margaritas were tasty but again I think I would rather stick to Macayos than frequent this place.

Really nice decor. Good California style Mexican food. Large portions and good quality.  The pork chile Verde burrito is large. Very spicy with great flavor and tender meat. The Carne Asada tacos are larger than street tacos and very filling. Make sure to try the original Margarita.

It's very rare for me to eat at a 3 star restaurant (yes, I am a food snob) but I will make an exception when it's a brand new restaurant.  I don't think it's fair to rush out to a brand new anything and expect it to be running like a well-oiled machine.  Everyone and everything is new and needs a little time to get acclimated as you do at a new job or at something you have never done.  I was willing to give them a chance and I'm glad I did.  I have been twice in the last week and both experiences were great.  The hostesses are warm and welcoming and get you seated fairly quickly.  I was able to make reservations which I always appreciate and they sat us before the entire party arrived which is a plus.  Both servers were attentive and got our orders correct.  The manager stopped by our table both times to make sure that all was well.  

My husband really likes the cadillac margarita and the fajitas.  The queso is very different (cream cheese, cheese and artichoke hearts) but was very good.  You can't skip dessert at a Mexican restaurant...Flan, Tres Leches and Fried Ice Cream...oh yes!!!

I need a new paragraph for this item, the Carne Asada Quesadilla.  Oh my word!!  It happened to be cheat day and a quesadilla sounded delicious but it's hard to find a good one.  I couldn't be happier that I ordered one here.  The tortilla was super fresh, perfection really.  The cheese was plentiful.  Then there is the carne asada, oh man!  If you are a fellow quesadilla snob you know that your quesadilla could come out with big chunks of beef, no thank you, or fatty pieces of meat, um no, or hardly any meat at all, no bueno!  However, Pancho's has got it right with perfect small strips of super juicy carne asada with perfect flavor.  Oh man was it good!  Cheat day + Pancho's Carne Asada Quesadilla = One happy girl!

The prices reflect location, it's Summerlin!  If you live in Summerlin you are use to paying a higher price tag and if you are driving from afar you must realize you are driving to Summerlin.

Best tasting authentic Mexican food. The chef is from Puebla Mexico and its evident in the dish selection. By far the most authentic taste outside of Mexico. We had the spicy margarita's and they were amazing, followed by the tortilla soup which is the best I've had in Vegas by far. I had the Mole Pipian and it was really well made and seasoned, the portion was big enough to have left overs for later. My wife had the Tinga Poblano and her dish was superb. And we finished the meal with a delicious flan. I would highly recommend this place.

Overpriced, under quality ingredients tasteless! Don't waste your money here !!! Horrible horrible food! 20 dollars for a basic ranchero shredded beef burrito which was barely warm.. Roberto's taco shop is even better than this place!

Honest review about the place. First problem, seated next to the door of the kitchen. The people had to walk in between 2 customers chairs to get in and out. They shouldn't have table at that spot. Overall they need to remove some tables from the place period!! Not comfy seating environment. The manager dropped a dirty fork on my friend's shoulder and didn't even apologize. We asked for a move, which took another 20 minutes because the host forgot about us. Finally they moved us to another table. The manager came smoozed with us after but he never acknowledged the fork incident. 

The food is mediocre, I ordered a $25 menu item which should've of been $11.99 at most places. It's very overpriced, these prices work for Manhattan Beach , CA for their original location, not Vegas. The food is bland and uninspiring, especially when we have amazing Mexican food here like Lindo, La Mojarra Loca...etc etc. To diners who love food, this is a skip!

Food -  OK (your basic unexciting standard restaurant Mexican  food)
Service - pretty good
Atmosphere  - pretty interior, well decorated

Price - WAY OVERPRICED 

Value - poor (find another restaurant)

The family and I went to Ponchos for dinner. I had heard that this place was good from co-workers. We walked in and were seated right away. The atmosphere seemed ok. Chips and salsa came out quickly. However, the salsa tasted like it came out of a jar, but the chips were good and the staff were constantly refilling it. The wife order the "Wahoo tacos" and I order the Enchilada de carnitas. The tacos tasted like frozen, over cooked fish, that they tried to cover up with bagged cabbage. So much so, that my wife sent it back, which never happens. The staff was understanding, apologetic and was willing to replace the meal. The enchilada de carnitas tasted ok, at best. The meat was tough, not tender or savory. My daughter order a kids meal quesadilla which was cold. Every meal on the menu was at least $20. This is place was disappointing. Two stars was pushing it in this review.

I love Poncho's! 

Poncho's is located in Downtown Summerlin (near Trader Joe's) and is a great place to enjoy a cocktail and meal. My boyfriend and I are at Poncho's quite often..... maybe more offers that we should be. ;) We love sitting at the bar, the bartender's are great! We always start with a house margarita- one with salt for my boyfriend and one with tajin for me, the chips are always warm and the salsa is great! Depending on our appetite and mood we will either share the steak fajitas which we always request medium rare and comes with tortillas and all the sides or a three item combo with a chicken taco, and two cheese enchiladas. The entrees are good sized, so depending on your appetite may be worth sharing.

They also have a happy hour daily and taco Tuesdays! I highly recommend Poncho's!

This has got to be the cutest Mexican restaurant with a real Spanish hacienda house feel!! The decor is beautiful and festive :) 

However, the food is PRICEY.  It's almost like paying Strip prices!! All entrees are approx $15+. 
Now, I get it....Mexican food is often marginalized and placed in the "cheap food" category, like most Chinese restaurants outside of the Strip and Chinatown.  If you're looking for a really great/fancy Mexican meal, you should probably be charged for it. But I argue that the price here does not match the food that is provided.  I ordered a chicken & mango salad and it was $18.  The salad was good, but not $18 good.  The salad portion was like the boxed greens from costco, and the mango was not very ripe. Chicken was juicy and had some great umami flavoring, but not overly impressed with the salad as a whole.  My friend ordered the fish tacos, which came in a cook fish-shaped plate! Also $18, and likewise not worth the price. 

Ultimately, Pancho's is a fun and festive restaurant but it's catering to the wrong crowd. If you have a cartoon character wearing a sombrero as your sign, you prob shouldn't be charging up to $20 for a meal.  Just sayin'. 

Would def recommend for a fun date night or bday. 
Service was friendly, but not the most efficient.

I'm surprised that this place is rated so mediocrely.  This is a great Mexican place in Summerlin!

They started the service with chips and salsa. The chips were crunchy and tasty and were paired with very fresh tasting salsa. It's also nice and spicy which we appreciated. 

The salad was so-so but a good option for those wanting a fresh start. If they could add a Mexican cheese, a bit of guacamole and a salsa verde instead of the regular vinaigrette that would make this dish even better. Ask for a salsa verde on the side. 

The tacos al pastor were very good. The meat is generous and marinated well so it was quite tasty. 

The taquitos are a must-order. Typically I stay away from taquitos because it is so oily and heavy. But these are not the oil-laden taquitos you get from the neighborhood restaurant. They are lightly fried and stuffed with well-seasoned meat. They were generous with toppings and came with an awesome salsa verde. 

But the best part of the night was the plate of carnitas enchiladas. The dish was deeply flavorful. There were so many layers of taste that came out that you can tell someone took great care to make this dish. The pork was so tasty but not overly seasoned as some carnitas can get. The garlic onion and cumin flavors are subtle enough to just bring out the pork flavor. The salsa cut the fatty taste of the pork in just the right way. The cheese and sour cream added heft to the dish. I loved it. The refried beans that came with the plate were not that glop of mush that you normally get in other restaurants. They were whole beans that had wonderful texture and taste. 

Lastly, the service was great - Fernando was our server and was very nice. He worked fast and never tried to push us to order anything. When we asked him for suggestions, he didn't push the most expensive dish on the menu and actually told us what he thought was really good. The manager, Doug made sure to go up to every table and ask how things were going. It helped round out a great dinner.
